review_body: Its in the center of town, near the "puerto del sol" square. And near everything worth seeing in madrid.Everything is 15 minutes walk away.The hotel has a fine maintenance and everything about it is great.For its prices, its a catch...Enjoy!
hotelName:
0    Hotel Francisco I
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Francisco is located on Calle de Arenal and a few blocks from Plaza Mayor and Puerta del Sol. There a restaurants and markets in the immediate vicinity. The hotel itself is stylish, the rooms are clean and well designed. Hotel staff was very helpful for any need and friendly, always greeting upon entering or leaving.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Francisco I
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel has a sleek and modern look for an older building.with a great location situated between the puerta del sol and the Opera. The staff could not have been more helpful and we would definitely stay here again on future trips to Madrid. Our room was on the top floor with a balcony and a view of Madrid. However the weather was cool and rainy during our visit so we were unable to use it. It should be noted that the hotel is on a pedestrian only street so it may be necessary to walk a half a block to get a taxi or uber. Shopping and restaurants are abundant within the blocks surrounding the hotel. The hotel is a great value and is highly recommended for a first time visitor to Madrid.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Francisco I
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel, is within walking distance of Puerto del Sol, Plaza Mayor, Mercado de San Miguel and other attractions. Good value with clean rooms and helpful staff. Plenty of restaurants nearby. I would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Francisco I
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just got back from a 3nt stay at Francisco 1, superb location, wonderful staff, spotless rooms and spacious. Couldn't ask for a better base to enjoy all that Madrid has to offer. Going back to Madrid next year and will definitely be staying here.Thanks for a delightful stay.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Francisco I
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was always a little surprised when we turned the corner to find our Hotel right there in the middle of a very active pedestrian street. Request a room on the third floor or higher if you have a balcony view of the street to make things a little quieter. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was spacious---for a European hotel. The staff was friendly. We did not sign up for the breakfast buffet, but there were all kinds of coffee and sandwich shops just outside our front door. A very pleasant stay.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Francisco I
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I wish I could give more than 5 stars. This is everything you look for in a hotel, great location, wonderful staff, clean, good beds, excellent breakfast. From the moment we checked in until 3 days later when we checked out, we were looked after. You can,t go wrong with this hotel
hotelName:
0    Hotel Francisco I
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel has an unbeatable location. It is at walking distance from la puerta del sol, la puerta de Alcalá, la gran vía.In addition to that the rooms are very modern and comfortable and the service is great. I would definitely come back if in Madrid.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Francisco I
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here with my son for a few days and it was perfect for our needs. Centrally located between Opera and Sol made it easy to get around. The hotel is well serviced with a lift which is great with luggage and is spotlessly clean, and cleaned every day. With your windows closed it is amazingly quiet and dark! And it is air conditioned too. Highly recommended - I’ve just booked another night on my way back through Madrid. Other places would be hard pushed to beat it!
hotelName:
0    Hotel Francisco I
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I normally get my first impression of the hotel when I send emails inquiring about booking. Their prompt replies and feedback to my queries already gave an insight that the way they deal with their patrons is very professional. In fact we ended up arriving late as we had a delay, and when I sent an email to inform the hotel, they replied to my email immediately. When we finally arrived after a three hour delay, we were warmly greeted by Yadian at the reception. He was so helpful going through various things and giving us tips not only on the day, but throughout the whole week we stayed there. Our room was on the top floor as I had requested, it was a nice spacious airy room, with a good sized bathroom and kitchenette . I was surprised how well insulated the rooms were as we did not hear any noise providing us with restful nights. The room was very spacious and immaculately clean as was the bathroom. I was surprised to say the truth with the items provided for example the hairdryer. Such a simple thing but personally I find it's a nightmare to blowdry my hair with the ones usually provided. Their attention to detail and needs of their guests left me quite astounded. Breakfast was delicious too and the staff were really nice. Also the terrace has a breathtaking view of the palace. It was a pity that we visited in December as it would have been nice to sit there and have a drink, but it was too cold in the evenings to stay for more than a few minutes. The hotel is equidistant to two metro stops - Plaza Espana and Principe Pio. This was another plus, apart from the fact of having bus stops just a few steps away from the hotel. Also it's a few metres away from the Royal Palace and walking distance to most of the sights.I would not like to mention names, as I don't want to leave out anyone, but all the staff are so friendly and professional in their approach. You are always greeted with a smile and very helpful in every way. Thanks to everyone for making our short break a memorable and relaxing one. Should we revisit Madrid, obviously we would not even consider looking around anywhere else.
hotelName:
1     ApartoSuites Jardines de Sabatini
49    ApartoSuites Jardines de Sabatini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have stayed There for 3 nights last month and we had a really nice stay. The staff is just as professional. The views are the best. Our apartment was a studio, but really nicely equipped. I will recommend this hotel to all guests
hotelName:
1     ApartoSuites Jardines de Sabatini
49    ApartoSuites Jardines de Sabatini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was an outstanding hotel choice for us. The location is great for anything you need in the central Madrid area but more importantly were the amazing suites with plenty of room and the most comfortable beds. The staff is very friendly and helpful. We really enjoyed the breakfast as well. Highly recommended!
hotelName:
1     ApartoSuites Jardines de Sabatini
49    ApartoSuites Jardines de Sabatini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is about 10 mins walk from Metro and 5 mins walk from the Palace. The staff at the hotel are friendly and helpful. The view from the rooftop terrace is beautiful. The included breakfast buffet is good too.
hotelName:
1     ApartoSuites Jardines de Sabatini
49    ApartoSuites Jardines de Sabatini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First of all, we made a stupid mistake and booked the hotel for the wrong nights! It was past those nights when we figured it out. They were kind enough to give us a small discount on the correct nights (we understand they had to charge us for the nights we screwed up). Everyone in this hotel bent over backwards to be helpful and pleasant. The room was amazing - large, clean, comfortable. Location provided lots to walk to in our short two night stay here.
hotelName:
1     ApartoSuites Jardines de Sabatini
49    ApartoSuites Jardines de Sabatini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: ApartoSuites was a great end to our two week trip. The suite felt like home. The rooftop was lovely, even though it was too chilly to hang around up there for too long. The front desk staff were all very helpful. We enjoyed the breakfast and appreciated the variety of food and beverage.
hotelName:
1     ApartoSuites Jardines de Sabatini
49    ApartoSuites Jardines de Sabatini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location, beautiful room with view on the Royal Palace and extremely nice and helpful staff made our stay in Madrid quite memorable. We liked the special deal on daily breakfast. We were also lucky to see our room upgraded to a suite...
hotelName:
1     ApartoSuites Jardines de Sabatini
49    ApartoSuites Jardines de Sabatini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very modern and beautifully decorated apartment hotel in the vicinity of the Royal Palace. All the mod cons, comfortable bed and sofa, well equipped kitchen, clean and spacious. Reception staff spoke English (not a common feature in Madrid), were very professional and helpful. Every request was attended to and every query answered. There is no restaurant for evening meals but they do provide a fantastic breakfast in a bright and cheerful hall downstairs. The hotel is a short walking distance from Sabatini Gardens, Royal Palace and local restaurants. Our only regret was not being able to extend our stay.
hotelName:
1     ApartoSuites Jardines de Sabatini
49    ApartoSuites Jardines de Sabatini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Variety of food and taste were very goodLocation very convenient ,Excellent viewRoom very cleanBottle of wine given good tasteFresh fruit good presentationPersonnel very professional,friendly and helpful
hotelName:
1     ApartoSuites Jardines de Sabatini
49    ApartoSuites Jardines de Sabatini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located within walking distance (even with luggage) from the airport, so even if you have an early departure/late arrival, there is no problem to get between the place and the airport. The hotel offers a shuttle service, but it runs until 2300 hrs, and fills up fast; it will be much quicker to walk than to wait for the next bus. Rooms are typical old-ibis-style, clean and ok, but they will soon need a refurbishment. If your flight is very delayed, be aware that the hotel may cancel your reservation due to no-show, and you will then need to discuss with the reception. Did not try breakfast, so will not comment on that. If you arrive by car, there may be an issue with finding a parking space close to the hotel.
hotelName:
2    Ibis Madrid Aeropuerto Barajas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived at 10 pm after traveling all day. Had made reservations long in advance on recommendation that Ibis hotels are high quality and reasonable. Had reserved double bed with extra bed as our son was traveling with us. He was needing to leave for a flight at 3 am. The front desk check in was very unpleasant with check in person unfriendly and told us our son would not be allowed in the room as he is in his 20s.--though my reservation was printed for double and extra bed. We asked if he could go to the room with us to repack his bag and take a shower and were told no, that only two people could go to the room. Our son returned to the airport to spend the night. In the room in the morning were small bugs on the floor. Hoping this experience is not truly the usual experience with Ibis.
hotelName:
2    Ibis Madrid Aeropuerto Barajas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very close to Barajas airport, so if you come late at night or have a morning flight, it's perfect because they offer free shuttle service to the airport. The hotel is good, rooms are nice and staff is polite.The breakfast is good also. It's not too far from Barajas metro station – about 10 minutes walk.So, it has all you need. All in all, my visit for 4 nights was very good and would go back.
hotelName:
2    Ibis Madrid Aeropuerto Barajas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a clean, efficient, no-frills hotel. If you are flying out of MAD and need a travel-friendly place with a free shuttle to the airport....this is the place for you. I recommend it and will be staying there again soon.
hotelName:
2    Ibis Madrid Aeropuerto Barajas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Checked in late and grabbed a quick meal at hotel's restaurant. Decent meal and a good night's sleep. Good bed and bedding. Good bathroom, shower, etc. Good breakfast in the morning. Convenient shuttle to the airport. Very good service from driver. Reasonable price. Would stay there again.
hotelName:
2    Ibis Madrid Aeropuerto Barajas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel ticked all boxes. It is close to Madrid hotel and has also free shuttle service. The staff are very efficient, friendly and fantastic. It has an excellent customer oriented mentality. The staff goes the extra mile to make sure guests are well served. To give an example on departure I had an early flight and there were far more people than places in their small van. Seeing this the receiptionist pro-actively counted the people waiting and asked which airport they are flying from. Then they got complimentary (shared) taxis so that nobody misses the flight. In general the staff has a very good human element when dealing with travellers.The rooms are also up to standard, clean and comfy. Well Done.
hotelName:
2    Ibis Madrid Aeropuerto Barajas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed there in spring for one night due to a connecting flight and had the possibility to visit Madrid and enjoy that nice Hotel.The rooms have the perfect size - there is everything you need.The staff was very courteous and helpful. When we left the hotel, they asked if we needed some help with reaching the airport.We could print out our boarding passes in the business center for the connecting flight. The breakfast was various and good.Some steps away from the hotel, you can catch the metro and reach the city center within some minutes. The Barajas area is very quiet and we felt safe there. Would stay there definitely again! A big thank you to the team.
hotelName:
2    Ibis Madrid Aeropuerto Barajas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for one night, after 28 hours of flights and travel. Clean basic rooms and comfortable bed. Breakfast was excellent.Free shuttle bus to and from the airport was efficient. Suited our needs perfectly.
hotelName:
2    Ibis Madrid Aeropuerto Barajas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Only stopped over one night and it was perfect, the hotel is very well run by the staff who all help each other to ensure the customers are looked after. The shuttle to and from the airport is efficient, the rooms are fine, decent bar area, didn’t use the restaurant, dined out as there is a good choice in the district.
hotelName:
2    Ibis Madrid Aeropuerto Barajas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean & adequate accommodation close to the main railway station. Walking distance from many attractions & great restaurants. Suggest try for a night or two and extend if meeting requirements.Madrid sure is worth a several day visit.
hotelName:
3    SLEEP'N Atocha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Cozy, good location, amazing personnel that makes you feel amongst family, this is a true discovery and a hidden jewel in Madrid center. Walking distance to everything worth seeing and doing. We used a meeting space with a great atmosphere that made a great difference in our start up.
hotelName:
3    SLEEP'N Atocha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is situated in the heart of Madrid, giving you easy access to Plaza del Sol by underground, bus or foot!Although it is evident that it is an old building, Sleep'n has tried its best to modernize this establishment (and achieving it!) providing spacious rooms, high-tech as integrated sound systems in the rooms (and Spotify recommendations) and modern bathrooms.This hotel is clean and feels secure.The rooftop doesn't offer the best view of Madrid but gives you a rather nice experience while you have breakfast or a drink.I have rebooked with them -as I go to Madrid for work every so often.
hotelName:
3    SLEEP'N Atocha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a very clean hotel, with the necessary amenities for a budget stay - hair dryer, shampoo, body gel. The shower is strong with good hot water. The room heating is excellent. You have the choice to open the room window if it becomes too stuffy. We just walked to the city centre (although it was at least about 20 minutes, it was enjoyable. we were tourists so we didn't mind).The breakfast spread was excellent for the price.It is quite easy to get to the hotel from the Atocha station if you start off at the right part of the Atocha train station (which is only about 200 metres away)- unfortunately the hotel gave us incomplete, then incorrect instructions. Follow this direction instead: Exit from the Atocha station building with the garden inside. Note that the Atocha station has two buildings. The exit (Salida) name is Emperador Carlos V. From this exit, if you look up, you will see the sign from across the building “Hotel Mediodia”. If you don’t see this sign you exited in the wrong place. There is a crossing directly in front, which you must cross. Then go straight to the laneway and turn right into the street (which is directly behind Hotel Mediodia). You will see about a few doors down on the left the Sleep N Atocha property.Possibly the negative to this property is that the room is on the small side. The reception area is also small and can become quite crowded when there are a few people checking in or waiting for turn to ask questions. I'd still come back to this hotel. This is definitely value for money, but book way ahead as the price I've noticed can double close to the date.
hotelName:
3    SLEEP'N Atocha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really great Vacation and place to stay super friendly and accommodating staff, free coffee after 11am cute little rooftop perfect for a few nights in the heart of Madrid. Can't say enough about location and cleanliness and perfect for 2 travelers. It had everything we needed and the shower was better than my shower at home and the soap smelled great too. Tons of room in the bathroom really unique space and close to Lavapies which happened to have a tapas festival going on when we arrived. So happy we chose Sleep N Atocha and close to the train station!! Will be recommending this to friends who travel to Madrid
hotelName:
3    SLEEP'N Atocha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice spot to rest my head. I was a little disappointed that they wouldn't let me check in early, but hey. That's the hotel biz. Rooftop bar is a nice idea, but it was dead at 8pm. Music a little too loud, and lighting too low- especially when I was the only patron! This ain't no disco. Comfy bed, hot shower. Pro tip: choose a room away from the echoic stairway.
hotelName:
3    SLEEP'N Atocha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here one night as it was close to the train station. The staff was lovely and the place was clean enough. That said it was basically a step up from a hostel, which I wouldn't have minded, but I paid more than $150 for the one night. For that amount of money it absolutely was not worth it. It had no frills. Not even a tissue box in the room. Not a single piece of furniture to put away anything, although being there one night it wasn't necessary for us. Also it was extremely noisy. If I paid half the price I would have given it three or four stars but not for this price.
hotelName:
3    SLEEP'N Atocha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location: I arrived by train to Madrid Chamartín. Jumped in the metro for 25 and was just a short walk from the metro station. Right next to the Museo Nacional Centro de Arte Reina Sofía. Was a dream location within walking distance of so many sights. Room: small but all I needed. Had some space to hang a few clothes. Lots of space under the bed for my suitcase and shoes. Tv with a couple of English channels. Great air con. Windows that open for fresh air. Comfy bed ✅ Amazing powerful shower ✅Blackout curtains ✅Breakfast was great. No longer served on a box (as mentioned before) bit in the roof top terrace. Lovely fresh food that friendly staff keep topped up. Cheese, meats, breads, pastries, fresh juice, eggs, cereal, yogurts, fruits and fresh coffee . A great little hotel I’d definitely stay again as was comfortable and one of the best locations. Staff are lovely and friendly too.
hotelName:
3    SLEEP'N Atocha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for 4 nights in an economy single room. The room was perfectly suitable for me with enough room to move around, an open handing area with enough hanging space for me and a very comfortable bed with a memory foam mattress. The bathroom was a good size for a small room with washbasin and a large shower. Luggage can be stored under the bed so it's out of the way. The room was also kept immaculately clean by the maids.The staff here are all very friendly and helpful and service minded.There is a buffet breakfast served in the rooftop breakfast room/bar. There is tea, coffee and orange juice, hot scrambled eggs and bacon, breads, pastries, cold meats and cheese, yogurt, cereals,fruit and preserves and a toaster to make your toast. You can also buy drinks and snacks which you pay for at reception.The hotel is in a great location. Easy to find, just come out of the front of Atocha train station and it is in a small street directly behind the Hotel Mediodia which you can easily spot as you exit the station. It's easy to reach the major attractions on foot - Reina Sofia 1 minute, Prado 10 -15 minutes, Retiro Park 15 minutes, Plaza De Cibeles 20-25 minutes, Plaza Mayor 25 - 30 minutes, Palacio Real 35 minutes. The Estacion D'Arte metro station is most convenient, you exit it at the front of the Hotel Mediodia. There are plenty of restaurants and bars in the immediate vicinity. I would most definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again in a heartbeat.
hotelName:
3    SLEEP'N Atocha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: wonderfull rooms and clean.Great breakfast and drinks all day long.Maybe a bit far away to the center of Madrid,but there was good bus and underground communication. Thax for a nice time at your hotel
hotelName:
4    Artiem Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I found the staff eager to assist in any way. The breakfast service was unsurpassed as well as the evening snack and beverages. The best in experience in Spain this season. I look forward to trying your other properties.
hotelName:
4    Artiem Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything is good , Free Drinks free food(Sandwiches, salad...), the rooms Are nice, the bed is great, its smell in every location in the hotel good , metro is 5-10 minutes to walk away. If you travel to Madrid use this hotel
hotelName:
4    Artiem Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a nice hotel with sweet perks like a complimentary soda, beer/wine refrigerator & "green room" with free snacks in the evening. Our room was nice & up-to-date & I appreciated the personal note & small boxes of candy left in the room. The only place this hotel fell short was the location. You are far away from the city center & have to walk quite a distance to the metro & then it takes a few different lines to get to all the sites. One evening we had reservations for a Flamenco show in the city center so I brought daytime clothing & then a backpack of evening clothing to change into because it was far & inconvenient to go back to our hotel to change. Our safe, also, didn't work & despite someone coming up to show us how to use it, it still didn't work which is frustrating/we needed a safe place to store our passports. The staff are very lovely, but I wouldn't likely stay here again purely based on location.
hotelName:
4    Artiem Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean, comfortable and big room. Kind and smiling staff. 24 hour all you can eat salad, fruit, drink and sweet buffet. It's really big advantage to get something to eat and drink. Easy check in and check out. And special thanks to their contribution for our anniversary. I also thank Juan at reception for his tips in Madrid. Artiem Madrid will be my first choice always.
hotelName:
4    Artiem Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 8.0Great visit overall! I would definitely stay here again! We plan to visit their other locations!!The room set up and bath was great! We enjoyed the rain shower!! The terrace was nice, the view not so much but I would've still enjoyed it all the same, providing the weather was a little warmer! Having the Green on the go was very nice!I would've liked to have lemon to go with my tea! I didn't like that there weren't any face towels automatically provided. We had to ask for them. On our last night, they didn't have any available or the gentleman didn't know where to locate them. It also would have been nice to have a microwave in the room to warm up food. We stayed in for a day and had to go down to have our food warmed. Although I truly appreciate them doing that, it was an inconvenience as well.
hotelName:
4    Artiem Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Artiem Madrid is an excellent choice and delivers on every aspect. The breakfast is the best that we had on our trip to Europe. The staff is friendly and the service is excellent. We will be back.
hotelName:
4    Artiem Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really nice hotel - must have been freshly renovated/modernized. Great helpful staff, relatively big room, cool relax/lounge area for all guests.What is not so great? Location - you'd need to walk ~5-7 minutes to the nearest metro station and to get to/from airport you need to change matero at least once.Oh... and the bathroom doors do not really provide much of privacy :)
hotelName:
4    Artiem Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel gets 5/5 on every aspect of assessment plus some.From their commitment to ecology to the value of what is offered. Fo example:Spotlessly clean; mattress is best; bathroom/ shower excellentFood and all the other extras a pleasant surprise; friendly, helpful staffTips: consider eating dinner in the green room (complimentary) it is that good
hotelName:
4    Artiem Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is centrally situated in a great area for walking around to great food and shopping spots. Close to El Corte Ingles too and for taking the metro (train). Heater wasn’t working but they brought a space heater which solved the issue.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Europa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Brilliant location, close to the heart of the city; lovely rooms, comfortable and clean; staff efficient and polite. I have been back several times and would not stay anywhere else. It's my home from home in beautiful Madrid.Hotel Europa es como una segunda casa en la hermosa cuidad de Madrid. !Hasta la proxima!
hotelName:
5    Hotel Europa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel staff at the front desk always tries to help but make sure that you and they are on the same page when getting tips, directions, or other information as some staff speaks better English than others. Overall very nice
hotelName:
5    Hotel Europa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall the service was very good. Breakfast was served in the café, and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was spacious and clean, plenty of room for three friends. The location was great, we were in the heart of Madrid, and a variety of shopping and restaurants at our doorstep. The hop on hop off bus was a great way to see the city, and afterwards we enjoyed walking through the botanical gardens, though there were lots of tourist attractions to see too.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Europa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great affordable place smack next to Puerta Del Sol. From the airport, a cab will cost a flat fee of 30 euros -at the time of writing. The entrance of hotel is pedestrian only but the cab can get you literally half a block away. A short walk (even with rollers on cobblestones) and it is no problem finding the hotel. Location is perfect for walking about 25 minutes to Prado and Reina Sofia. Cab and bus options available too. About 8 euro 10 minute cab ride to the Atocha train station for high speed trains. The plaza is crazy busy filled with people Friday and Saturday nights. Every one enjoys eating and drinking out. Rooms are comfortable and clean. The windows are double paned thick but one still hears the plaza at night. True for any hotel in the area. Nothing a pair of ear plugs can’t fix for a good nights sleep. Cafe downstairs - great for a breakfast cappuccino or a nightcap. Plenty of eating options nearby.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Europa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at Hotel Europa 5 nights in October. I found it's location excellent, being within walking or transit distance of all the sites I was interested in seeing, as well as restaurants and shopping. I did not try the cafe next door. I also found the staff excellent. All that I had contact with were very friendly and helpful. I also enjoyed the reception area with comfortable couches and chairs I used to watch people going by on the street.My room overlooked the outdoor dining and had a balcony. It was narrow but fine for one person. The glass slider to the bathroom was also fine for one person. As others have reported, the rooms would get warm during the day as the air conditioning had been changed to heating. When the sun went down I would open the windows, it it would cool down by the time I closed them and went to bed. I especially liked the comfort of the bed and the small frig for storing leftovers.To reach the hotel, from the airport, I took the Airport Shuttle to the Fuente de Cibeles and subway 2 stops to the front door. Returning to the airport, for a very early flight, I walked to the other side of Cibeles (10 minutes) and took the shuttle back.I would recommend this hotel and if returning to Madrid, I would stay there again.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Europa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good location, we arrived by train and took the subway to within a very short walking distance to the hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room size was okay and room and bathroom were clean.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Europa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic location - very central for shops and attractions. A great place to stay. Very nice rooms. Very clean. And even though it's right in the centre of the city it was surprisingly quiet. The staff were helpful.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Europa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Definite recommend staying here. Super close to metro and Plaza Sol. Staff were very helpful. There is a cafe there too, but we didn't try it. Shut wooden shutters in room when sleeping because of some noise from the plaza.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Europa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is excellent. Service was great. They went out of their way to accommodate us. Will definitely stay again. The bar was lively and was open late. The neighborhood was quite with lot of good restaurants.
hotelName:
6    Only YOU Boutique Hotel Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is one of the most stylish hotels I have ever seen. Attention to detail is first class. The public rooms and facilities are excellent, with lovely details everywhere you look. During the visit most of the staff were wonderful, and went out of their way to be helpful. Some of the staff were a little bit carried away with themselves, maybe trying too hard, maybe focussing on the wrong things occasionally, but not enough to spoil the overall experience. I hope to return.
hotelName:
6    Only YOU Boutique Hotel Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay at the Only You hotel was amazing! From the kindness of the staff to the beauty of the hotel during the holidays it was a wonderful stay. I search long and hard to pick this hotel and there wasn't an ounce of disappointment. The room was nice and quiet. The bed was very comfortable. Thanks for everything
hotelName:
6    Only YOU Boutique Hotel Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing hotel in great location. Excellent service, very clean, delicious food. The room was very clean and comfortable The stuff was so helpfulI am sure we’ll come again very soon The hotel interior design is amazing And I really recommend this hotel
hotelName:
6    Only YOU Boutique Hotel Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Only YOU Boutique hotel, which was perfectly located in the heart of the city, walking distance everywhere. Everyone on the staff understands what truly makes a pleasurable experience for guests. Everyone we encountered was incredibly friendly and went out of their way to help, assist and direct. Everything we needed was easy, from restaurant and attraction recommendations to storing luggage for a week between flights. The rooms are nice and clean. We stayed for four nights and then flew to another city for 6 nights and came back to Only YOU Boutique for an additional night before going back home. When we checked out after the four nights and they asked us how our stay was we told them we were happy with everything other than it was a little noisy in the room we stayed in. They made sure to note that on the reservation and when we came back for the additional night at the end of the trip they upgraded our room, which was very nice of them. Highly recommend, especially given the reasonable price.
hotelName:
6    Only YOU Boutique Hotel Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed here for only one night but really enjoyed our stay. The hotel is next to both the main train station and a metro stop so it is very easy to get there. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly and there were several people around to help us whenever we had questions. Our room was spotless and very comfortable. This place is great and we would gladly stay here again. A very fun hotel.
hotelName:
6    Only YOU Boutique Hotel Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights and loved the whole feel of the hotel which is located in a great area with lots of bars and cafes but also only a 15 minute walk to main centre. Andrei and the bar team were brilliant extra helpful as were lobby staff - absolutely top drawer!
hotelName:
6    Only YOU Boutique Hotel Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It’s was An amazing experience The service of the hotel was very kind and satisfying we got the best !!!!! service from from juls Guerrero she She was very kind and professional I highly recommend the hotel..
hotelName:
6    Only YOU Boutique Hotel Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stunning Hotel in the heart of Madrid. Excellent customer service. Every single person who work there has been kind all the time. I will definitely go back next time I'm town and I highly advise to stay there.
hotelName:
6    Only YOU Boutique Hotel Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice room: comfortable bed, clean, awesome shower, reasonable prices of minibar, good wifi.Regular and reliable transportation to/from airport included in the price for the room.Quick check in/out and very nice and helpful staff.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Nuevo Boston
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My stay there was a rather bad experience. In the shower the water warmed up slowly/one day it was not even hot just warm. There were no vegetables for breakfast. The receptionist was not nice, he argued with me because I was half laying on the on the couch but did not care that the whole lobby smellt like cigarettes because others were smoking right next to the door.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Nuevo Boston
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was close to the airport, had a free shuttle and the room was modern and clean. The restaurant had good food and drinks and the staff were friendly and knowledgeable. We will definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Nuevo Boston
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 3 nights whilst visiting an exhibition at IFEMA. Rooms comfortable and clean. Hotel provides a free shuttle to airport and IFEMA. Nearest metro station is a walk followed bus ride away which is not that convenient for exploring Madrid. 3 prices for breakfast we discovered on our second morning - not explained earlier. Dinner was a buffet with good choice but no vegetarian/vegan main dishes and everything luke warm even the soup which had just come out of the kitchen. Room came with a 10% voucher for use in restaurant- can only be used at dinner (not explained) and has be given to the waiter at the time not when paying the bill at the end of the stay. So stay could have been improved with more information.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Nuevo Boston
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Near the airport, outside the center of Madrid with the advantages and disadvantages that this entails.Housed in an industrial / housing neighborhood with few shops and restaurants nearby.Easy access to main roads.Free airport shuttle
hotelName:
7    Hotel Nuevo Boston
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff are very unprofessional and very rude. Choose another hotel for staying near the airport before a flight- the value here is not worth it. WiFi in room is very weak and disconnects intermittently.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Nuevo Boston
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is very close to the airport and very close to a big huge shopping mall, about 5-7 minutes walking distance. The mall has everything as well as good restaurants. I discovered Primark Store and I did my last minute Christmas shopping there.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Nuevo Boston
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Bice room, unfortunately I was traveling for work, I only slept a few hours between two flight. The Hotel looks like nice and the personal is kind and professional. The shuttle from and to the airport is very useful.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Nuevo Boston
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a very convenient hotel to the airport. A van will pick you up at the airport and will bring you back. Check-in to the hotel was very efficient. The rooms were very nice. The menu at the restaurant was very accommodating, i.e., we were able to find food that was very good although we arrived late.The staff was very friendly and helpful.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Nuevo Boston
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is at the heart of Madrid and is within walking distance to almost everything you would want to visit. We hardly had to use any public tansport.Their unique selling point is the fact that they are environment friendly and do not use single use plastic. We were very impressed with this. The kitchen is a nice addition with an excellent coffee machine, kettle, microwave sofa, dining table and TV. They also separate their waste for recycling. The kitchen is accessible 24 hours a day.The hotel is clean with large comfortable beds. Staff are friendly and approachable. They also give you a goody bag with fresh pastry, muffins and a paper bottle of water everyday- which was very handy for us.Our balcony was on the 5th floor and we got a great view of Puerta del Sol. However, it got noisy at night, so you may want to use the earplugs provided if your room is on the front side.
hotelName:
8     B&B Hotel Madrid Centro Puerta del Sol
50    B&B Hotel Madrid Centro Puerta del Sol
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic location at the edge of Puerta del Sol. Spacious, immaculately clean and thoughtfully accessorised rooms. A special mention for the excellent rain shower. Very quiet despite the hotel’s busy location. Highly value additive common room in the basement with good coffee. Strongly recommend for anyone seeking to stay in central Madrid.
hotelName:
8     B&B Hotel Madrid Centro Puerta del Sol
50    B&B Hotel Madrid Centro Puerta del Sol
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've been to madrid many times and have never gone back to the same hotel twice - but I will definitely be goign back to this hotel. It is clean, modern and quiet even though it could not be more central. The room we had was huge and the bathroom is excellent. There is a communal kitchen where you get drinks all day and in the mornign they hang a wee bag of pastries on yrou door for breakfast. To top it all there is a great rooftop terrace bar and restaurant - its expensive but you get a great view over the rooftops as you watch the sun go down.
hotelName:
8     B&B Hotel Madrid Centro Puerta del Sol
50    B&B Hotel Madrid Centro Puerta del Sol
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I just spent 5 nights in this hotel along with my family; we had two spacious rooms on the 5th floor. From the outside maybe one would not think much of it but the stay here is very comfortable. Security is awesome as the main doors and the lift both require key card access.Check-in is a breeze and we were up to our rooms in no time. Our room comes with a king size bed. Room amenities are as per usual. It’s clean and very comfortable. Even their bathrooms have a 4-star hotel feel to it.The hotel is a real gem, well priced and located near to everything you could want to visit in this interesting city.Puerta del sol is a minutes’ walk from the hotel and is always buzzing with activity. So is the Metro and it is the best way of getting around Madrid. Avail of the T10 card (very economical and one card can be used by all members of your family) which can also be used on the bus.The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful; it feels a little like staying with family as they greet you with a smile as you return from a day wandering in the streets of Madrid.The hotel has some lovely features on offer. The basement cafeteria is open 24/7 where you can enjoy fresh fruits, juices, tea, coffee and cookies all day long.Stay at the B&B Hotel Madrid Centro Puerta del Sol, you will not be disappointedMany thanks to the staff there for a wonderful stay. I would gladly recommend this place to others.
hotelName:
8     B&B Hotel Madrid Centro Puerta del Sol
50    B&B Hotel Madrid Centro Puerta del Sol
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. It is in a very central area and is close to metro and busses. The hotel is very clean and the staff courteous and polite. We had a private balcony room overlooking a busy street. The balcony has a table, chair and egg chair and is a nice place to relax or admire the views over the rooftops. There is a lot of foot traffic on the street till the early hours but it wasn't enough to stop us from sleeping. The hotel also comes with a communal kitchen which is available 24/7 and provides coffee from a coffee machine, tea, juices, water, fresh fruit, a microwave and ice etc. It is a very welcome free service. There is a free breakfast pack left at the door each morning which contains croissants, muffins and water. The bed is huge and very comfortable and the shower has a rainwater shower head, great pressure and easy to regulate temperature. There is free parking at the rear of the hotel and free reliable wi-fi. We would stay here again and would recommend to family and friends.
hotelName:
8     B&B Hotel Madrid Centro Puerta del Sol
50    B&B Hotel Madrid Centro Puerta del Sol
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect location just steps from plaza mayor and nearby puerta del sol—single room with single bed was small but more than adequate for a two night stay; priced at 50€/night for a limited budget;Free coffee and rolls and fruit available 24 hours a day Excellent reception service
hotelName:
8     B&B Hotel Madrid Centro Puerta del Sol
50    B&B Hotel Madrid Centro Puerta del Sol
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a very cool, very Central hotel albeit hard to find at first. It's tucked away to the side of a noodle bar. It clean and modern. There is a communal area which provides coffees fruit and biscuit's. The hotel provides a breakfast bag served to you door every morning with a pastry and water. The roof bar is a must it takes you out of the city buzz to a beautiful view.
hotelName:
8     B&B Hotel Madrid Centro Puerta del Sol
50    B&B Hotel Madrid Centro Puerta del Sol
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The only problem was the cab couldn’t get to the front door. He was able to get us very close, but we had to walk a busy, narrow street about a block, no big deal. The rooms are clean. The staff friendly and helpful. The coffee bar with fresh fruit in the basement was nice too. Didn’t realize how important having air conditioning in the room was until now, bit it is a must and worked great. We would definitely stay here again!
hotelName:
8     B&B Hotel Madrid Centro Puerta del Sol
50    B&B Hotel Madrid Centro Puerta del Sol
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Actually a very decent room and a rather good roof top bar makes this centrally located hotel work well. It was a bit too low key / low staff for me and my breakfast hanging on my door handle in the morning is not my style but in terms of location, quality and value for money I could not knock it. But not for me.
hotelName:
8     B&B Hotel Madrid Centro Puerta del Sol
50    B&B Hotel Madrid Centro Puerta del Sol
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The IBIS CENTRO is a perfect place to emerge in the life of the locals in Madrid. Attached to the Bilbao Metro station you can easily enlarge the radius to discover all over Madrid. The nearby Restaurants offer typical Spanish food and life style. Just suitable to explore ...
hotelName:
9    Ibis Madrid Centro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Younger people would enjoy this hotel - good price, basic bed, shower, good location. One step up from a hostel, privacy. But if you like nice beds, bath tubs, nicely appointed rooms and a fridge, you’re not going to enjoy this Ibis. The decor is saggy, thin orange curtains and light brown. The elevator from the street to check in fits one person with a suitcase, so it takes awhile. The breakfast is limited to a small corner with little variety. It’s OK if you’re young and filled with excitement. Older and spoiled? Not so much. The people at the desk were friendly and helpful.
hotelName:
9    Ibis Madrid Centro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really enjoyed the neighborhood and found it easy to walk to the sites. The room was quite warm and didn’t allow changing thermostat. Had to open windows to noisy street for air. The beds were comfortable.
hotelName:
9    Ibis Madrid Centro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Ibis Centro is in a good location, a 2-3mins walk from the nearest metro Bilbao. For good walkers, you can reach sol in 20mins.There are many food options around the area and a supermarket nearby.Room is basic but comfortable. Love their bed and pillows!Staff were all pleasant and helpful.The only downside I can think of is perhaps the breakfast which does not have hot food. Variety is however sufficient in my opinion.Overall, we enjoy our 4 nights stay and highly recommend it!
hotelName:
9    Ibis Madrid Centro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Dropping our bags off before check in was chaotic partly due to disorganisation, lack of staff and too many people but check in went more smoothly and the staff are very helpful.The room was basic but functional and clean. This hotel is perfect for sightseeing as it is a one minute walk to Bilbao Metro. We used a two day metro tourist card to travel all over the city.We left our bag again after check out and returned to pick it up before catching a train back to Ávila.
hotelName:
9    Ibis Madrid Centro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel has an excellent location with close metro stop. Points of attraction easy to access. The area was also full of restaurants nearby. As regards the hotel it was as usual a good ibis clean hotel and breakfast having a vast choice. Would highly recommend.
hotelName:
9    Ibis Madrid Centro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is anything but at center of the city. We had two days in Madrid and were looking to stay near the city center. Good place to stay, standard Ibis rooms.The staff did not have the check-in kit ready which we get as accor le club status. The staff also forgot to give the welcome drink vouchers.
hotelName:
9    Ibis Madrid Centro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When I first looked up this hotel, I saw the reviews were excellent, but it was considered a "2-star" hotel, so that gave me a little doubt about what to expect. I was totally blown away. The hotel is great and perfect for my 10 night business/vacation trip. The staff was the most friendly that I've ever seen at any hotel. I'm a native English speaker but can speak Spanish on a B2 level. None of that really mattered. Most, if not all, of them spoke fluent English, French, and Spanish. One even spoke Portuguese. I arrived early and was able to drop my luggage off in a secure area while my room was being prepared and while I explored the city. The breakfast buffet was great and they even have a tapas bar for dinner if you'd rather stay in. The neighborhood (Malasaña) was super convenient to everything whether you want to walk or ride the metro (Bilbao station minutes away). The wifi was great and I was able to work in the room except for the times they were cleaning it. I will definitely stay here the next time I go to Madrid.
hotelName:
9    Ibis Madrid Centro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff is very friendly and helpful. They offer good advice and speak excellent English. The beds are comfortable and the rooms are quiet. The hotel is located very close to the Bilbao metro station which makes it easy to get places. However, the facility seems very "tired" and the rooms are small. It would have been nice to have had a hot pot in the room to make coffee or tea. The breakfast was okay but did not have any hot foods. Overall, I didn't feel that the hotel was as nice as was advertised. There is an elevator.
hotelName:
9    Ibis Madrid Centro
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great place to stay, the staff are always so friendly and the food they offer is great value. I like the room as they are well equipped always clean and the WIFI is easy and good. The location of the hotel is very central and easy to get to.
hotelName:
10    ibis Madrid Calle Alcala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is perfectly situated " minutes walk from the metro station, which is on the same line to get you to the bus to and from the airport, very convenient. Roughly 25 minutes to the centre of Madrid. The hotel itself had all we needed, very clean room, cleaned daily. Friendly helpful reception staff. Worth the breakfast in the morning everything you needed, hot drinks, fresh juice, fresh fruit, breads, cheese, ham and more. Would certainly recommend this hotel>
hotelName:
10    ibis Madrid Calle Alcala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent inexpensive hotel, good value for money.We have stayed there a few days in our trip around Spain and I can recommend it for a short stay.I would highlight the mattress, extremley comfortable.
hotelName:
10    ibis Madrid Calle Alcala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed only one night in Madrid for business. The hotel was nice and clean a good price performance ratio. However it was very inconvenient to wait so long at the check in. So for business people in a hurry, not a good solution. The day after I left at 4.00 am in the morning and checkout was no issue then.
hotelName:
10    ibis Madrid Calle Alcala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very friendly & co-operative staff, always at hand to help out even during late hours.I experienced both Ibis styles & Mercury in Madrid but found this property cozy & decided to extend my stay for a day. Would recommend this to anyone on a business trip in Madrid.
hotelName:
10    ibis Madrid Calle Alcala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Only 200m to The Metro station, this hotel is situated in the suburbs of Madrid. The Smile Team made our stay hospitable & pleasant. While our focus was on visiting the City we both enjoyed catching the Metro "home" each evening and experiencing thd lifestyle of quieter areas shere residents lived
hotelName:
10    ibis Madrid Calle Alcala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Although being Accor Platinum Member and used to some bad Ibis hotels this one casts a new light on the word bad and accor. It is unbelievable how practically a youth hostal can be called a hotel, (and even get such good ratings (where do these people stay normally, in tents or caves?), and still charge 90us for a room I wouldn’t even accommodate my worst enemy in.No idea where to start. First I get a more than unwelcome reception by a terrible employee called Marta, more unprofessional impossible. She will get a special mention on my next meeting with regional Accor Board in Ontario,Ca (Hope they can get after someone even when it’s not North America, who should rather be employed in a prison compound)then you get practically a bed with a 1m2 shower, a plastic cup and neither a wardrobe,nor a fridge,nor a safety box,nor any Coffee maker. Not even one drawer and the whole lobby being torn apart for renovations. Any decent hotel would be closed, not this one, of course not.Back to the luxury rooms : Not even a toothbrush or anything. Only a gulag appropriate soap dispenser and a small bathing towel, no others ! Nothing for the hands or face.Not even welcome amenities for Platinum members. Wow...and I complained cookies in Hongkong and thought that was cheap,lolFor 30 us bearable, for 100 an outright fraud, no other word for this. This was my second and last ibis in Europe. I couldn’t believe how bad and miserable an ibis can be. I will never again complain about the ones in Asia after this. Wow ....A pity it’s not possible to leave negative points ,this would be an ideal canditdate. Stay far,far away from this place.The fun thing, not joking. The construction was so bad, when someone normally was shutting the door to the hallway your bed was shaking . REALLY NOT MAKING IT UP! For me it doesn’t matter, I travel a lot to Spain ,but if this is your first time, do yourself a favor and get a decent hotel. The only practical thing was the metro stop Suanzes, Line 5. A tip. If you are on a budget but don’t want to spoil your holidays, move half a mile south to Ilunion Alcala Norte, it costs maybe 20 us more but you get a solid 4 star hotel, not this ridiculous ibis.I really felt unwelcome.... They think they can get away with it because normal travelers aren’t very demanding or wouldn’t bother to report them, well I will. Good Riddance.okay never again. Learn from it and enjoy Spain.
hotelName:
10    ibis Madrid Calle Alcala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is ok if u r going to use it for sleep only...the room is clean but very very small...the toilet is also clean and small...the location is not bad near a metro station 2 mins walk...the staff are nice and friendly..its a basic hotel to sleep only..
hotelName:
10    ibis Madrid Calle Alcala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Recently stayed here for the weekend. Hotel was very clean, staff very friendly and had everything what we needed. The bar area was nice. Great value for money and easy to find. The continental breakfast was very nice. We will definitely be staying again.
hotelName:
10    ibis Madrid Calle Alcala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful in every way. The staff really cares and the gummies are a nice touch!!! Location was outstanding and the cleanliness of the rooms was amazing!! I would definitely recommend this property for both business and leisure!!!
hotelName:
11    Barcelo Torre de Madrid
68    Barcelo Torre de Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great service, nice and cozy rooms, the breakfast is good but I'll suggest you'll skip dinner. The location is close to all the shopping centers and restaurants. It was the second time I visited Madrid and that hotel was way better than other 5 stars hotel.
hotelName:
11    Barcelo Torre de Madrid
68    Barcelo Torre de Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Always enjoy staying here, great staff clean and comfortable rooms and close proximity to most everything in the city. My colleagues always enjoy happy hour at the bar to start the evening before heading out to dine and enjoy the offerings of the city.
hotelName:
11    Barcelo Torre de Madrid
68    Barcelo Torre de Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When we arrived at the hotel via taxi, we were met and greeted by one of the employees. He immediately took our bags and directed us to the check in area located on the second floor. We were greeted and provided water as we completed the check in process. The service provided was excellent. Our room was surprisingly spacious. Robes and slippers were provided as well as great toiletries. The room was well kept and very clean. We did not take advantage of the breakfast at the hotel and kind of regretted it. Good breakfast locations were hard to come by and after all was said and done it cost us as much without a decent selection. Something to think about!Hotel location was also great. We were able to walk to all the points of interest. The concierge at the hotel was extremely helpful with information regarding points of interest and restaurants. We were very pleased with our entire experience at Barceló Torre de Madrid. We highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
11    Barcelo Torre de Madrid
68    Barcelo Torre de Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Extremely luxurious hotel in the centre of madrid.Pro's....Good size room. Very modern hotel. Welcome at public relations very good. Location brilliant. Rain effect shower lovely. Breakfast very good with great range. Customer service very efficient. Cons...Slight issue with some of the foreign channels on the tv which for a deluxe room is disappointing. Could be a internet issue. Slight noise but to be expected. Also don't think it's a hugely fun environment a bit like being in a art gallery afraid to touch anything.
hotelName:
11    Barcelo Torre de Madrid
68    Barcelo Torre de Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We've just returned from a three night stay at the Barcelo Torre and it was lovely, we were welcomed as soon as we arrived with a water and alcoholic shot and all the staff were very helpful. The room was lovely, a decent size, a big bathroom with a walk in shower and bath, and then an even bigger bed. We sadly didn't get the opportunity to eat at the hotel but there are many wonderful restaurants nearby. The bar was really good at the hotel and the cocktails were amazing!!!!Great location, and everything was great - I'd definitely recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
11    Barcelo Torre de Madrid
68    Barcelo Torre de Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a wonderful hotel with perfect service in every area. The first nice touch was being offered glasses of water as we were checking in. A simple touch, but welcomed after two flights. Room was large, bathroom was very large with huge walk-in shower, deep soaking tub, plush towels, etc. Everything you could ask for! Bed was comfortable with a full menu of pillow options. Breakfast was fantastic with absolutely anything you could imagine wanting from omelettes made to order to platters of hams, smoked salmon, a large variety of yogurts, fresh breads, fruit, cheese, danish, cakes, churros. It goes on and on and everything is available in a bright, contemporary lovely room with large windows.From the concierge to the cleaning staff everyone was accommodating. There's even a gym and lap pool. Sadly the Plaza di Espana is being renovated so we didn't have a view of that, but we did look straight up the Gran Via which was lovely. Convenient location added to the stay. Would come back in a minute and are looking to stay at another Barcelo hotel soon.
hotelName:
11    Barcelo Torre de Madrid
68    Barcelo Torre de Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very pleasant stay at Barcelo Torre de Madrid. Just off Plaza de España/ Gran Via in a historic building everything there great excellent breakfast pool staff gym comfortable bed great waterfall shower spacious room
hotelName:
11    Barcelo Torre de Madrid
68    Barcelo Torre de Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: An extremely well located hotel with very friendly and efficient staff. The concierge(tall lady) was incredibly well informed and helpful. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. The buffet breakfast is high quality and comparable with other top class hotels.On balance, an enjoyable stay thanks to the wonderful staff.
hotelName:
11    Barcelo Torre de Madrid
68    Barcelo Torre de Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The only good thing about this hotel is its location which allows you to stay not too far away from some of the city’s attractions. But you can easily find a much better hotel much closer to the city center. The stuff is ridiculously unhelpful. At the reception they can’t even provide you with the basic information about the city. Every hotel with the status like this should book the restaurant for its customers if asked to. Not only they didn’t do this, but they didn’t even tell us where we can go to have a dinner. The rooms are always dirty. The towels smell bad and the bedsheets look like they’ve never been washed before (the picture is attached). Even though my room was cleaned every morning, I had to call the cleaning service every evening and closely monitor them change my bedsheets because otherwise I’d have to sleep in dirt. The rooms themselves are really small and the walls are very thin. Every night I had to listen to all the noise from the streets. Impossible to sleep. And it’s always cold in the room. The shower is hard to use. The pressure is too heavy. The shower doesn’t close so the bathroom floor was always wet. The food at the breakfast is not good either. I liked the fresh juice but all the food was bad. Everything was always cold even the things that are impossible to eat cold. The fruits and the vegetables were too soft and tasteless. Don’t ever come to this hotel if you respect yourself.
hotelName:
12    Novotel Madrid Center
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First of all, thank you for allowing us to check in earlier than standard checking in time. However, front office staff especially from male staff need to practice smiling as basic practice for hospitality business. I booked my room through third party online booking channel which it took time for my booking to be found and my family name was written wrongly on the key card holder. Without smiling and not paying attention in details, it made me feel like I walked into factory rather than hotel. This not smiling included staff who is in charge baggage room as well.
hotelName:
12    Novotel Madrid Center
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here one night prior to flying out and had a good experience.Our rooms felt a bit small but were well furnished. There is a small refrigerator in the room that thankfully was not filled with mini-bar items like other hotels. Instead, it had two complementary bottles of water. The bathroom felt modern and had good amenities. There was only a shower, no tub. However, the shower lacked a door and the glass panel that’s supposed to keep water from splashing into the rest of the bathroom was not big enough. This was especially the case when using the overhead nozzle resulting in water getting into the rest of the bathroom. The TV in the room was quite big and had a good selection of international channels. The hotel buffet was very good. Both for dinner and breakfast, there was a good selection of choices. Items though were more generic in style rather than having any Spanish feel to the cuisine. There was ample and spacious seating. The hotel is located in the heart of Madrid and major attractions are accessible by taxi. There is a taxi stand by the hotel. There is a supermarket (La Plaza de Dia) a short walk away with many stores and restaurants close by. There is also an El Corte Ingles department store that you can walk to in under 10 minutes. Most of the staff spoke English and were both helpful and friendly.
hotelName:
12    Novotel Madrid Center
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a 600+ delegate conference in this hotel. It maxed out the hotel's service capacity. There are many areas for improvement. What delegates will remember are long lines for coat checks and strange odors. Happy to discuss with management if there is interest.
hotelName:
12    Novotel Madrid Center
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Reception was very good. The gentleman at reception was very polite and attentive. Answered all our questions and upgraded our room. Offered complimentary drinks while we were waiting for our room to be ready as we arrived early. Location was excellent near restaurants, shops and metro. we would stay there if we visit Madrid again.
hotelName:
12    Novotel Madrid Center
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I want to elogiat . the very good services in the hotel .well come greite.in the desk of reception was Yuri from i receive a huge service.I travel a lot.but never in the word I didn't receive so special relation and service.well done to Yuri.The hotel clean and cloth to the Retiro park
hotelName:
12    Novotel Madrid Center
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall good stayPros: Good breakfastGood roomFew of the reception staff are nice and very helpfulFood at hotel restaurant is limited but tastyCons:Ventilation to the rooms is horrible...need more light into the roomCouple of people from reception staff (remaining staff is good) are justifying the issues instead of fixing them
hotelName:
12    Novotel Madrid Center
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is a bit outside from the center, but easy to go around via the metro. The area is quite pleasant with many restaurants as well, all quite genuine and not touristic. People working there are really kind and helpful. Rooms are big and modern and clean, with really nice bathrooms. Finally the breakfast was also really good. I would indeed come back.
hotelName:
12    Novotel Madrid Center
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: They actually did a nice job with the renovation of this hotel, the lobby and rooms are modern and comfy, but the building is like a prison, there area no windows in the whole lobby/bar/restaurant area (apart from the courtyard entrance door), and the windows in the rooms are tiny.Both the lobby restaurant and the breakfast restaurant are very open and noisy, and lacks coziness, not a place you want to spend any time (also no daylight coming in).Then there is the breakfast, it is just hard to believe how such a big hotel can serve soggy and running scrambled eggs and soft bacon, I have news for you, "NO-ONE LIKES TO EAT THIS", If you do something then do it right, this is just too lazy.Also, it gets very busy in the morning, so one has to line of for the coffee and tea constantly. HONESTLY how hard can it be??Want to see how it is done correctly? Then visit the Novotel in Amsterdam city.The gym is not bad but lacking music or a TV to watch news, there is indeed a couple of speakers on the wall, but with wires hanging out I doubt that they actually work.On the positive side then the location is not bad, not exactly city center, but close enough...
hotelName:
12    Novotel Madrid Center
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I wanted a place in Madrid that made us feel like home, the Hospedaje Romero exceeded our wishes! The building is old world elegant, complete with a wrought iron cage elevator located in the middle of the heart of Madrid. We walked everywhere. The owners, Charo and her son Raul could not have been more attentive and welcoming. Our room was as pictured, comfortable and clean. At one point in our trip, I left my wallet in Sevilla and I was comfortable just having it shipped while we were in Granada and held by Charo until we returned to Madrid for the last few days of our trip. We were able to leave our luggage several times during our trip and enjoy the city unencumbered with helpful guidance as to where to go. This experience was the perfect way to begin and end our 18 day journey into Spain.
hotelName:
13    Hospedaje Romero
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a pretty good bargain if you are good with staying in a simple, decent room. A very large apartment has been converted to an inn, and it feels like you are staying in a room in someone's apartment. The building has some great historic charm -- which means that, if you love things like an antique elevator, you will be charmed, but the property is OLD, though well maintained. As others have commented, the landlady speaks no English but we communicated anyhow -- her son speaks English. Rooms was quite modest but clean, quiet, comfortable, and had all the basics. The location in central Madrid is awesome, and I was completely satisfied with this bargain.
hotelName:
13    Hospedaje Romero
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This little hotel is located directly on the busy Gran Via but is somehow really quiet and comfortable. Charo doesn’t speak any English (and I speak no Spanish) but I think she’s had so much practice with foreigners that she was able to explain everything to me. Absolutely everything is within walking distance. If you’re staying here, don’t waste your money on a metro card. The rooms are small and rustic but very clean and comfortable. The floors are wooden and a bit squeaky but not annoyingly so.All in all, it’s well located, very comfortable and great value for money.
hotelName:
13    Hospedaje Romero
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at Hospedaje Romero in March 2019 and was very impressed. Lovely welcoming family who make you feel at home as soon as you arrive. Very clean and safe. Short walk to all major tourist attractions. Located on the Gran Via, a busy street but it’s lovely and quiet in the hotel. Highly recommend.
hotelName:
13    Hospedaje Romero
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just returned from a 3 night weekend stay. The location is absolutely superb, in the heart of Madrid, just a couple of minutes walk from Plaza De España and Santa Domingo metro stations. One of which you take towards the airport (40 mins journey time). The guest house is on the sixth floor of a securely locked building, with a private entrance again, once you get to floor six. The guest house is owned my mother and son (Charo and Raul), who are both very friendly and helpful. Mother doesn’t speak English, but son does. Our room (number four), though quite small, was two single beds, with a bathroom with shower and toilet. It was complete with tv and safe, in wardrobe. The only grumble I’d have, is with the floors been wooden, wooden doors on room and bathroom, it creates a fair bit of noise when other guests are moving about and opening/closing. Sometimes it was like been in the same room ! However, the plus points outweigh this only minus. The room was clean, warm and towels changed daily. The location is superb for walking to all the local attractions, or jumping on the excellent metro. If you’re on a reasonable budget, this is a very good place to stay. Value for money and definitely recommend.
hotelName:
13    Hospedaje Romero
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location just superb.On the most happening street of Madrid close to underground station,this location is just the right place to stay.But Hospedaje Romero is not exactly a hotel.It is more of a home stay with privacy & no interference. The rooms are small but clean.The room we stayed in was with a shower & toilet.The small window had a nice restricted view.The best part of this place is the lady who owns the place & her son.She is such a nice person & will make you feel at home with her care & warm welcome.She can only speak Spanish & hence if you are English speaking you could have some problems.But her son speaks English so that is not a real issue.He too is very helpful.So if you are one of those who does not mind not having the option of tea/coffee or breakfast inside your hotel, this is a wonderful place to stay.There are lots of food joints down below on the main street.
hotelName:
13    Hospedaje Romero
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: In all my years of travel, I have never felt more warmly welcomed and cared for than I was at Hospedaje Romero. The location is perfect for tourists: close to parks, historical sites, restaurants, public transportation, and shopping. The hostess was delightful to talk to and thoroughly knowledgeable about not only the local area, but also about all of Spain. The next time I visit Madrid, I will definitely stay at Hospedaje Romero again!
hotelName:
13    Hospedaje Romero
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent my birthday in Madrid (March 2 to March 6) and I was overwhelmed by the kindness and support of the lady in the hotel. She gave us also a lot of tips. The Hospedaje is absolutely central, you can walk to all locations. There is also the metro station plaza de Espagna in 5 min walk. I would absolutely recommend. The hotel is in an old and perfectly held palace (the glass windows and the lift are absolutely stunning). To those who want breakfast: There are plenty of cafes near the hotel - and in Spain it is no use (like in bella Italia) to eat so much in the morning. Gracias Madrid!!
hotelName:
13    Hospedaje Romero
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I´ll recomemded Hospedaje Romero to all my friends and family who come to Madrid because our experience in this little hotel were excelent. They have a amazing situation in Madrid´s center with good, clean and quiet rooms.
hotelName:
13    Hospedaje Romero
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here a week for a class trip to COP25 in Madrid (Dec. 1st thru 7th). The hotel was simple, clean, and had a solid location near the Alfonso XIII metro station and several restaurants, bodegas, and other amenities. The rooms were a lot nicer than I expected, and my compatriots and I had no complaints regarding the bathrooms, closet space, and comfy beds. Our few interactions with the staff were pleasant, and they seemed genuinely responsive to our needs. Would highly recommend.
hotelName:
14    ILUNION Suites Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for two nights earlier this week due to working commitments. Decent location as plenty of stores and restaurants in walking distance, underground only a 5 min walk and the cab to and from the airport was also only around 20 mins outside of rush hour. Room was small but clean, certainly functional. Staff were friendly enough. Breakfast had plenty of choice and hot food available on request. Plenty of bread, cheese, ham etc. Big screen in the bar for sport. Ideal for a business trip, but I don’t think this is ideal for family or a couple sightseeing as it is just a bit too functional for that for me. Would stay here again if working locally.
hotelName:
14    ILUNION Suites Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 1. Very noisy. Hard, uncarpeted floors. Poor soundproofing. In the room next to me I was disturbed by a woman walking in heels on the floor - seemingly endlessly.2. The washbasin in the bathroom was small with a fixed tap extending a long way over it. This made it difficult to wash ones face, etc. It was also sort of "freestanding" on a formica bench. No where to put soap!3. The shower in the bathroom (which worked perfectly well) was over the bath. There was no hand rail to hold on to to assist in getting into or out of thebat. This is not good for older guests.4. There were NO drawers in the room. This is amazing for a so-called 4* hotel. 5. There was no suitcase rack. This made it difficult to find a suitable location to store my suitcase. And for a double room I would have expected 2 racks.6. The entrance passage was lit with a strange purple colour. This made it feel like entering a brothel!7. On the other hand, the bed was comfortable but narrow-ish. The towels were good. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The location was good (only 100m from a Metro station.8. We didn't eat in the hotel so I can't comment on the food. However there was a very nice cafe/bar next door but three, called Los Torreznos. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
14    ILUNION Suites Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in a family room in the hotel. Room was nice, double bed in one room, pull out couch in another, tv in both, walk in wardrobe and bathroom.Location was good. Decor was clinical. Staff were nice and helpful, the lady who cleaned the bedrooms was just lovely and so helpful. We stayed for 3 nights. It was good value. Mark down is because there was a fault with the security reader in the machine in the lift which meant anyone could access your hotel floor from the lift. Made us feel very uneasy. We reported the fault to reception on our first stay, they informed us it was being fixed, it wasn’t during our stay.
hotelName:
14    ILUNION Suites Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for a week and our stay was very comfortable. All staff was very friendly and helpful. It is at a very convenient location. There is a supermarket next door and the metro station is also very close.The beds are very comfortable and is cleaned to a good standard daily.
hotelName:
14    ILUNION Suites Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a comfortable stay with my family. The room was very spacious, clean and modern. Staff at check in were nice, professional and friendly. Also very helpful. The air condition could have been more effective, especially in a very hot climate like Madrid. Breakfast was really lovely and one could also order a hot breakfast from the kitchen.Overall would recommend this hotel especially with children
hotelName:
14    ILUNION Suites Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
