review_body: The Ilunion Suites hotel offers all that necessary for a pleasant stay both for business and leisure. The rooms are spacious and well equipped, the facilities are those of a 4 star and the location is convenient for the business district nearby the Santiago Bernabeu stadium.
hotelName:
14    ILUNION Suites Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was such a gem of a find. We stayed here one night after a few days away from Madrid. I chose it because of proximity to the metro. It is about halfway between the centro and the airport. It was comfortable, quiet, and our family room was extremely spacious. I would definitely stay here again. My only complaint was the AC; but that seemed to be the norm in Madrid—not cold enough to suit us and no fan to circulate stuffy air. The front desk staff was very accommodating when I needed to print boarding passes.
hotelName:
14    ILUNION Suites Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really handy for the airport and transport links into the city, all staff speak English which was helpfull ! It was 40°+ outside so aircon was a godsend, and worked well, unlike other reviews. Didnt eat in hotel, but many cafe and bars in local area for brekie etc..... 30 euro in taxi to barajas airport booked by hotel which wasnt too bad. Or walk to bus station on avenue america then 1.50 to airport. Go to teledo for a day if you have time, an hour on the buss but well worth it.
hotelName:
14    ILUNION Suites Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We came in with no reservations and we loved this hotel! Excellent location in the middle of everything...close to all. Every morning there is a goodie bag on your door with breakfast a bottle of water. There is coffee machine juice and cookies and fruit all day long on the 5th floor. And a beautiful outdoor balcony. The staff is very helpful, caring and smiling.I would stay there again for sure!!!
hotelName:
15    B&B Hotel Madrid Fuencarral 52
52    B&B Hotel Madrid Fuencarral 52
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is very central and this is the best part of it. The rooms are clean but small. The staff is kind and helpful. The common room could be cleaner (and better quality teas!). Overall, pleasant stay but without praise or blame.
hotelName:
15    B&B Hotel Madrid Fuencarral 52
52    B&B Hotel Madrid Fuencarral 52
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location was close to metro station, walking distance to Plaza Mayor and any major attractions, bust street, my room was luckily not facing the street so it was quiet. The room decor was simple but very comfortable, shower was very good! Air conditioning was so-so, couldn't adjust it.Front desk staff not very engaging. I asked for a taxi to get to the airport in the early morning, they tried calling the taxi service once and then apologized they didn't answer and told me to stand on the street...No taxi's came in 15 minutes so I requested an Uber.I didn’t like that you don’t truly get a breakfast even though the property is called B&B. You get a bag delivered to your door daily with the same items, croissant, lemon muffin and one water-even though we were 2 guests we only got one water per person however we did get 2 of each mini pastry daily. If you want coffee to go with it, you need to go to the 5th floor to get it. Coffee, tea and juices available all day on the 5th floor. Vending machine is an option for snacks.I personally just wished it was your typical bed and breakfast spread that I experienced in other properties in Europe where I could sit and enjoy breakfast before leaving for the day.
hotelName:
15    B&B Hotel Madrid Fuencarral 52
52    B&B Hotel Madrid Fuencarral 52
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel entrance is a single door tucked in between 2 shops, blink and you'll miss it like the Leaky Cauldron so look up for the large B&B sign. It's opposite a Decathlon and Starbucks, plenty of shopping and food up and down the street. There may be a little bit of noise at night but I had no trouble getting to sleep. Check-in was quick and easy, the staff were friendly and always exchanged a greeting. The room is fairly spacious with a balcony that overlooks the street. Power points are built into the platform bed and easily accessible. Breakfast is a muffin, pastry and bottle of water hung on your door at around 7am. There is free tea/ coffee provided on the 5th floor as well.
hotelName:
15    B&B Hotel Madrid Fuencarral 52
52    B&B Hotel Madrid Fuencarral 52
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This little hotel on a busy shopping street in central Madrid met all our needs and more. It was quiet, had comfortable beds and pillows, a great rain shower, is in a safe and central location, has helpful staff, rooms have little fridges, and the upstairs terrace is a great meeting place with beverages and food available at all hours. We could easily walk on a side street to the interesting university district with restaurants, shops and markets. And the San Miguel Market isn’t too far away. The Tribunal metro stop is only about 10 minutes walk from this hotel.We also appreciate that this is the first hotel chain in Spain that has removed all of the disposable plastic in its rooms. The hand and shower soaps are in dispensers and are only lightly scented.Rooms are modern and functional rather than cozy, and that’s just great for a hotel.
hotelName:
15    B&B Hotel Madrid Fuencarral 52
52    B&B Hotel Madrid Fuencarral 52
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This B&B met all my expectations. Right in the centre, affordable priced, friendly staff, and very clean. What else would you need. The bed was good, the sanitary also. On the fifth floor there is a very nice terrace where you can take coffee, juices, bites (all inclusive)
hotelName:
15    B&B Hotel Madrid Fuencarral 52
52    B&B Hotel Madrid Fuencarral 52
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Well maintained hotel with good view. Perfect location. Rooms were small, but clean. We had balcony attached to our rooms, which gave us the view of the street below. It also had a common area, with continuous supply of coffee, fruits, juices, and fruits. Staff were polite and cordial. They helped us with the directions whenever asked. Location was also good. We could walk anywhere from the hotel. Overall we had a great experience, and could not have hoped better.
hotelName:
15    B&B Hotel Madrid Fuencarral 52
52    B&B Hotel Madrid Fuencarral 52
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stylish boutique style city centre hotel. Good value for standard of rooms and location. Bathroom modern and great shower. Big king sized bed but mattress a little soft for me. No street noice with balcony doors shut. Breakfast basic but hot and cold drinks and snacks available free of charge 24/7. Reception staff very friendly. Would definitely stay again.
hotelName:
15    B&B Hotel Madrid Fuencarral 52
52    B&B Hotel Madrid Fuencarral 52
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great little hotel!! Unassuming from entry but very nice and new on the inside. The front office staff were great especially Andrea. They have 25 hr. coffee, tea fruit available on the 5 th floor. They leave a little goodie bad on your door in the Am with a muffin, a pastry and a water. Very quiet as it is at the beginning of a pedestrian street that takes you down to the Gran Via. Highly recommend!!
hotelName:
15    B&B Hotel Madrid Fuencarral 52
52    B&B Hotel Madrid Fuencarral 52
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Its location cannot be beaten, just 100 m far from Puerta del Sol (Madrid s city center).Rooms are really nice and service was great.The number of rooms is quite a number as hotel was built through different buildings connected.We were a total of 23 attendants to a private event nearby, tally to 10 rooms.There are a few reason why we all booked at Hotel Regina, namely location, quality, facilities...but the key one was the service, care and profesionality provided by staff CRISTINA from Sales Department since we started looking for the best accommodation among all options at city center. So highest possible mark for Cristina and a very high mark for Hotel Regina.
hotelName:
16    Hotel Regina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is perfect it is literally 5 minutes walk from Sol, staff is lovely: all of them, all the time.Best breakfast ever: loved the guacamole, the spring rolls and all the pastries!Very clean all over to the point that the cleaning lady scrubs the stairs everyday by hand, no mop!And the bedroom? Beautifully decorated and very comfy mattress, stunning glass and mirror bathroom with vanity desk!The restaurant is also very nice and the hotel decor is so ‘great Gatsby’ I loved it! Attention to details is mesmerising would definitively go back! I had room 109.I asked for a twin room with separate beds when I booked as by the pictures I saw a twin room and that is how it was advertised and also what I got confirmed in the messages but when we arrived we were told that there are nonsuch rooms and the bed cannot be separated because the night stands are not moveable.
hotelName:
16    Hotel Regina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rooms were extremely nice, location was unbeatable!! Staff super friendly let us store and have access to our luggage the entire next day after we had checked out. 10/10 recommend. Good vibes overall!
hotelName:
16    Hotel Regina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is well located in a central location within walking distance of many sites, restaurants etc. All facilities (lobby, rooms etc.) are modern and have been tastefully renovated and the service was overall very good, including an excellent breakfast. I was not happy with the room: the first room I was given at checking was the size of a large closet with a window opening on what the reception termed an interior courtyard, but which was in effect a dark well. I managed to change room by agreeing to pay a supplement of 20 Euros/night. This second room was bright and pleasant but the very loud construction noise on the street made it overall an unpleasant stay.
hotelName:
16    Hotel Regina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked sight unseen via the web exceptionally pleased with the standard and welcome.Unlimited good quality breakfast bar stools a bit too high.Temporarily construction work going on outside but nothing to do with the hotel very central and would stay again if we revisit
hotelName:
16    Hotel Regina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The accommodation is very nice,excellent location and friendly staff.But... we went to the restaurant for a late dinner and we were thoroughly disappointed. We ordered a medium steak with a side of vegetables. We got the vegetables- about twenty minutes later we got a steak that had barely touched the grill. Sent it back only to be given the same steak after what looked like a turn in the microwave. Some parts cooked through - others still raw... So, stay at the lovely hotel - avoid the restaurant
hotelName:
16    Hotel Regina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Hotel Regina for 4 nights and it was a very good choice. It is centrally located close to restaurants, bars, shops and the city's main piazza. It is also very close to a metro stop. Our room was spacious, clean, very well appointed and very comfortable. The bathroom had a very large shower stall with a rainfall shower head as well as a handheld shower head. It also had a large counter with double sink along with the toilet and bidet.The hotel itself is upscale and classy with a lot of attention to detail. They offer an excellent breakfast with numerous choices including cereals, fruits, bacon and eggs, and an assortment of croissants and other sweets. The staff was friendly, helpful and professional especially Manuel who worked diligently for several days to resolve a billing issue for me. I would definitely stay there again on a return trip to Madrid.
hotelName:
16    Hotel Regina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for four nights last week. The location was perfect, within easy walking distance of the large park, lots of restaurants and bars, and shopping. We loved just wandering around old Madrid and spending time in the many nearby plazas. The room was modern and clean, the breakfast was great, and the staff was very helpful. Due to the ongoing construction on Alcalá, we had requested a room off the street, and were very pleased with our room.
hotelName:
16    Hotel Regina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a fabulous location. We stayed 3 nights at the Hotel Regina and were very happy with the room, the location and the staff. We arrived very early and our room wasn't ready but we were able to store our bags and come back in the afternoon when the room was ready. We would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
16    Hotel Regina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Not client friendly. Simple but logical request is just whiped away. 24/7 at breakfast as well had to ask to turn loud tv volume low or off. Very, very annoying. 'Music' is more important than /conversation with/ client.
hotelName:
17    Ibis Budget Madrid Centro Las Ventas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: During our stay on this branch, we lived a wonderful experience, full of excellent memories, a convenient location and plans to come back in the short term.Additionally I would like to mention that the staff of the front desk is willing to go the extra mile by offering even hot tea to help you in case your stomach is upset. They were very considered.Best regards,Hector Romero
hotelName:
17    Ibis Budget Madrid Centro Las Ventas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located near to a subway station, but a little far from the center. The room is small but com-pletely functional and confortable. The breakfast is good. As a negative point, after check-out, we couldn´t use the internet connection to call our uber to the airport.
hotelName:
17    Ibis Budget Madrid Centro Las Ventas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here before and is quite central and also near to metro station and therefore easy links to the whole city if you buy the day passes. the room was clean, the staff were friendly and helpful. they even bought in Gluten free bread rolls and Magdalena's for my breakfast which was nice. you do have to inform them of the requirement before arriving.
hotelName:
17    Ibis Budget Madrid Centro Las Ventas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was big enough and clean but the bathroom was really small. Stayed here for one night. The location was good, it was close to the metro station ' El Carmen ' . It takes 15 minutes to the city center by metro. The breakfast was ok, could be better. The staff was helpful.
hotelName:
17    Ibis Budget Madrid Centro Las Ventas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very small room in out of the way location.Very much overpriced even for a budget hotel in a very ordinary area.Also hard to find in a back street. Bathroom miniscule.Have stayed in numerous hotels in Madrid and this is definately the worst value.
hotelName:
17    Ibis Budget Madrid Centro Las Ventas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: You always know what you’re getting with an ibis budget - friendly staff, fast service, a large bed and no fuss or frills... we’ve previously stayed in the London one and our room was identical. Pillows are not comfy and there are no extras which is a downside. Good location for metro! Would stay again!
hotelName:
17    Ibis Budget Madrid Centro Las Ventas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Ibis Budget is a 3-star hotel chain (Ibis) attempting a 2-star hotel, and they succeeded. The hotel is perfect for those who like functional stays. The room has a decent bed, a plain toilet, a small sink, etc. The breakfast buffet is essentially at the hotel lobby, and is small but has all the main ingredients most people want (bread, cereals, fruit, coffee, juice, jams, etc.). The hotel is outside the city center, but it is right next to the El Carmen metro station, which is on the green line that also goes right to the city center. The price is super low, which makes this hotel perfect for light travellers who prefer function over comfort.
hotelName:
17    Ibis Budget Madrid Centro Las Ventas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Cosy hotel, great location outside the city centre but with great communication. Also quite good communication with airport. Near the hotel many shops, cafes, restaurants. Rooms basic as it is in Ibis budget hotels but with everything that you need to refresh and rest. Very clean. Breakfast also basic but enough for the begenning of a day, everything fresh. A bit small dinning area. The staff very nice and helpful. I reccomend.
hotelName:
17    Ibis Budget Madrid Centro Las Ventas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First time in Spain. Hotel was modern, and clean. There was an outside sitting area with an outdoor heater, and it looked really nice but unfortunately it was raining that night so we could not sit outside. I found everyone that worked there to be polite and friendly.
hotelName:
18    Barcelo Imagine
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved this hotel! Very comfortable beds, linens and pillows. Good sized room. Room service was good. Service was great and located very close to Santiago Bernabeu stadium. There are several restaurants close by. There is even a pharmacy across the street in case you forgot to bring something. Would definitely recommend and would stay there again.
hotelName:
18    Barcelo Imagine
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights yes its a good distance from the city but only 10 mins on the train. I found the staff to be friendly and helpful. The prices in the hotel are extortionate i ordered a fish and chips it was 16 euro which i wouldnt mind but it was like a starter portion 2 tiny squares of fish and about 6 chips it was disgraceful. Rooms were very nice and clean.
hotelName:
18    Barcelo Imagine
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nothing fancy outside, but smart themed hotel two stops from the airport. Take the metro as that's quicker and ten times cheaper than taxis, who in our experience will just drop you where they want and not where you are going. The staff at the hotel are really friendly and helpful, and the breakfast is really good. Boasts a swimming pool but that's only open in the summer, so you may be disappointed. Rooms are spatial and clean. Beds very comfortable. AC takes some training.
hotelName:
18    Barcelo Imagine
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice hotel, with all you need. I was there for business and the loaction was near my Congress. But if I was there for holiday I would have chosen something closer to the city centre. The bus took almost 30minutes downtown. And metro was not any easier. Taxidrivers were unpolite, so I only did that twice. Tip: you don't have to buy a ticket in advance for taking the bus. Just pay 1,5Euro in cash.
hotelName:
18    Barcelo Imagine
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel service and location!! Next to Chamartin train station we were able to walk to Santiago Bernabeu stadium, get to city centre by local train C3/C4 in less than 15 minutes!! We will definitely stay here again anytime we come back to Madrid! Thanks for a great stay.
hotelName:
18    Barcelo Imagine
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: An excellent value for money hotel, you get a high end modern accommodation for the price of mid class hotels in the city center. The hotel is located a bit outside the typical tourist area. However if you’re a business traveler and want proximity to the business district you are a stones throw from plaza Castilla. The staff is super friendly. The rooms are large and are correctly equipped. The big pluses for me are the comfortable beds and the large walk-in showers. It also has an outside pool, a gym, a restaurant with quite alright food, a roof top bar, Try it, it is well worth staying at, whether you travel for business or pleasure.
hotelName:
18    Barcelo Imagine
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The gentleman at the reception was very warm and patience when checking us in as we wanted to know more about the area round teh hotel. Unfortunately we forgot to ask for his name as we just arrived in Madrid after 21 hours up in the air. Its very rare we encountered such a warm wlecome in any hotel. He even loaned us a metro card so that we didnt have to purcahse it for our next morning outing in downtown. Its very rare that we encountered such a warm wlecome in any hotel.
hotelName:
18    Barcelo Imagine
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As a hotel we couldn’t ask for anything more, we had an amazing stay and the attention to detail throughout the entire hotel is perfect and immaculate! The location seemed daunting but all the information we needed was given to us as we checked in and felt comfortable using the nearby metro to travel around Madrid and sight see. Overall the perfect experience and we plan to return again in the future
hotelName:
18    Barcelo Imagine
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friend and I stayed here a few weeks ago and we were pleasantly surprised! This was definitely not your average "hostel". It was more like a 3 - 4 star hotel. Staff were friendly. I did email a few times before my trip to request twin beds in our room, but we were given a double bed instead, although this wasn't a big issue.The room was clean and cosy, and had a mini bathroom, TV, fridge, arm chair, dressing table and free toiletries plus our towels were changed every other day. It took a while for our air-con to kick in but it was fine after that. Breakfast was good and there was lots of variety. There was cereal, a range of hot drinks, orange/ apple juice, yoghurts, pastries, mini pizza slices, fruit, ham and cheese board and baguettes. Location on Gran Via was brilliant too as it was similar to Oxford Street so it was nice and central. We were a little thrown off by the outside of the building but it is basically a big apartment block with a different hostel on each floor. There are loads of bars, restaurants and shops within walking distance of the hotel and also several metro stations. My favourite restaurant was 'Salvador Bachiller's greenhouse' which was in the basement of a retail shop a few doors down and IT WAS AMAZING!!Overall, if you're after cheap and cheerful accommodation in the centre of Madrid, then Vitium Urban Suites is definitely the place to go!
hotelName:
19    Vitium Urban Suites
34    Vitium Urban Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed in onebof their lovely suites with an in-room tub and shower. The amenities were nice as well as the customer service. The location was nice, but a bit noisy and bright being right downtown. My husband and I didn't mind, however, just pull the shades and use ear plugs if it becomes an issue. We enjoyed people watching from our 4th floor room. The elevator is a bit small and slow, something to consider if taking the stairs is not an option for you.
hotelName:
19    Vitium Urban Suites
34    Vitium Urban Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very modern hotel. The decorations are very nice. The room was clean. The bed big enough for two. The bathroom was a bit small. Breakfast was very good. They'll cook eggs for you and you actually had real coffee to drink. Of course, don't expect Grade A coffee, but it was fine if you're not picky. The location is walkable to the Palace/Church and Plaza Espana. Metro is close from a couple of different stops. Even though I think the hotel was near full (if not completely full) it was very quiet. Downsides? Elevator is small (seems like a lot of them are in Europe) and slow. As I mentioned the bathroom was small. The a/c was turned off for the season as it seems that the heat and the a/c can't run at the same time. Beware if you're going in the Spring or Fall. We had an incident where I spilled a glass of wine and it went everywhere on the bed. Since it was evening, there was no housekeeping and the guy at the front desk had to scramble to find a broom and new sheets/blankets for the bed, but he managed to do it so that was nice.
hotelName:
19    Vitium Urban Suites
34    Vitium Urban Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice location in the center. The staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are ok but average. The breakfast is poor, coffee is very bad - better to have breakfast out. Next time will probably choose another place for stay
hotelName:
19    Vitium Urban Suites
34    Vitium Urban Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel was comfortable. Very central location in Gran Via. Almost everywhere was in walking distance. Room was clean and hotel staff was very helpful. If I go to Madrid again, I would stay in Vitium Urban Suites.
hotelName:
19    Vitium Urban Suites
34    Vitium Urban Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Check in went fine and room had everything we required, clean and tidy with a nice powerful shower. Bed confy and although our room overlooked the main road we could barely hear any outside noise. Breakfast was good although the cutlery and plates ect was not always very clean and it would be nice to be able to get a clean plate if you wanted to get more food, However there was always plenty and the maids were always friendly and would try and help although there english was not very good.Access to the room is via buzzer system where you have to press each time you want to get access from the road or onto each floor (card unlocks your room door) although most of the time they opened the door within a few seconds sometimes it felt longer and got a bit tiresome having to do it everytime. I appreciate it is for security but it would be car easier if the card gave you acceess to the front door and each floor. Not a major issue just something that could be improved. I would recommend this as a place to stay.
hotelName:
19    Vitium Urban Suites
34    Vitium Urban Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is well located in Madrid but too expensive if you add the parking charge. The information of the website does not provide the daily parking rate in order to allow travellers to compare with other hotels. The parking represented 62% of the room charge which I find is totally disproportionate and would of changed my mind of booking there. The management response to my complaint was not satisfactory. No elevator services, so if you have a lot of luggage I would not recommend.
hotelName:
19    Vitium Urban Suites
34    Vitium Urban Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Although Vitium Urban Suites is on the Gran Via, one of the main streets in Madrid, I think it's located just slightly too far northwest on the street to be entirely convenient. Closer to the metro stop Gran Via is a bit easier to get around. However, there are 2 metro stations very close (Santo Domingo & Plaza de Espana) and also tons of bars, restaurants, and shopping just outside the door.If you choose to take public transport from the airport, you can take the Cercanias rail to Chamartin, then transfer to the metro to Plaza de Espana. From there it's about a 5 minute walk.The building is currently (late March/ early April 2017) undergoing renovations. When you arrive at the hotel, the doorway is beneath scaffolding. It seemed the front door remained open during the day but then was locked at night, at which point you had to buzz to be let in. Although reception always buzzed you in promptly, I prefer locations where your keycard can also open the front door. Luckily there is an elevator, though small and slow. The door to the hotel itself is sometimes open or again sometimes you need to buzz.My room 511 did not face Gran Via but rather a smaller street behind it. However, the building opposite was undergoing construction, so it was a bit noisy when they began working in the morning. In addition, it faced several terraces, so if people are loud out on their terrace, you will hear it. Of course the hotel cannot control this but just be aware it may not be the quietest spot.The room was small but adequate; the bathroom was really tiny. A miniature sink and you practically touched the opposite wall while sitting on the toilet. The shower had good pressure and both a normal shower head and a rain shower (though I never did figure out how to use the rain shower). Both room and bathroom were clean and definitely looked new.Considering the size of the room, there was surprisingly decent storage space - a closet, several shelves, a large desk, and the top of the minibar. There was an easy to use safe in the closet. There was a sort of shelf along the wall behind the bed but no nightstand which would have been more convenient. Also no luggage rack.I did not use the minibar but it was well-stocked and not terribly expensive.The negative aspects: the wifi was terrible, constantly going in and out. I use roaming so I would start a Skype/ Whatsapp call anticipating using wifi, only to have it cut out at some point during the call and switch to data... be careful. And also, they twice did not bring me a new bathmat. I do not tend to reuse bathmats or towels and had in fact tossed the used, wet mat in the corner, only to discover when I returned to the room that they retrieved it. refolded it, and placed it back in the bathroom! That day they also did not bring me a fresh hand towel. I went to the desk and they were happy to give me a new mat and towel, but then the same thing happened the next day. This time when I went to the desk I was a little irritated and the man told me they only replace the bathmat every other day (though he did again give me a fresh one). This is super odd in a modern location such as this one when they do replace the rest of the towels daily.There were at least 4 people working at reception and some were friendlier than others, though all were helpful with buses, maps, etc.This is a okay choice if you get a great deal but I do not think I would seek out staying there again.
hotelName:
19    Vitium Urban Suites
34    Vitium Urban Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is very well located and very modern. Our room was clean, but it was very small and the bed was very uncomfortable. It squeaked everytime you turned yourself in bed and it was very noisy because of the traffic on Gran Via.
hotelName:
19    Vitium Urban Suites
34    Vitium Urban Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I chanced upon the OK Hostel to explore downtown Madrid during an overnight layover. Once upon a time in my 20’s this would have been a fantastic experience. Great value, in the heart of downtown, and offered a great 3-course meal (soup, paella, and ice cream with unlimited sangria or beer) and opportunity for good conversation with the fellow travellers. Despite being in my 40’s I met similar ages staying over from all around the world. The security was good (given a wrist band to unlock your particular room. However, also as with any hostel, it’s a dorm style room of many beds and public sinks. I was given a top bunk and although everything was clean, the bed was not the most comfortable. The noise of the comings and goings of other travellers made for a disturbed few hours of sleep before my flight. I left in the early morning for my return flight - all in all a unique experience that I would have truly enjoyed during my university student days, but not recommended for a middle aged professional used to her creature comforts and some luxury!
hotelName:
20    OK Hostel Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at OK hostel, as it was recommended to my by a friend. Location is very good, central and walking distance from pretty much all main attractions.No one gets in if not buzzed in by staff. Immediately noticeable the 3 iMacs for guest to use. Bar and lounge are quite cozy. Another nice lounge downstairs for some more quiet time. Rooms are fairly spacious for being dorms, nice big box under the bed. Lower bunks have curtains. Nice touch ! All beds have light and power socket. Receptionist ( Marta?) was just awesome! Breakfast for 5 € is ok. Not the best but ok, much better than many others I have had in hostels. All in all it is a very very good place to stay while visiting Madrid !
hotelName:
20    OK Hostel Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: this hostel is clean, well-kept, and organized. location is great as there are 2 metro stations nearby. there also lots of restaurants with varied cuisines around to choose from. the main attractions of madrid are also nearby. the hostel has a bar/restaurant that serves breakfast and dinner. the staff are nice and very helpful.
hotelName:
20    OK Hostel Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hostel has to be the best I've stayed in for a long time. All the facilities are spot on ranging from very clean room, large locker and en-suite. The staff are extremely pleasant, friendly and helpful and their efforts produced an excellent breakfast and dinner. No one would be disappointed with this choice.
hotelName:
20    OK Hostel Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hostel has the friendliest staff ever! Everyone was very accommodating and went out of their way to make sure you are taken care of. I really enjoyed the family dinner. It was worth the cost and an easy way to make friends. The rooms are clean and super comfortable. I enjoy the body length pillow and the curtain for privacy. The location was perfect and really close to a strip of tapas restaurants.
hotelName:
20    OK Hostel Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really nice hostel, with great facilities and lots of helpful touches, like bunk beds having curtains, as well as each bed having its own light and electrical outlet. Daniela at reception was exceptionally helpful, and the historical center tour with Erika was great as well.
hotelName:
20    OK Hostel Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hallway and stairs smell like unwashed feet. The male receptionist (the chubby one) was so rude and unsympathetic. Breakfast tastes like cheap. I hated staying there. Look for something better and in a better area if you can.
hotelName:
20    OK Hostel Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It seemed like a hostel with the facilities and quality of a hotel. The beds were extremely comfortable, the staff was very friendly, they cleaned the room and bathroom 2 times a day,...There's a nice bar downstairs where the drinks aren't expensive and you can meet a lot of nice people. You can eat in the hostel for only €10 and it encludes three dishes AND the drinks. The food is prepared by chefs and is very good quality.The bathrooms were extremely clean and there are even bathtubs in the rooms.There were also a lot of activities organised by the hostel, based on tips.If you go to Madrid, I would defenitely recommend you to choose this hostel!It was amazing!
hotelName:
20    OK Hostel Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hostel surprised me with its immaculately kept rooms that had lot of space and natural light. It's wasn't a crazy party place but had dinner events that got people together followed by the pub crawl. The staff were friendly and helpful. For the price they have on weekdays this place has to be the best value for money in town.
hotelName:
20    OK Hostel Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Convenient hotel at good price next to metro stop, a bit far from city center.Good room, and fast check in and check out!They gave us the room at 12 pm, unlike other hotels the check in is not before 14:00 or 15:00
hotelName:
21    Ibis budget Madrid Calle Alcala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff were helpful. The room was clean. The breakfast was good.The high stools in the breakfast area are too high and uncomfortable. The door of the toilet in the room would not close! It was warped and must have been like that for some time. The ringing of the phone at reception could be heard clearly in the room, and at a late hour.
hotelName:
21    Ibis budget Madrid Calle Alcala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pubic hair and disgusting stuff in the bank bed where my daughter was to sleep. They were nice, but could not give us another room since they were full. The manager said it was normal, and it would be due to regular laundry operations. They didn’t offer any compensation. Unacceptable. Good they at least changed the linen after complaining.
hotelName:
21    Ibis budget Madrid Calle Alcala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My stay was from Jun/26 to Jun/28/2019 in a Room with a Queen bed and a small bed for my son. There was no pillow for my son and when my wife asked the guy on front desk about it, he was Very rude and said to her the hotel had no more pillows and even If they had one It would be charged. She decided to Go back to the room to make sure there was no pillow but It was really missing. After that she went back to the front desk and after some time he decided to look for a pillow and magically he found one. Our impression is that sometimes they forget who is the customer. When you book a hotel room It is supposed to include the pillows on the reservation. Also, they must know How to treat the customer with respect. It is a Basic behavior that we expect If It is a serious and professional company.
hotelName:
21    Ibis budget Madrid Calle Alcala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Alcala Ibis Budget is a 20min metro ride from downtown using the close-by Line 5 metro. Close to airport, great suburbian area. Bed was comfy and the room was clean and not noisy at all. We liked staying here. (4 nights)
hotelName:
21    Ibis budget Madrid Calle Alcala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had 1-person room, but it turned out to be a room with a bunk-bed (double bed + kid bed). The room is small, probably too small for 2 (and definitely too small for 3), but as I was alone, I was ok with it. I had a smoking room, but I didn't really understant how it works (do they want people open the window (the stopper allows to open it for 10 cm) and smoke in that tiny hole?), so I just went downstairs. Bed was very comfy, I slept well.Wifi was not bad.Breakfast was limited - cereals, coffee, tea, some fruit (apples one day, grapes another day), bread, cooked ham, cheese, some jam and yoghurt. So I had coffee with toast with ham and cheese and an apple. But it was enough to start my day, but didn't make me really full.Metro station Suanez is within the walking distance. There are also some supermarkets nearby. Cleaning was made every day.What I didn't like was constant noise from a shower, the sink in the room and aircon. I couldn't actually locate the aircon in the room. There was some relay on the wall and I tried to adjust the temperature on it, but it didn't get warmer. I think I would come back there or to another Ibis across the street, it seems to be more classy.
hotelName:
21    Ibis budget Madrid Calle Alcala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at Ibis budget Calle Alcala for 7 nights ( 25.06.2018.- 02.07.2018. )The room was like in description , AC sistem was ok , breakfast ( only 5 euro / person ) nice.  The room was cleaned every day , towels changed
hotelName:
21    Ibis budget Madrid Calle Alcala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at the Ibis Budget Madrid Calle Alcalá before embarking on a package tour , thus only stayed for 1 night. The accommodation was clean, safe and comfortable enough. The breakfast was okay as well. I try not to have enormous expectations when station at a budget hotel.
hotelName:
21    Ibis budget Madrid Calle Alcala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: small but clean rooms ( I knew it from the begining ).  WIFI was very good .  Air condition sistem was good . breakfast was ok ( only 4.90 E/ day )the hotel is in the proximity of Suanzes metro station ( 200 m ) Thank you Ibis Budget Madrid Calle Alcala !
hotelName:
21    Ibis budget Madrid Calle Alcala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for a layover after travelling 8 hours from Turkey to connect next day for other 15 hours journey to Mexico. Called to the hotel to request the shuttle and picked me up in about 20 min. The lady who drove me to the hotel was extremely professional and nice. She insisted in carrying my luggage with a smile. Check in was fine with a very honest receptionist who gave me a call after noticing I left my wallet with passport and important cards and money on the reception desk. Room disappointing as the coffee service lacked of creamers, decaf and tea. Old furniture, with a 15 year old TV I never managed to turn on. Since I was too tired I just napped and beds were fine and clean. Heater working properly. Booked a shuttle at 7 am and we were 1 minute late, the driver named Miguel denied helping us to put our luggage into the trunk. He was extremely upset for our minute-delay despite being no one but us on the way to the airport. Once on the shuttle, he started to SHOUT AND SCOLDING US for our delayAs shocked as I was for such treatment, I asked him to please refrain from shouting at us and just drive and he kept talking and talking, UNBELIEVABLE! I was under antistress treatment and he managed to make me shout back at him causing me taquicardia and had to shout back to PLEASE SHUT UP AND END THIS ABSURD AND UNNECESSARY CHAT. I asked him his name to report him and he denied to gave me the info, clearly aware of what he did. The worst part was calling to reception and instead of receiving and apology, had a lady on the phone DEFENDING the guy... OUTRAGEOUS!!!
hotelName:
22    Hotel Maydrit Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have used this hotel on several occasions when stopping in Madrid to change the plane to another European destination. They have a very convenient shuttle bus from the airport and the metro is within walking distance to get downtown. The rooms are clean and well fitted and the breakfast very decent. This is mainly a hotel for the business travelers. I recommend it for the good value for money.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Maydrit Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel and staff is very good. It is very near to the airport and hotel provide free pickup and drop which has to be booked at the reception or on call. It is very close to metro El Capricho which takes you directly to the city center in half an hour.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Maydrit Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I really liked this hotel, was reasonable priced for the quality of the hotel, room, food and airport transfer. The staff was really friendly when I called asking for hotel transfer from the airport to the Hotel, which they OFFER, they told me to call the hotel as soon as I left the plane or in case you had checked your bags, as soon as you get them, and I did we waited 20 mins, could have been less but one bus had just took off with other clients. The journey to the hotel is 10 mins, as we arrived our room was already available and the room was really good, quite spacious, a nice big and comfortable bed. The bathroom was amazing, really simple and modern, with a bathtub and a shower, two sinks and some counter space, nice toiletries. Overall the room was really good for the price and location, really clean, nice breakfast and nice staff ( English could be better). The metro stations was a nice 3 minute walk, cool and quiet neighborhood, journey to city center is quite long, 28/30 minutes buy metro/underground but we already knew about that. This is a good hotel, close to airport which for us was good we didn’t want to be stressed about catching our flight back, you can book your airport transfer at front desk. I recommend if you want an easy, comfortable and cozy staying.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Maydrit Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is an excellent Hoel for an overnight stay. We did a late booking due to BA strike action and found the room comfortable and very clean, with an excellent bathroom. The breakfast was fine and self service. What sold it for us was their mini bus service, which picked us up on our arrival at 11 pm at night. This you need as the airport area is large and too far to walk.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Maydrit Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Close to airport and transportation is provided..no restaurant close but we had nice meal and wine at hotel. Room was comfortable and updated. Had early flight and their transportation got us to airport in plenty of time.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Maydrit Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 3 nights. Check in was friendly and efficient. Shuttle was a plus. Rooms are clean and modern. Bed was too hard. They have a coffee machine in the room but only give you one pod, then you have to buy at front desk after. That was disappointing. Close to metro which was nice. Front desk was very helpful in explaining which line to take. There is also uber in Madrid which we took twice. I would stay again.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Maydrit Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was good value. Clean and comfortable. There is a shuttle from the airport and it’s only a couple of kms from the airport . Bathrooms are updated and rooms were really nice . They have WiFi and a pool
hotelName:
22    Hotel Maydrit Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked one night in Maydrit Hotel, and found it satisfaying for our needs. The room was clean and neat, the staff were super friendly. We used the hotel shuttle from and to the airport. We also recomend the great breakfast in the hotel
hotelName:
22    Hotel Maydrit Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice hotel, rooms are big enough and very clean, staff are super nice and welcoming, they are very helpful. Didn’t try any of the restaurants. Very close to gran via street. Would recommend it if you would like to be close to gran via. Nice location.
hotelName:
23    VP Plaza Espana Design
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic hotel for its price. My experience started with the greeter who opened our taxi door and brought it our luggage. Not only did he help bring the luggage to our room, he also gave me a quick tour of our room! Remarkable. The check-in was painless and front desk was also very attentive with maps and tips on where to visit where to shop. The room was among some of the most modern/high tech room I have ever stayed at for a hotel, almost everything is automatic with a push of a switch. They also provide free water, free soda and free juice. Since it’s our first time in Spain, I am not sure if this Is normal or if it’s just them. Room is clean and well kept, I feel safe in the establishment. Location is ideal, it’s literally right next to the royals palace. If I ever come back to Madrid, this hotel will definitely be my hotel of choice again. One thing I do want to mention to the hotel mgmt is about the house keeping team. They like to knock on room early. I stayed for 2 days and it happened both days!! One was to come finish up the bed cover? And other was straight house keeping. We were still sleeping, it was only 10-11 am!!! Kind of early for house keeping? I find that so strange !! Other than that. No other issues at allll!Price : 3/5 (price vs value, the lower the score the better the value for the price you paid, doesn’t mean cheap)Cleanliness:5/5Friendliness:5/5Convenience:4.5/5
hotelName:
23    VP Plaza Espana Design
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel has got to be one of the sexiest hotels I've stayed at, beautiful contemporary design, with satisfyingly enough space. The rooms were gorgeous, and the bathroom was beautiful. The location of the hotel was above average. One disappointment I had was when I ordered uber eats. When the guy arrived, he couldn't go on the elevator for security reasons, which I understand. We called downstairs and the lady who picked up the phone said yes, the guy is here. I asked her if she could let him up, in which she replied no, but I can bring it to you. Terrific 5-star response! Twenty seconds after hanging up, a man called and told my wife NO, we cannot let him in or bring it up to you, come down and get it yourself... WTF HORRIBLE RESPONSE! Customers are always right, especially if it's an easy issue to resolve, wish I had got the "gentleman's" name. The next issue was... the ceiling leaked! See attached image, apparently, when whoever showered in the room above us, it caused the rip in the ceiling and starting streaming his dirty shower water into my room. My daughter, who is 2, discovered it when she walked in there, slipped and started crying. My wife and I ran into the bathroom and immediately called front desk. They sent someone up to comfirm what happened. Front desk called again and when I informed him what happend, didn't even offer medical assistance...WOW. Didn't even offer another room until I said my daughter had slipped..WOW again. 5 star hotel with 3 star customer service.
hotelName:
23    VP Plaza Espana Design
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is an amazing hotel. From the chic, modern room design and welcoming, helpful staff, the hotel exceeded our expectation. The breakfast was fresh, delicious, and of high quality. I cannot say enough great things about this hotel. We look forward to coming back to this great gem of a hotel.
hotelName:
23    VP Plaza Espana Design
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel located right in the heart of Madrid. We had a few issues with the staff waking us in the morning but those were quickly rectified. Definitely one of the highlights was Haydem at the lobby bar he was a genuinely friendly person that was very informative and great to talk to while grabbing a quick drink. We went back almost every night for his company and conversation. The concierge was also great the gentleman who helped us on the first day was very informative and arranged everything from our day tours to our train tickets. Puri offered some great recommendations on restaurants and other activities. Overall will definitely be back when in Madrid again.
hotelName:
23    VP Plaza Espana Design
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay for 8 days during the Davis Cup was beyond expectations. The staff was responsive. The room was delicious with the most comfy bed and wonder full bathroom. The location made it easy to walk to the museums and shopping areas. The subway is but a few steps from the hotel.
hotelName:
23    VP Plaza Espana Design
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed there for 5 days visiting Madrid for Davis Cup finals. The hotel accommodated Croatian, Spanish and Russian teams. I should say their choice was right. Comfortable modern rooms, several modern elevators, spacious lobby with a bar, tasty breakfasts with Veuve Cliqueot. Perfect service. Undoubtedly a 5+ star hotel
hotelName:
23    VP Plaza Espana Design
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here recently whilst visiting for a business trip. The hotel is in a great location and within minutes you can be in the central shopping areas with all the bars and restaurants. The hotel has all the amenities you would expect to find like fitness room and spa as an example. The room was excellent with a very comfortable bed and extremely quiet for a good nights sleep.Great place to stay, lovely staff.
hotelName:
23    VP Plaza Espana Design
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I took my 13 years old daughter to Madrid on October and after reading many hotel reviews,I have decided to stay at the VP Plaza Espana hotel.The hotel has a great location ,the Junior Suite we stayed in was spacious and luxurious and the breakfast was amazing.BUT what made our vacation truly perfect was the hotel staff.I am travelling quite often and I always stay at 5* luxury hotels but I have never experienced this kind of service before.Its starts with the reception staff - check in was quick and efficient.The concierge was patient and had a great sense of humor and he helped us with any request we had.The person who for us will be unforgettable is Mahmoud from room service - what an amazing person.We have been using room service daily and his service was nothing short than excellent.I was sick for the last two days and when he saw that he returned to our room with warm milk and tea and made sure I have all I needed to get better.We felt the VP Plaza was our home in Madrid and will definitely be so also for our future trips.
hotelName:
23    VP Plaza Espana Design
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is the second time we stayed at Only YOU Hotel and we enjoyed both times very much. Staff is nice and helpful and the room is modern, comfortable with a great shower and bed. We also love the location because it’s walking distance to lots of landmarks, amazing restaurants and right across the Atocha train station. If you are taking the train to travel to other cities, Only YOU hotel is extremely convenient.
hotelName:
24    Only YOU Hotel Atocha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just spent 3 nights at this hotel and the entire experience was fantastic; the hotel is fabulous and all of the staff are so friendly and helpful - especially the lovely Pablo on front desk! Really cool hotel with nice bar/eating areas. Would definitely recommend and return!
hotelName:
24    Only YOU Hotel Atocha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were attended by very nice and accommodating staff, awesome rooms, outstanding breakfast, nice rooftop, and perfect location. It was our first time staying at the hotel and we had a good experience.
hotelName:
24    Only YOU Hotel Atocha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed there for 3 nights while on vacation. It's right across the street from the Atocha train station, so easy to return a rental car there and walk back to the hotel. The hotel is modern, with a hip atmosphere. The people are very friendly and helpful, and the rooms, while small, are well-appointed, clean and modern. Lots of plug-ins for electronics, etc. The higher rooms on the street sides are not too noisy, and have nice views over the plaza in front of Attocha. It's very easy to get cabs in front of the hotel. There is a restaurant on the ground floor and a rooftop bar, both inside and outside. Very nice. We'd certainly stay there again.
hotelName:
24    Only YOU Hotel Atocha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff were wonderful. Really went out of their way to help us on a weekend of air traffic control delays. Great room and loved the restaurants and bars.The 7th floor terrace is spectacular. Well equipped gym with mats. I’m looking forward to returning next year.
hotelName:
24    Only YOU Hotel Atocha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 2 nights in the hotel. As soon as you get the hotel you feel welcome. The staff was very courteous and helpful, providing us a map of the city, and suggestions for the places we want to visit.Room and bathrooms were extremely clean and comfortable. Location very convenient, just across the street from the Atocha train station. Breakfast delicious and huge selection of breads, cheese, hams, fruit, coffee, cereals, pastries, traditional hot Spanish meal, juices . The view from the terrace was amazing. I highly recommend this hotel
hotelName:
24    Only YOU Hotel Atocha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Usually I think of being next to Atocha as busy mousy dirty but The Only You Hotel was nothing I expected Friendly door greeters helpful front desk people fluent asking if I preferred a language. The modern cool vibe them is carried over into the rooms. Nicely appointed clean and temperature controllable !! Look forward to coming back again
hotelName:
24    Only YOU Hotel Atocha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful hotel and you feel it alteady when you enter. It is lively in the lobby and lots to look at. The round bookshelves with the classics shelved. The room is also new York style with an efficient use of space a perfect place to feel Home when you Enter after days of work. Excellent t service.
hotelName:
24    Only YOU Hotel Atocha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I chose the Only YOU Hotel Atocha due to the strong Tripadvisor reviews and it's proximity to the Atocha train station. The experience was a mixed bag. On the positive side, the hotel is very convenient for guests arriving or leaving Madrid by train; it's literally within eye sight across a main avenue from the train station. In addition, the reception desk team in the hotel were very personable and helpful. The hotel also makes an effort, sometimes successfully, to be lively and artsy. For example, our floor in the hotel had an art piece comprised of about 25 ping pong paddles. The wall art in our room was kind of silly, but no big deal. On the negative side, Only YOU Atocha rooms are quite small and the hallways are a bit narrow and bleak. Secondly, the lobby is a very busy place. It attracts a lot of people for food and drink, coming from the close-by train station. After our check-in to the hotel, we tried to have lunch in the hotel restaurant. We were told if we didn't have a reservation, we would have to wait 15 to 20 minutes. That was fine, but once seated, we were not served or even acknowledged for another 10 to 15 minutes. Other restaurant patrons on either side of us that were seated after us were served much more quickly. Once our drinks were finally provided, we subsequently only got a chance to order food after a thoughtful Spanish-speaking couple at an adjoining table felt sorry for us, and spoke to a server. Lastly, because the hotel is on a major thoroughfare (Paseo de la Infanta Isabel) and across from the station, the street noise is very loud. Lots of car honking, sirens, etc.that can be heard from the rooms. If staying here, we recommend requesting a room of the other side of the hotel. Don't be lured by the "balconies" facing the busy street. The balconies are very small and not useable anyway.
hotelName:
24    Only YOU Hotel Atocha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent hotelNew and modern Excellent location: Plaza de España / Gran víaAmazing boutique breakfast - on the 14th floor with great viewsVery good service- from everyone at the hotel,Jorge the waiter was a specially nice, super friendly and remembered our preferences after the first day Madrid is amazing Super recommend
hotelName:
25    Dear Hotel Madrid
51    Dear Hotel Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel ,great view from the roof , good service , convenient location ( close metro station ) , clean rooms , tasty breakfasts , pleasant and professional  stuff  , especially  at the restaurant   Special thanks to waiter Alvaro !
hotelName:
25    Dear Hotel Madrid
51    Dear Hotel Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We love the rooms the staff and the breakfast. All through the day and night you can get food, service and answers about the activities in the city.Our waiter in breakfast Jorge was helpful and very nice. We are sure to return here!
hotelName:
25    Dear Hotel Madrid
51    Dear Hotel Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am quite facy with hotel but the Dear Hotel in Madrid near Plaza Epaña, on Gran Via, is a great great Hotel. The room is modern and the bathroom very nice. The breakfast/restaurant area, the service was perfect, especially with Abraham. He was always attentive to our needs. Thank you also to the rest of the team.
hotelName:
25    Dear Hotel Madrid
51    Dear Hotel Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is in a brilliant location on Gran Via and there are plenty of restaurants and bars around. Despite being on the Main Street next to a metro station, you could not hear much traffic at night apart from the occasional sirens. Very helpful staff and very informative. The room was very clean and stylish. The only small issue we had was that our room was on floor 11 and the lift sometimes took up to 3 minutes to get to our floor as it was quite slow especially if other people were using it. However this is a very minimal problem and it certainly would not put me off returning to the hotel for future visits to this beautiful city. Many thanks!
hotelName:
25    Dear Hotel Madrid
51    Dear Hotel Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very comfortable hotel with very clean rooms. Exceptional service by their friendly staff. Especially Esther who was very patient helped a great deal when we were facing problems communicating. Will definitely stay here again on the next trip!
hotelName:
25    Dear Hotel Madrid
51    Dear Hotel Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very chic and clean hotel with super friendly services. Shout out to Esther who helped us when we needed assistance with speaking to a Spanish over the phone to settle a courier issue with UPS. We enjoyed our stay in Dear Hotel and will definitely come back again when we visit Madrid in the future! :)
hotelName:
25    Dear Hotel Madrid
51    Dear Hotel Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: LoveliesVennessa and Maria, the best service ever. You made ourstay plesent and with worm . I will sure return backtostay here becouse of you. Thanks again.You direct us to the best places, resturants, shows and dire ctions.
hotelName:
25    Dear Hotel Madrid
51    Dear Hotel Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a great stay this noviembre. We were welcomed by Gador at our check in and check out. Al was arranged for and the service was impecable. We definitely will Come back.Also the welcome drink was serves with pleasure and great views over Madrid.
hotelName:
25    Dear Hotel Madrid
51    Dear Hotel Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay was very good. The room was spacious and confortable. The bathroom was clean, we only had some trouble adjusting the water temperature. Breakfast was REALLY good :) it had plenty of options and it was delicious. Plus, the location is excellent and very well connected. Overall, it is a very nice place to stay.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Persal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: from persal you can visit the most interesting places of the central madrid on footthe hostal is cosy and cleanthe room is small but comfortable and the bed is too shortthe receptionists are helpful
hotelName:
26    Hotel Persal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good location of hotel. Everything is just fine. I love staying here,stuff nice. Room are clean and comfortable. I have to say that value for what you get is very good! I really dont have any bad words :)
hotelName:
26    Hotel Persal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location in the centre of Madrid, just a few minutes away from Plaza Mayor.The hotel has a unique style, specialky the lobby and the breakfast room.Nice staffVery big rooms with anything you may need: hairdryer, shampoo, tissues...Really nice brekfast with sweet treats (jam, pastries, cereals...) and salty ones (bread, boiled eggs, cured meats). Good selection of teasI have been on 3 and 4 stars hotels which are way worst than this one. The only thing I'd change is the bed size and comfortabilityI would definitely come back
hotelName:
26    Hotel Persal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is a good place, but to need to improve in the following details: Safety bars in the shower Better Wifi in every level of the hotel. You can not work with this Wifi, some times you need.All the rest is very good
hotelName:
26    Hotel Persal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This welcoming small hotel is truly in the center of everything. All attractions are a 15 minute walk or less! There are many restaurants in the surrounding neighborhood. The hotel has a comfortable, easy atmosphere Cleanliness is a priority throughout the entire hotel. My original room was irregularly shaped, awkward, cramped with a teeny shower and it was very noisy. I requested a room change and it was done without hesitation. My room was then comfortable with a fine bathroom. Rooms are simple. Wi-Fi was excellent in my room and public areas. Breakfast was very nice with plenty of choices. Staff is friendly and service oriented. It is surrounded by restaurants and next door is a small grocery store. I would gladly stay here again. Thank you Hotel Persal!
hotelName:
26    Hotel Persal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Reasonably priced, basic hotel, situated in the heart of Madrid. Room was basic but comfortable and very clean. Buffet breakfast well worth the small price charged when ordered with booking. Staff extremely helpful. Only negative was the noise you could here from outside, adjacent rooms and corridors. Am returning to Madrid next year and will definitely be staying here once again.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Persal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent service. The location is perfect, a 15 minutes walking distance from Barajas Int Airport. Very near of biggest attractions of Madrid lime Parque del Buen Retiro, plaza Las Cibeles, La Gran Vía and the famous Plaza del Sol.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Persal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rooms are pretty small and a bit Spartan but perfetly clean and well isolated.People working at the reception are very friendly and welcoming, always prepared to answer whatever question you may have about transport and places of interest in Madrid.Wecanespecially recommend tthe breakfast buffer which is served in a very cosy room.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Persal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall very disappointed with the Ibis. We booked this room because it was reasonable value, allowed pets and had free parking. When we arrived we were immediately told the parking was not available so we had to drive around the corner (+€24). We were charged €15 for our dog as well (we later discovered that the literature said it was €10). The room was ok, but much smaller than pictured when we booked, and the window opened to an alley directly facing a bleak wall - very depressing and dark! The buffet breakfast was €9 and did not include any hot food. We also ordered two €9 pizzas to our rooms and were charged €25 on checkout. Overpriced and not in the best location either. We won't be staying there again!
hotelName:
27    ibis Madrid Centro Las Ventas
38    ibis Madrid Centro Las Ventas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a very good experience at this hotel. It is very well located, next to the Bull Ring which we could see every day at breakfast. Service is very good, breakfast is good and the location of the breakfast area is really nice. Overall a very good experience. We would stay there again. Specially for the easy access to Metro.
hotelName:
27    ibis Madrid Centro Las Ventas
38    ibis Madrid Centro Las Ventas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Being accor status holder, it was a no brainer that we would book an accor property. We made a small mistake of going by the name - Centro. This is no where close to the city center but is very accessible none the less. Very close to metro and on the Hoho bus route. If you are planning to explore Madrid - Not a bad choice.
hotelName:
27    ibis Madrid Centro Las Ventas
38    ibis Madrid Centro Las Ventas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 1 night at this hotel, and we'll deffinetely come back if we visit Madrid again, The room is a little small, but for us was enought, The view from the room and The restaurant=wonderfull, a very tasty and fresh breakfast, a very good cofee and pastery, stuff at The reception very kind,always ready to help în whathever you need, it's really close to The center.. a few subway station from the center-with line 2.. You can get easy to Grand via, plaza Mayor, palacio Real..We couln't choose better hotelThank you Ibis Centro de las Ventas!
hotelName:
27    ibis Madrid Centro Las Ventas
38    ibis Madrid Centro Las Ventas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I went to Madrid to meet up with friends and know the city because I studied there for a semester. I just stayed at this hotel last weekend. Before I arrived, I almost changed my reservation to stay closer to the Gran Via, but glad I did not!!!!!!! It was a great location with the metro across the street and also a nice walk to different areas of the city. There is are places to eat all around and a couple of supermarkets if you just want to buy a bottle of water. The staff was incredibly nice!!!!!!!!! The breakfast buffet was included and was satisfying and typical of an European breakfast. My one little minor complaint, I wish their were electric outlets closer to my bed or on the side of the bed. I would stay there again!!
hotelName:
27    ibis Madrid Centro Las Ventas
38    ibis Madrid Centro Las Ventas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for a second time after our first visit a few years back was faultless.The two key features for us were location and price - it's literally across the road from a metro station and you can be within the city centre in minutes. It's also much cheaper than most central Madrid accommodation, and you know you're getting a good standard.The only reason I can't award it 5 stars is because the rooms are still somewhat lacking - no safe's in the room, TV could only pick up a handful of channels and the air-con struggles if the temperature outside goes above 30. It's a two minute walk down the road from a good selection of local cafe's and restaurants, as well as a few burger places.Don't let any of the above put you off though - the staff were brilliant, the rooms were kept spotless. I'd stay here again.
hotelName:
27    ibis Madrid Centro Las Ventas
38    ibis Madrid Centro Las Ventas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this hotel last year and had a great stay, so we didn’t think twice about booking it again. We stayed in a superior room last time, which had a seating area next to the tv and a raised platform with seating next to the window.This year we decided to book one of the penthouse rooms with an outdoor terrace/patio expecting it to be as large as the room we had last year, we were wrong.On entering, the room was a weird shape, narrow entrance hall, straight into the desk area. There was a huge pillar in the centre of the room and there was very little room either side of the bed. The terrace though was brilliant! Large and quite private, with two chairs and a table. We loved the view over the city and las ventas. We were here during the heatwave in mid to late June.....the air con system just could not cope so we took matters into our own hands and purchased a room fan from the shop next door, €15 we didn’t have to spend but it made sleeping a lot easier!There are no tea/coffee facilities in these rooms so take a travel kettle! This led to another problem with the room, only one plug socket, under the desk. Annoying to the modern traveller, when you have phones and cameras to charge!The staff are really friendly here and our room was serviced daily to a good standard. Location is ok with a metro stop opposite and plenty of restaurants nearby. If you don’t want to stay in the thick of the tourist hotspots, this is your place! This is also reflected in the price, as it is much cheaper than other ibis/Accor hotels in Madrid city centre.
hotelName:
27    ibis Madrid Centro Las Ventas
38    ibis Madrid Centro Las Ventas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When I was there, I noted anything goods and bads. Breakfast was good, but Parking was bad. I reserved one type of habitation, but I received other different. The street was in maintenance, but no problem. Other things was good.
hotelName:
27    ibis Madrid Centro Las Ventas
38    ibis Madrid Centro Las Ventas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This facility is way better than the price would suggest. Great facility is a cool and clean part of town. I will definitely recommend to friends. Great service, friendly staff and very clean. Beautiful stay.
hotelName:
27    ibis Madrid Centro Las Ventas
38    ibis Madrid Centro Las Ventas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel. Rooms big and very clean. Everything works well. Bed and pillows comfy. Very close to Main Street but not too close to be noisy. Very nice bakeries close by. Highly recommend with friendly staff.
hotelName:
28    Suites Viena Plaza De Espana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel located in Espania Square, close to the metro line which has the same name as the market (Spain) We had the double room without breakfast. The clean, friendly staff helped us with everything we needed. We will return with love.
hotelName:
28    Suites Viena Plaza De Espana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rooms are small, but who goes to Madrid to be in a hotel room. Room was clean. The kitchenette was a pleasant surprise even though we didn't use it. Breakfast was good and the staff was wonderful. Can't beat the location; close to everything!
hotelName:
28    Suites Viena Plaza De Espana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff is very nice with clients. Breakfast is very good with many choice for international customers.I had a spacious room very clean BUT there are a lot of noise (like an engine motor, perhaps a lift). It was quite disturbing.
hotelName:
28    Suites Viena Plaza De Espana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is our regular place to stay in Madrid.Well located yet away from the crowds and noise of Sol.Excellent staff, quiet rooms at the back , good wifi ,nice breakfast,TV channels in English and French, comfortable beds on the hard side and useful kitchenette( El corte Ingles 7 minutes away for a vast selection of food)
hotelName:
28    Suites Viena Plaza De Espana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I loved Suites Viena ("SV").The hotel is great, but I loved the location. It's two blocks off Pl de Espana, which means quiet, convenience, and transportation. The hotel is in a quiet street but there are many shops and restaurants nearby. It's a quick walk to Gran Via, the Royal Palace, and Sol / Plaza Mayor. You can even walk to Retiro and the museums in about 25-30 minutes. The Pl de Espana metro stop is very close as well and makes for a quick trip to the airport (about 40 minutes) and Atocha (20-30 minutes).The hotel is nice, looks pretty new (but I think it's been there a while). The room was much bigger than I expected. The staff were pretty nice, esp the housekeepers. Wifi worked well in my room. I didn't do the hotel breakfast - there are many nearby breakfast places (Cafe y Te, Faborit, Starbucks, etc). There's a safe and a little fridge in my room as well as a kitchenette. There's a little supermarket nearby if you want to make/eat breakfast in bed. The hotel has a garage.The hotel was a great value. I would pick SV again for a stay in Madrid. I loved it.
hotelName:
28    Suites Viena Plaza De Espana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my second visit to this hotel in the past 3 years. I liked it so much the first time, that when I knew I was going to be in Madrid again, I was eager to book here as soon as possible. I got the junior suite with a terrace, which was absolutely great. The terrace was perfect for our toddler to run around there. Everything was spotless. As the first time, no noise from adjacent rooms. Very quiet sleep all around, and very professional service from the staff. Highly recommend this hotel!
hotelName:
28    Suites Viena Plaza De Espana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a very friendly place to stay and the staff at breakfast are very helpful.Our room was cleaned every day to a good standard.It is a quiet hotel but that was what we wanted.Just a 10 minute walk to the Royal Palace and 5 mins from the metro stations. The hotel is down a side street and so the views from the bedrooms are not great, however, as a base for exploring Madrid, we were very hapoy
hotelName:
28    Suites Viena Plaza De Espana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location Very near of the more important turistic loctions in Madri Near of the subway e bus stationKind staff Spacious roons with a litlle kitchen with helps famillys Travellers I will recomend specially for famillys
hotelName:
28    Suites Viena Plaza De Espana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is well located for a tourist visit. The staff are very friendly and helpful. My room was very nice and comfortable though it lacked a chair. My one suggestion would be to reduce the single use plastics and fibers. I appreciate a hotel that places an emphasis on the environment in all of its operations and disposable items need to be abandoned.
hotelName:
29    Hotel CoolRooms Atocha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: CoolRomms Atocha is a wonderful boutique hotel. Situtated beautifuly in the center of the city, in a narrow old streed surrounded by beautiful old buildings. The rooms were so beautiful! Every detail was carefully chosen. The room was very spacious, every piece of furniture was actually breathtaking! The bathrooms are most exceptional: a huge room with a huge double shower, carefuly designed. A big surface around the sinks, gives you enough room to put all your staff (not very common in hotel bathrooms). The staff was very welcoming and gracious. Really - A perfect hotel!
hotelName:
29    Hotel CoolRooms Atocha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The best hotel!! Evert thing is more then great. The location, the rooms, the breakfest, and all the team was so kind and helpfull, especially,ALEXIS,that always wanted to help us and his advices was the best.
hotelName:
29    Hotel CoolRooms Atocha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located in the center,max 15 min walk to every attraction, this hotel offers spacious rooms, beautifully and luxuriously decorated. (We took the junior suit) Huge bathroom space with double cinc. Well stocked mini bar and espresso machine. Soft bed and comfortable sofas. Better even in reality than it looks on the internet. Nice breakfast, helpful staff. (One small remark for management: hyginic bags and toilet brush needed in bathroom). Will definitely book this hotel again next time in Madrid
hotelName:
29    Hotel CoolRooms Atocha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The best hotel I been in, everything was great!!!! The rooms are big, stunnig bathroom,Great location!!! Very clean! The breakfast could be beter... No vegtables..I reccomend this hotel we had a great time!,
hotelName:
