29    Hotel CoolRooms Atocha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was in this hotel on my last visit to Madrid and it was a very successful option. All the staff had a very cordial and attentive treatment. In addition, the location of the hotel is great, close to the city center, which makes it very accessible.
hotelName:
29    Hotel CoolRooms Atocha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very recommended hotelWe stay 4 adults and sleep at 3 rooms bedroom with 2 large bathroom. The hotel have agreat location, great service and good breakfast. We defently will come back next timeThe human staff at the reception, restaurants and the doormans/women are fantastic and thats what make this hotel so good!!! Thanks for all!!
hotelName:
29    Hotel CoolRooms Atocha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was slightly disappointed in my recent stay here. The hotel is not bad, its in a great location and the staff is very accommodating. But I think they are trying too hard to be "cool" and in doing so they kind of sacrifice function and convenience. Lobby is relatively unimpressive and oddly laid out. Hotel is quite dark and musty. Rooms are huge yes, but almost too big. I reserved a premium room because it said it had a tub and it didn't so they kindly upgraded us to a junior suite - again, staff is great. The room is enormous, but not really a good use of space or decorated very well. The color scheme was a bit drab, all browns, furniture in the sitting area was very hard and not comfortable. The bed linens are nice, but mattress was a bit too firm for our liking. Bathroom was huge and had nice molton brown toiletries. On the last day, the bathroom smelled a bit like mold or sewage and the toilet clogged. They fixed right away however. For as big as the room is they have plenty of space to put a full length mirror, but instead they have one inside the closet door which doesn't really open that wide and hard to use. We ordered room service one evening and it wasn't very good. Location is good, close to Centro. Staff is amazing and very accommodating tht room. I give them A+. The towels and linens and all great. The hotel was quiet, I never heard my neighbors. They do have a nice pool -shallow though- which would be nice in the summer. Courtyard in back is also quite pleasant. Had it not been raining we would have spent more time there. Overall it was okay. I just think they are trying too hard. I probably wouldn't stay here again. Maybe it's just not for us.
hotelName:
29    Hotel CoolRooms Atocha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent and attentive staff! I wish I can remember all their names. Noelia, Guillermo, Diego and Pedro were awesome. We arrived early and our room was already available. Room was spacious and clean and king size bed was very comfortable. Bathroom was amazing, especially the shower and sink. There was more than enough closet space to put clothes away and store luggage. Safe was a plus. There was a good selection for the breakfast buffet and eggs can be made to order. Location was the best as it was close to the metro and walking distance to the major attractions. Wish we had more time to explore the hotel more. Since it was November, we didn't venture outside to enjoy the pool area. Will definitely stay here again and recommend this gem to anyone who wants to visit Madrid.
hotelName:
29    Hotel CoolRooms Atocha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A great choice in the centre of Madrid; easily accessible by public transport and from the airport by Metro. The hotel is within walking distance of all the attractions that central Madrid has to offer.The staff were friendly and helpful and check in was efficient. My room on the 7th floor was adequate for a city stay - typical European size, but spacious enough not to feel crammed. The room was clean and in good condition with complimentary tea/coffee making facilities. The en-suite washroom with a shower had complimentary Avena products as well as large comfortable dressing gowns.Breakfast was served at El Gato Canalla and although not massive had everything you’d need from a breakfast buffet - cheeses, meats, vegetables, juices, breads, cereals and more. Gluten free products are available on the buffet as well as bread rolls on request. If your rate is inclusive of breakfast then in addition to the buffet, you get the choice of a hot meal from the a la carte menu. The evening menu is also very interesting and reservations are recommended especially at the weekend, as we were not able to get a walk in table, even though we arrived early while the restaurant was still empty.The bar by reception is also a nice place to relax and have a drink.During our stay, the Sky Lounge and rooftop pool were closed for renovation. The one thing that I found extremely disappointing about my stay, was the initial contact I had with the hotel prior to arrival. Three days prior to arrival, I e-mailed the hotel advising of my late evening arrival and requesting a room close to friends who were also staying at the hotel at the same time. Without even acknowledging my request, the reservations staff proceeded to pre-charge the payment for the room (I booked a flexible rate), and for some reason were unable to do so. I then received an email informing me of this and advising me that if payment is not sorted within 48 hours they would have to cancel my booking. I found this to be very unwelcoming, and had my friends not been staying at the hotel too, I would have cancelled and booked elsewhere. Having spoken to my bank, I responded that there was no issue with the card they had on file, and requested they try again, which they did with no issues. A day later, they acknowledged my initial request. I feel they could have managed this in a more welcoming manner - if it was important for them to pre-authorise payment that early, given that my rate allowed me to cancel free of charge until the evening before arrival, they could have pointed it out and still acknowledge my request. In a way, I was being told that without a guarantee of payment, they would not consider any requests.All in all, this was a very good stay in Madrid. There is a vast choice of hotels in the city, and I would still consider the Indigo, but I would certainly look at other options before deciding.
hotelName:
30    Hotel Indigo Madrid - Gran Via
62    Hotel Indigo Madrid - Gran Via
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Indigo brand has become my favourite in the IHG group as they are rapidly expanding the number of properties around the world. So when I was given a two day assignment in this area of Madrid it seemed like a good option. I was particularly taken by the line in the hotel's IHG Website PR; "take a cooling dip in our rooftop infinity pool" you just might expect to be able to do a few laps in the morning before starting work. Photos of said pool with a sunset background at the "right angles" looked far bigger than reality, it had me sold. Even better a few days before arrival I noted as a Spire member I had been upgraded to a suite.On check-in the supervisor apologised that my upgraded room had been sold you know how it is... well not really. But to make up they would give me the other suite for my second night. I explained I had an evening flight when I check out would it be possible to keep my room to just before 3pm (past the usual 2pm extension). He paused then agreed locked in I thought. First morning I headed to the pool which is part of their themed bar, with sunbeds and pool area down some steps for an early swim. No luck! Access via the bar does not open until 10am. So I go back a couple of hours later only to find a lone barman starting to set up. He says he will take me down as the changing room area was still locked. As I enter the area I trip on a raised door frame and the drop to the lower floor inside and fall flat on my face, quick reflexes limit my injury to a bruised hip and arm. In full view of the barman he is concern, and says it is a dangerous step and informs me a woman had broken her arm (or was it a leg) just a few weeks prior same spot... OK so NO SIGNS warning guests in any language or better still a ramp to avoid the drop. I mention it at the front desk to a couple of staff and nobody seems particularly concerned or aware of the woman's injury. As for the pool it is barely more than a plunge pool maybe 15m and is not heated so no more than 16C, so yes you will get "a cooling dip" as the sun does not hit the pool until the afternoon!My first room had no view other than the next building with limited natural light, the suite was spacious and comfortable but has no natural light whatsoever. The only highlight of the hotel for me is the sunset at the rooftop bar with some nice light food options to go with your drinks. I have waited until I returned home to write this review as I was too angry after checkout to give a fair appraisal. I landed at reception at 2:45pm to make my way to the airport. An inexperienced young lady on reception processed my account and advised me I had been charged fifteen Euros for my late checkout. I explained to her I had spoken with a supervisor when I arrived and he had approved the extension. She would have none of that and kept insisting on the payment. I asked to see the supervisor then the Duty manager until then she remained insistant. Around twenty years with IHG as a loyal member most in recent years at Spire level. The standard of staff (training) here is hit or mainly miss, especially if you don't speak Spanish. You are paying for the location.
hotelName:
30    Hotel Indigo Madrid - Gran Via
62    Hotel Indigo Madrid - Gran Via
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We staid there a total of 9 nights and the staff was incredible. We had interaction with several staff members and they were all just the best. They gave us great recommendations, helped us book train tickets, helped us with shows, etc. The location was perfect, the hotel super clean, beds were sooo comfortable. I will be staying again when I return to Madrid.
hotelName:
30    Hotel Indigo Madrid - Gran Via
62    Hotel Indigo Madrid - Gran Via
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, 2 mins from Callao metro station, round the corner from loads of lovely restaurants & within easy walking distance to everywhere we wanted to go in Madrid. Staff friendly, helpful & very efficient. Room fab with huge bed & great shower. Loved the roof top bar too. We will definitely stay here next time we are in Madrid. Highly recommend.
hotelName:
30    Hotel Indigo Madrid - Gran Via
62    Hotel Indigo Madrid - Gran Via
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a fantastic time in Madrid at the Hotel Indigo Gran Via.Anastasia and Alex, enthusiastic staff that went well beyond to ensure we had a wonderful time and provided invaluable recommendations and answers to our numerous questions.Thank you very much for your incredible service.The hotel is in a great location with easy access to the many sites Madrid has to offer. The Metro is very close by along with many good eating options and shopping.We had a fantastic stay. Thanks !
hotelName:
30    Hotel Indigo Madrid - Gran Via
62    Hotel Indigo Madrid - Gran Via
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Slightly mystified by this hotel’s rating. It’s OK but nothing special. Best bits are location and the excellent breakfast choice (though at €17 it should be good). Be aware that all the standard rooms face onto a very dark internal lightwell. The window also faces the bathroom so if you’re in bed it feels like you’re in a windowless cell! We asked to be moved as our first room on the 5th floor was so claustrophobic. They kindly moved us to the 9th floor which was a bit brighter as closer to the sky but still not great. Make sure you check out the Malasaña neighbourhood a couple of blocks north across Gran Via - lots of cool bars and cafes.
hotelName:
30    Hotel Indigo Madrid - Gran Via
62    Hotel Indigo Madrid - Gran Via
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 4 star boutique style hotel. Very modern and very clean. Staff eager to make sure you have all you need and that you’re happy with it. Rooftop bar has lovely view across the rooftops and good view of sunsets. Staff there really friendly. Had a great weekend (4nights) with hotel perfectly positioned in center of Madrid so you can reach any of places of interest easily. The only ‘average’ thing about the hotel was it’s food. Very unimaginative although quite tasty.
hotelName:
30    Hotel Indigo Madrid - Gran Via
62    Hotel Indigo Madrid - Gran Via
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were promoted to a nice spacy corner room at higher floor for being an elite member. Stepped into our room, found one bottle of local red wine as a courtesy welcome. Unfortunately, the A/C was not working. We had to "downgrade" to another double room. They offered complimentary breakfast for our inconvenience. The upscale breakfast is a surprise beyond our expectation. Super close to subway stations for all attractions. Calle Gran Via is active day and night for tons of activies and eatery. The only down side was the consturction next door at the time we stayed.
hotelName:
30    Hotel Indigo Madrid - Gran Via
62    Hotel Indigo Madrid - Gran Via
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The only positive thing about this hotel is location and reception staff.Extremely disappointed with the hotel itself, the lifts are painfully slow, they only have 2 and you can wait 10minutes for a lift to arrive.The rooftop pool is poorly designed, most of the sun is blocked by a canapé.It was also closed 2 out of 3 evenings we were staying due to ‘private’ functions. This is Not good.They have a very small bar downstairs in the courtyard.There is also construction work next door.It feels like the hotel has been squeezed in between 2 buildings.This is our first and last stay.
hotelName:
30    Hotel Indigo Madrid - Gran Via
62    Hotel Indigo Madrid - Gran Via
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a very comfortable and clean apartment with everything you want and in the best location!!! Above all, they have the best team to serve and manage guests needs and questions- Daniela, Hugo, Javier and Alberto- well done!
hotelName:
31    SmartRental Collection Gran Via Capital
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 5 days and the one word we kept saying was WOW!The location is fantastic, 20 meters from the metro and a short walk to all the best places! Plaza del sol, plaza mayor, San Miguel food market, plaza españa, everything!The appartment was huge, with a kitchen that had everything! Including a nespresso machine. Great shower too and very nice staff eager to help.In short, Wow.We will be back!
hotelName:
31    SmartRental Collection Gran Via Capital
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent in location, facility, space and equipments. Basically excellent in everything. Definitely the right place to be in Madrid.Within walking distance for most major attractions. Very close subway stations . The apartment equipped with everything you need as if you are in your own home .
hotelName:
31    SmartRental Collection Gran Via Capital
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 3ed time to Madrid with family, no other place to stay like this.1.location 2. Cleaness 3.Amenities 4.Decorate 5. Lobby service.Not our last time to Madrid, Always happy to get back there.Thank you
hotelName:
31    SmartRental Collection Gran Via Capital
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a nice time in This facility. Well equipped apartment with modern furniture and huge space. It has a nice view and a great location just in the centre of gran via. The most visited attractions are in a walking distance.The front desk lady (Danialla i think her name) made our stay wonderful and she was extremely helpful in guiding us where to go and how. She even booked tickets for us in advance.It was our 1 st time there but definitely not the last.
hotelName:
31    SmartRental Collection Gran Via Capital
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect place to stay if you want to explore Madrid by walk, especially when you travel with babies and you need that base to get back to quickly no matter where you are in the city.I stayed there with a large family and the rooms were big enough to accommodate all of us comfortably.The personnel are extremely helpful and always there when you need them, with a big smile.Great value for money that I’ll definitely recommend for family trips.
hotelName:
31    SmartRental Collection Gran Via Capital
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a two bedroom apartment on the 6th floor for a 5 night stay. The apartment was immaculately tidy and had everything you’d need if you were staying forever and was perfect for our group of 5 adults. The apartment block also housed a gym which was good quality, and a roof top terrace. This was great to watch the sun setting at night and to look out across the city. It did tend to get busy though and some youngsters did hog the seating which was annoying. The apartment block is smack in the middle of the busy part of Madrid and is the perfect location for visiting the sites. We were able to walk to everywhere we needed to go. A great apartment & a great location. Perfect for visiting a vibrant & beautiful city.
hotelName:
31    SmartRental Collection Gran Via Capital
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a one bedroom apartment for 4 persons. It is ok because you can close the door from living area and bedroom! The staff is very helpful an friendly! The position of via capital ist good to reach nearly everything by foot! So you can see, feel and get madrid to know, how it really is! The apartments are in good condition and the rooftop bar with pool an the overview on madrid is spectacular! Thx for the good time!
hotelName:
31    SmartRental Collection Gran Via Capital
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a fantastic 8 floor apartment with wonderful views. It was very spacious, with modern furnishings and all the appliances that a family with kids needs (washing mashine, dishwasher, iron, hairdriers). The apartment was also very clean and we were given a lot if towels (mostly brand new!)The location was also excellent - practically everything was in the walking distance (the Royal palace, Mercado San Miguel, Placa del Sol... all the restaurants, shops). There was no need to use the public transport at all. Furthermore, the taxi ride to and from the airport was quick and reasonably priced.The only downside to this great place was the poor wifi connection.
hotelName:
31    SmartRental Collection Gran Via Capital
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Centrally located the hotel was within 10 minutes walk of the Mercado and Plaza Mayor.Breakfast at Catalyna Atacha was wonderful! I loved the fuet salami, really delicious bread with ovo and tomato salsa; lots of hams and cheeses, sweet breads, delicious mini sandwiches with peppers and lettuce, and lots of fresh fruit and fruit juices. The yogurt tasted home made and I had it with goji berries, nuts, bee pollen and chia. The rooms were very clean with comfortable beds, TV, a safe and fridge. No fan in the large bathroom but a nice shower with a rain shower head and heated rods for towels. They provided a hairdryer. The only complaint was that the toilet had and off-gassing smell.
hotelName:
32    Catalonia Atocha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is a 10min walk from Atocha train station. All tourist sights are within walking distances (max walk was the catedral and palace which were a 30min walk). On arrival we were given free drinks tickets to use in the bar, in the room there was free bottled water. Also, in room was tea/coffee/kettle. Room was modern and spacious, bathroom big with a huge walk in shower. Drinks and food in the restaurant were very reasonable (less than I expected at a 4* hotel). Staff friendly and helpful. On checking out we were able to leave our bags at the hotel and collect them later. The only complaint I would have is that we were in an internal room, which meant we had a window (not a balcony door) that looked out onto a very tall rough wall. This was not particularly a problem as we didn't spend much time in the room. I didn't realise we had booked an internal room, so this detail needs checking when you make a booking. Breakfast was 17€ so we didn't bother with it. There are plenty of cafes around the hotel where you can get breakfast for a few euros!
hotelName:
32    Catalonia Atocha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First time in my life i have this bad experience to be accused of steal a luggage. I stayed in this hotel twice always for work purpose spending more tha EUR 3.000,00 for 5 rooms within this period and on my last stay I received a call from Daniel (Hotel Staff) saying that my group stolen a luggage from the hotel lobby. I have the worst feeling ever about this property and will never ever stay here again and/or indicate Catalonia Hotel to any of my contacts.They "somehow" found the "lost" luggage in the airport i don´t know how and said me that the problem is solved.Worst experience EVER
hotelName:
32    Catalonia Atocha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Professional and friendly staff members; hotel very well located; room confortable, clean, quite and well equiped. The price for the room was not excessive for the quality of the hotel but it was for breakfast.
hotelName:
32    Catalonia Atocha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights as part of our Globus Spanish Fiesta tour. The room was small with a queen bed. There was a safe and mini bar and effective air conditioning. The bathroom was very clean and had a wonderful walk-in shower.There was an excellent choice of hot and cold foods at the breakfast buffet. There are many restaurants within walking distance. The restaurant in the hotel does not have an extensive menu and the prices are reasonable.The staff are attentive and helpful.
hotelName:
32    Catalonia Atocha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I really liked the experience of staying in this hotel, its very vlean, very organized. Loved the breakfast, the food is really. I would stay over and over again. Plus the location is great, right in the center of the city.
hotelName:
32    Catalonia Atocha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: great place to stay as you can safely walk everywhere, eat good local food, be most comfortable in the roof terrace or lounge area, all are friendly, welcoming, and the price seems right. would stay there again without any hesitation;
hotelName:
32    Catalonia Atocha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just a 10 minute walk (uphill) from Atocha Station, this hotel is ideally situated for visiting the main tourist attractions. We had a balcony room on the sixth floor overlooking the street and although this is a busy spot, no street noise could be heard once the doors to the balcony were closed. The hotel is handily placed for cafes, restaurants and supermarkets and there is also a Metro stop right outside.Our room, like the hotel itself, was spotlessly clean and had everything we needed - from robes and slippers to comb and toothbrush! Breakfast was of the highest quality and there was a wide range of freshly prepared food - the fresh fruit salad was particularly delicious. All staff we encountered were friendly and efficient. We would highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
32    Catalonia Atocha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great stay in Atocha! Only stayed for one night but hotel and surroundings are great. Have also stayed in "Centro" and "Chueca", but I think this neighborhood is as nice as those. Great bars and restaurants,
hotelName:
32    Catalonia Atocha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was in an area of smaller streets south of the City centre, with a good range of bars and restaurants nearby; and an easy walk from the art galleries. Our room was spacious, quiet and comfortable with modern fittings. Thoroughly recommended.
hotelName:
33    Artrip Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I spent a really nice weekend in Artrip. The hotel is a restored house bought by the owner’s grandmother in the 1950’s although it has the most modern of features. It’s about 100 metres from the Metro and has lots of restaurants nearby. The staff are very helpful and friendly none more so than the owner Miguel, who is a mine of information and so willing and eager to be of help. There is a quiet passion and attention to detail about how everything is done, and there are great deals. You are in the heart of Madrid’s cultural area. We’ll be back.
hotelName:
33    Artrip Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our fourth visit to this hotel. Ideally situated in this lively barrio, and within walking distance of all the major sights of Madrid. Metro nearby if you feel lazy. Hotel is very clean comfortable and contemporary. Staff are all kind and helpful and multilingual. Excellent.
hotelName:
33    Artrip Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a pleasant stay. The hotel has a good location near Lavapies station; 10 minutes walk to Reina Sofia. 15 mins. Walk to el Prado/Thyssen. Very minimal reception floor. Three rooms per floor ( at least 1-5 floors) Free WiFi in the room and restaurant. The staff in general nice, polite and accommodating. The room was clean, fresh-looking, very minimal, no closest. One shower. Beds were comfortable , there is a fridge with free water, safety deposit box. There is a tea pot and fresh fruits available. Unfortunately being a light sleeper I ask for a quiet room away from streets. I got a fifth floor with street view and you can hear street noise, conversations, trash collection. Only drawback! If you choose to have breakfast in the hotel you will find great variety of breads, cold cuts, coffee and juices.
hotelName:
33    Artrip Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The girls at the desk and the owner, Miguel, were very helpful with any query or request. They cared for us as if we were family. Service was outstanding, excellent breakfast, room spacious and clean. Would certainly recommend - a gem!
hotelName:
33    Artrip Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’d define this place like, really cozy & family friendly. Well located, clean, the room is spacious, the staff is amazing, simple and delicious breakfast. I really felt like home! I recommend 100% :)
hotelName:
33    Artrip Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wow! I can not recommend this hotel highly enough! Totally exceeded my expectations. Greeted by a welcoming, helpful and friendly reception. Room was spacious, clean and modern. Convenient to Metro, walking distance to city centre. Loved the access to mobile wifi!
hotelName:
33    Artrip Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I can’t recommend this hotel more highly. It was centrally located, had lovely clean rooms and we were provided with a free WiFi dongle to use whilst sightseeing, for the duration of our stay. Jessica on reception was just gorgeous and so helpful. She let us check in early as our room was vacant and offered us breakfast on the day of checkin. I would love to stay here again and highly recommend this boutique hotel to anyone travelling to Madrid for business or pleasure.
hotelName:
33    Artrip Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely and well located hotel to explore Madrid. The family room is spacious, clean and fully equipped. Artrip hotel has very friendly and experienced staff. Jasmine is a great hostess. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
33    Artrip Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friend and I stayed here a few weeks ago and we were pleasantly surprised! This was definitely not your average "hostel". It was more like a 3 - 4 star hotel. Staff were friendly. I did email a few times before my trip to request twin beds in our room, but we were given a double bed instead, although this wasn't a big issue.The room was clean and cosy, and had a mini bathroom, TV, fridge, arm chair, dressing table and free toiletries plus our towels were changed every other day. It took a while for our air-con to kick in but it was fine after that. Breakfast was good and there was lots of variety. There was cereal, a range of hot drinks, orange/ apple juice, yoghurts, pastries, mini pizza slices, fruit, ham and cheese board and baguettes. Location on Gran Via was brilliant too as it was similar to Oxford Street so it was nice and central. We were a little thrown off by the outside of the building but it is basically a big apartment block with a different hostel on each floor. There are loads of bars, restaurants and shops within walking distance of the hotel and also several metro stations. My favourite restaurant was 'Salvador Bachiller's greenhouse' which was in the basement of a retail shop a few doors down and IT WAS AMAZING!!Overall, if you're after cheap and cheerful accommodation in the centre of Madrid, then Vitium Urban Suites is definitely the place to go!
hotelName:
19    Vitium Urban Suites
34    Vitium Urban Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed in onebof their lovely suites with an in-room tub and shower. The amenities were nice as well as the customer service. The location was nice, but a bit noisy and bright being right downtown. My husband and I didn't mind, however, just pull the shades and use ear plugs if it becomes an issue. We enjoyed people watching from our 4th floor room. The elevator is a bit small and slow, something to consider if taking the stairs is not an option for you.
hotelName:
19    Vitium Urban Suites
34    Vitium Urban Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very modern hotel. The decorations are very nice. The room was clean. The bed big enough for two. The bathroom was a bit small. Breakfast was very good. They'll cook eggs for you and you actually had real coffee to drink. Of course, don't expect Grade A coffee, but it was fine if you're not picky. The location is walkable to the Palace/Church and Plaza Espana. Metro is close from a couple of different stops. Even though I think the hotel was near full (if not completely full) it was very quiet. Downsides? Elevator is small (seems like a lot of them are in Europe) and slow. As I mentioned the bathroom was small. The a/c was turned off for the season as it seems that the heat and the a/c can't run at the same time. Beware if you're going in the Spring or Fall. We had an incident where I spilled a glass of wine and it went everywhere on the bed. Since it was evening, there was no housekeeping and the guy at the front desk had to scramble to find a broom and new sheets/blankets for the bed, but he managed to do it so that was nice.
hotelName:
19    Vitium Urban Suites
34    Vitium Urban Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice location in the center. The staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are ok but average. The breakfast is poor, coffee is very bad - better to have breakfast out. Next time will probably choose another place for stay
hotelName:
19    Vitium Urban Suites
34    Vitium Urban Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel was comfortable. Very central location in Gran Via. Almost everywhere was in walking distance. Room was clean and hotel staff was very helpful. If I go to Madrid again, I would stay in Vitium Urban Suites.
hotelName:
19    Vitium Urban Suites
34    Vitium Urban Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Check in went fine and room had everything we required, clean and tidy with a nice powerful shower. Bed confy and although our room overlooked the main road we could barely hear any outside noise. Breakfast was good although the cutlery and plates ect was not always very clean and it would be nice to be able to get a clean plate if you wanted to get more food, However there was always plenty and the maids were always friendly and would try and help although there english was not very good.Access to the room is via buzzer system where you have to press each time you want to get access from the road or onto each floor (card unlocks your room door) although most of the time they opened the door within a few seconds sometimes it felt longer and got a bit tiresome having to do it everytime. I appreciate it is for security but it would be car easier if the card gave you acceess to the front door and each floor. Not a major issue just something that could be improved. I would recommend this as a place to stay.
hotelName:
19    Vitium Urban Suites
34    Vitium Urban Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is well located in Madrid but too expensive if you add the parking charge. The information of the website does not provide the daily parking rate in order to allow travellers to compare with other hotels. The parking represented 62% of the room charge which I find is totally disproportionate and would of changed my mind of booking there. The management response to my complaint was not satisfactory. No elevator services, so if you have a lot of luggage I would not recommend.
hotelName:
19    Vitium Urban Suites
34    Vitium Urban Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Although Vitium Urban Suites is on the Gran Via, one of the main streets in Madrid, I think it's located just slightly too far northwest on the street to be entirely convenient. Closer to the metro stop Gran Via is a bit easier to get around. However, there are 2 metro stations very close (Santo Domingo & Plaza de Espana) and also tons of bars, restaurants, and shopping just outside the door.If you choose to take public transport from the airport, you can take the Cercanias rail to Chamartin, then transfer to the metro to Plaza de Espana. From there it's about a 5 minute walk.The building is currently (late March/ early April 2017) undergoing renovations. When you arrive at the hotel, the doorway is beneath scaffolding. It seemed the front door remained open during the day but then was locked at night, at which point you had to buzz to be let in. Although reception always buzzed you in promptly, I prefer locations where your keycard can also open the front door. Luckily there is an elevator, though small and slow. The door to the hotel itself is sometimes open or again sometimes you need to buzz.My room 511 did not face Gran Via but rather a smaller street behind it. However, the building opposite was undergoing construction, so it was a bit noisy when they began working in the morning. In addition, it faced several terraces, so if people are loud out on their terrace, you will hear it. Of course the hotel cannot control this but just be aware it may not be the quietest spot.The room was small but adequate; the bathroom was really tiny. A miniature sink and you practically touched the opposite wall while sitting on the toilet. The shower had good pressure and both a normal shower head and a rain shower (though I never did figure out how to use the rain shower). Both room and bathroom were clean and definitely looked new.Considering the size of the room, there was surprisingly decent storage space - a closet, several shelves, a large desk, and the top of the minibar. There was an easy to use safe in the closet. There was a sort of shelf along the wall behind the bed but no nightstand which would have been more convenient. Also no luggage rack.I did not use the minibar but it was well-stocked and not terribly expensive.The negative aspects: the wifi was terrible, constantly going in and out. I use roaming so I would start a Skype/ Whatsapp call anticipating using wifi, only to have it cut out at some point during the call and switch to data... be careful. And also, they twice did not bring me a new bathmat. I do not tend to reuse bathmats or towels and had in fact tossed the used, wet mat in the corner, only to discover when I returned to the room that they retrieved it. refolded it, and placed it back in the bathroom! That day they also did not bring me a fresh hand towel. I went to the desk and they were happy to give me a new mat and towel, but then the same thing happened the next day. This time when I went to the desk I was a little irritated and the man told me they only replace the bathmat every other day (though he did again give me a fresh one). This is super odd in a modern location such as this one when they do replace the rest of the towels daily.There were at least 4 people working at reception and some were friendlier than others, though all were helpful with buses, maps, etc.This is a okay choice if you get a great deal but I do not think I would seek out staying there again.
hotelName:
19    Vitium Urban Suites
34    Vitium Urban Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is very well located and very modern. Our room was clean, but it was very small and the bed was very uncomfortable. It squeaked everytime you turned yourself in bed and it was very noisy because of the traffic on Gran Via.
hotelName:
19    Vitium Urban Suites
34    Vitium Urban Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A four night break to see Madrid's galleries and the attractive prices offered at the end of August brought me to the Ibis Styles. Room very nicely appointed with good air conditioning and an excellent bathroom. Reception staff were most welcoming. Breakfast represents good value with a wide choice and very flavoursome coffee.
hotelName:
35    Ibis Styles Madrid Prado
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First trip into Spain brings me to Madrid. Choosing Ibis Styles comes as a natural choice as I’ve always enjoy my stay in Accor Hotels. Proximity to eateries and transportation network makes it a wonderful location!
hotelName:
35    Ibis Styles Madrid Prado
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is located in the central area of Madrid, close to the Puerto del Sol and Museum district. It is within walking distance of the main Atocha rail station. The room was a good size and the décor stylish. The Reception staff were generally friendly and helpful. There is a small supermarket about 150 metres from the hotel (in an adjacent side street).The breakfast menu is reasonably extensive and typical of the Ibis chain generally; the staff in the dining room were friendly and helpful. The free wi-fi worked extremely well, as did the air conditioning; in addition there was a refrigerator in the room which ran extremely quietly. However, there were no tea/coffee making facilities. Overall a very good hotel.
hotelName:
35    Ibis Styles Madrid Prado
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A super clean and efficient base for our Madrid visit. Wonderful helpful an efficient front staff! The rooms are well equipped and designed with great AC and water pressure. Super clean with a mini fridge and iron and safe provided. Close to many tapas bars and restaurants and just two blocks from plaza Santa ana. Walked almost everywhere. A full buffet breakfast was included with fruit, juices cereal eggs charcuterie with breads and pastries. A cappuccino coffee maker was put to good use. All the staff was friendly and particularly the front desk staff! Will be my only choice from now on! Recommend the 7th floor superior rooms.
hotelName:
35    Ibis Styles Madrid Prado
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My arrival was on Tuesday morning, the 4th. (I think I remember) We were attended by a girl named "Begoña" whom I thank for her words, her patience and her good treatment.Both the facilities and the stay were good. The hotel is very well located in the center. As a great point in favor is the treatment of the staff, very attentive.Greetings
hotelName:
35    Ibis Styles Madrid Prado
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: All tourist attractions of Madrid like the Prado Museum, Thyssen Museum, Reina Sofia Museum, Plaza Mayor, Real Palace, The Retiro Park, the botanical garden are all with in walking distance from the hotel. You find countless restaurants of all types of cuisine within 10 minutes of walking distance. The Attocha station is also just a kilometer away. So, even if I paid a bit more for the hotel (compared to other typical IBIS hotels), it is overall a very good deal. The rooms are quite big, with all basic amenities. The breakfast is fine.
hotelName:
35    Ibis Styles Madrid Prado
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Was staying in Spain for business and decided to spend an extra day sightseeing in Madrid, as I had never been. Pretty typical 3-star hotel, but I have to say, very good front desk staff, room was rather large, AC was excellent after a long day of walking, and the breakfast was fine. Really good location, and easy to walk to any number of plazas for a snack or dinner. Would definitely repeat. Excellent value. Only comment was that shampoo was not replaced after the first nite and there was no hair conditioner available.
hotelName:
35    Ibis Styles Madrid Prado
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The brand lives up to my expectations each time I stay here. Right in the heart ofSol, and walking distance to practically all the sights, Plaza Mayor, Museo del Prado, Puerta del Sol (obviamente), Gran Vía etc. I always book a room facing the street. Room is pretty in green and white. Good size, nice window, everything functional. And I don’t mind some noise of my dear tapas trail lovers since it’s a street facing room. It’s Madrid. It has life! Breakfast is perfect, you get what you pay for. Nothing bad, nothing exceptional. Beds are super comfortable! Air con works perfectly fine. Heating is great too, in winters. Front desk is great. Service is top quality. They store luggage too. The selling points of this hotel are location, service and functionality of the rooms. And it has laundry nearby. Just step out of the hotel, turn left, and walk on Calle de Leon, you will find Lavandería. Drop of your laundry and they will wash, dry and fold: and keep your bundle of clothes ready, nice and fresh for you. I use it each time and they are amazing. They dry clean too. Supermarkets, kiosks, pharmacies, restaurants... basically everything nearby. There is so much to do in Madrid, I don’t need a posh place to waste my time in a hotel. This hotel is just perfect in every way. I rate it 10/10.
hotelName:
35    Ibis Styles Madrid Prado
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location.Excelent service.Rooms are good enough with confortable beds and pillows and everything needed. Clean and working properly.Breakfast is not spectacular, but at least is much better than many other hotels I know.Recommended when in Madrid. Will eventually return to IBIS.
hotelName:
35    Ibis Styles Madrid Prado
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is a relatively small boutique hotel in a quiet neighbourhood. We found the service to be very good with a helpful concierge and front desk. They recommended an excellent restaurant a short walk from the hotel and also gave us a discounted late check out as we were not departing for the airport until 8pm. Many other hotels would have stuck to the full over night stay charge despite there being an empty room!The breakfast was good with enough variety and everything was fresh.We were in a Classic Double room which wasn't huge but just large enough. To make the best use of the space you walk through the wardrobe and bathroom space to get to the bedroom. A little different but a good use of space. We were on the 2nd floor off a main road and we were not affected by noise. Beds were firm and comfy.Whilst we didn't find this a downside it is a bit of a walk or a taxi ride to the main tourist spots. We walked to the Retiro and Plaza Major with the odd stop off at a few markets (recommended by the concierge) before walking back to the hotel and we clocked it at 15km.If coming back to Madrid, I would stay here again.
hotelName:
36    Relais & Chateaux Heritage Madrid Hotel
41    Relais & Chateaux Heritage Madrid Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff was so warm and welcoming from the moment that we arrived. Our room was beautiful with a pleasant view and our bed was comfortable. Their turndown service was an added bonus. Food was above and beyond. Would definitely stay again!
hotelName:
36    Relais & Chateaux Heritage Madrid Hotel
41    Relais & Chateaux Heritage Madrid Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful room only surpassed by the friendliness of the staff. Nothing was too much trouble, including organising with trip to the gym. The quality of the decor and room made me wish I was staying longer.
hotelName:
36    Relais & Chateaux Heritage Madrid Hotel
41    Relais & Chateaux Heritage Madrid Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The front desk is the stand out for us during our stay. The staff was friendly, helpful and some of the best we have met. The room was clean, quiet from street noise and just the right size. Continental breakfast was good; we always leave a bit of gratuity for the wait staff and they were appreciative. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
36    Relais & Chateaux Heritage Madrid Hotel
41    Relais & Chateaux Heritage Madrid Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was excellent. All of the hotel staff were courteous, kind and very helpful. Service amazing. Location was great - did not have any street noise. Our only regret was that our stay was too short. We definitely will return here.
hotelName:
36    Relais & Chateaux Heritage Madrid Hotel
41    Relais & Chateaux Heritage Madrid Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautifully curated property with a magical roofdeck bar. Superb personal service by friendly staff who are knowledgable about the local restaurants, tapas bars, and sights. The excellent breakfast was a step above the usual.
hotelName:
36    Relais & Chateaux Heritage Madrid Hotel
41    Relais & Chateaux Heritage Madrid Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently stayed here two different times during our travels through Spain on our Family vacation. This hotel really feels like you are home, living in luxury. The hotel was upscale, had a relaxing vibe, very comfortable rooms and the staff is so helpful in every way. Also it’s easy to walk around to explore fight from the hotel. We will not stay anywhere else on our next trip. I hope you enjoy it as much as we did
hotelName:
36    Relais & Chateaux Heritage Madrid Hotel
41    Relais & Chateaux Heritage Madrid Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location a few minutes walk from the upmarket shops in Serrano, this hotel provided us with a pleasant stay. In keeping with its name, the hotel was decorated with that ornate classic look that seems part of the Spanish tradition. Though on the small side, our room was spotlessly clean and fit for purpose. The standard of service was great as every request was greeted with a smile. Their recommendations for good restaurants nearby was also first class. Their own restaurant served top quality, fine dining food, albeit the service was a bit too formal for our liking. It seemed quiet on the nights we were there, which seems a pity as we would recommend it without hesitation.
hotelName:
36    Relais & Chateaux Heritage Madrid Hotel
41    Relais & Chateaux Heritage Madrid Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in hotel Heritage for one night, on our way back from vacation on the Costa del Sol.In the past, we have never stayed in Madrid mainly because we were afraid of traffic inside the city but also because of a lack of high-end hotels at a reasonable price.Hotel Heritage proved us wrong and we will certainly return.First of all, the welcome was fantastic. We were travelling with my father who is both very old and has trouble walking (stairs are impossible). The personnel did everyting they could to help my father out of the car and into his room as fast and comfortably as possible. There are2 different entries to the hotel, but each of them offers an elevator so we could easily avoid the stairs. The personnelcouldn't be more helpful and friendly than they were.Our 2 rooms (we were 4) were very spacious and had everything we could hope for. Bath and separate shower, separate toilet, small lounge with 2 comfortable chairs, complimentary bottle of water, bathrobes, slippers,...We are regular visitors of Relais & Chateaux hotels all over Europe, so yes a lot of these things are common but the size of the rooms, the design ("vieux chic") and the fact that there was absolutely nothing to make a remark about, really made this hotel stand out.In the evening, we had a great meal in the hotel restaurant, again with very nice personnel and a perfect maitre d'hötel who made excellent suggestions.It was less important for us, but the hotel is also very nicely located if you want to visit the city: not very far from the big museums and the most important shopping area.
hotelName:
36    Relais & Chateaux Heritage Madrid Hotel
41    Relais & Chateaux Heritage Madrid Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is probably one of my best hostel experiences. Fist of all. They don’t have bunk beds. Which is a nice change. The area is very touristy but it’s very convenient to everything. Staff was friendly and helpful. They have laundry and the place is kept clean. There are shared showers but each have their own room. So you have more privacy that the dorm style showers. There is free churros and chocolate every morning. It’s worth waking up for! Also free dinner is available every evening. Which I was unable to go to. But is great if you are alone or want to save money. I went on the free tour to Segovia. Tour guide was great. All we paid was the metro and bus ticket. And when we got there they showed us a cheap spot to eat. They also have other things to do. There is a pub tour and other free tours. In general they go out of your way to make you feel welcome. If you are traveling alone and especially if you are not the best social person this is the place to stay in Madrid.
hotelName:
37    Sungate One Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spain is a wonderful country with history, culture and fascinating tourist experiences. One great experience is staying here where everything is done to look after you. What is really great is the enthusiasm of the staff. During the day, free breakfasts and dinners are gastronomic and at night, everybody is quiet and the rooms are perfect. Bathrooms are very very clean but most of all, I like the helpfulness of the reception team. Hugo is my favourite but there are many more here...
hotelName:
37    Sungate One Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is one of the best hostels I've stayed in ever!All the staff are really friendly and make this place feel like home. They offee free dinner, day trips, night activities and more. This is the best option if you're a solo traveller and wanna meet people and have fun together.
hotelName:
37    Sungate One Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at Sungate One as a solo traveller for 3 nights in early May 2019. It was easy to access and incredibly central (please don't buy a tourist metro pass! I did but never used it as the hostel is in walking distance to everything). The hostel staff are amazingly helpful, and provide free dinner and breakfast (and not just any breakfast, we're talking churros and cake!) with the option to pop a few coins in a tip jar. The atmosphere in the common dining area is great, and an easy way to make friends. There is the opportunity to participate in drinking games and going out, but if that's not for you it's still easy to get a decent night's sleep without being disturbed. The place is incredibly clean and well maintained (and I say that as a bit of a neat freak). The only issue I had was with the quality of the beds - the lack of bunk beds was fantastic, don't get me wrong, but mine seemed to allow me to feel every single spring inside it, and all of them wanted to dig deep into my flesh. The pillow was also pretty pathetic. I certainly don't expect five star comfort at a hostel, but this was out of character for the place given how good it is otherwise. Despite the bed issue, I would 100% recommend Sungate One to other travellers, particularly solo. For the older age group, don't be put off! There were several solo female travellers in their 50/60's staying at the time, interspersed among the 20 year olds.
hotelName:
37    Sungate One Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I run a high end cleaning company in Essex. To my horror, my daughter announced that she was going to work in a hostel in Madrid. Two months in, I decided to pay her a visit with her best friend from home. I have never stayed in a hostel before and at 47 years of age I found it quite a nerve-wracking experience. I could not have been more pleasantly surprised and relieved. The hostel was as clean as any house I have ever seen or cleaned ; the staff and volunteers were more helpful than you can imagine. If your teenage child is thinking of travelling abroad and working there way round I would highly recommend Sungate One hostel. I have come away feeling my child is safe-but they sure know how to party, I now have to take a day off of work just to recover.Incredible,undescribalbe experience.
hotelName:
37    Sungate One Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean hostel in a convenient location. The staff are motivated to create a social atmosphere with many activities during both the days and nights. The free dinner every night is also a great opportunity to meet the other people in the hostel.
hotelName:
37    Sungate One Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful hostel great staff and awesome location- it really doesn’t get much better than this! The beds are not bunk bed style which if you’ve been traveling for a while is a huge plus! With a great combo of group dinner optional day and night activities you may come to this hostel alone, but by the end of your stay you will leave with plenty of great friends. The staff is also wonderful Tobias is so welcoming and really helpful when it comes to eats in the city and Ester will always make sure you have somebody to dance with on the night activities! Overall 15 out of10 would recommend every time!!
hotelName:
37    Sungate One Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was traveling solo and I think staying here was one of the best choices I made. The food there was amazing and so was the company and the pub crawls were the best. I had the best time in Madrid with the best people :)
hotelName:
37    Sungate One Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Gives lots of free stuff:- "churros all the time"- breakfast (if cake and churros + chocolates can be counted)- free tours of city (4hrs) and day trips (toledo.. etc.)- maps with info- wifi - lunch- dinnervery nice staff and very sociable atmosphere. The decoration really gives a good aesthetic. The rooms are pretty basic, but standard for hostels. Not sure if the price is worth, but definitely really nice.P.S. The entrance does not look obvious at all. It is small and has only a tiny sign, to get in press the bell and someone will answer, after that they will give you the password so you can get to it yourself this time.
hotelName:
37    Sungate One Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall very disappointed with the Ibis. We booked this room because it was reasonable value, allowed pets and had free parking. When we arrived we were immediately told the parking was not available so we had to drive around the corner (+€24). We were charged €15 for our dog as well (we later discovered that the literature said it was €10). The room was ok, but much smaller than pictured when we booked, and the window opened to an alley directly facing a bleak wall - very depressing and dark! The buffet breakfast was €9 and did not include any hot food. We also ordered two €9 pizzas to our rooms and were charged €25 on checkout. Overpriced and not in the best location either. We won't be staying there again!
hotelName:
27    ibis Madrid Centro Las Ventas
38    ibis Madrid Centro Las Ventas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a very good experience at this hotel. It is very well located, next to the Bull Ring which we could see every day at breakfast. Service is very good, breakfast is good and the location of the breakfast area is really nice. Overall a very good experience. We would stay there again. Specially for the easy access to Metro.
hotelName:
27    ibis Madrid Centro Las Ventas
38    ibis Madrid Centro Las Ventas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Being accor status holder, it was a no brainer that we would book an accor property. We made a small mistake of going by the name - Centro. This is no where close to the city center but is very accessible none the less. Very close to metro and on the Hoho bus route. If you are planning to explore Madrid - Not a bad choice.
hotelName:
27    ibis Madrid Centro Las Ventas
38    ibis Madrid Centro Las Ventas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 1 night at this hotel, and we'll deffinetely come back if we visit Madrid again, The room is a little small, but for us was enought, The view from the room and The restaurant=wonderfull, a very tasty and fresh breakfast, a very good cofee and pastery, stuff at The reception very kind,always ready to help în whathever you need, it's really close to The center.. a few subway station from the center-with line 2.. You can get easy to Grand via, plaza Mayor, palacio Real..We couln't choose better hotelThank you Ibis Centro de las Ventas!
hotelName:
27    ibis Madrid Centro Las Ventas
38    ibis Madrid Centro Las Ventas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I went to Madrid to meet up with friends and know the city because I studied there for a semester. I just stayed at this hotel last weekend. Before I arrived, I almost changed my reservation to stay closer to the Gran Via, but glad I did not!!!!!!! It was a great location with the metro across the street and also a nice walk to different areas of the city. There is are places to eat all around and a couple of supermarkets if you just want to buy a bottle of water. The staff was incredibly nice!!!!!!!!! The breakfast buffet was included and was satisfying and typical of an European breakfast. My one little minor complaint, I wish their were electric outlets closer to my bed or on the side of the bed. I would stay there again!!
hotelName:
27    ibis Madrid Centro Las Ventas
38    ibis Madrid Centro Las Ventas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for a second time after our first visit a few years back was faultless.The two key features for us were location and price - it's literally across the road from a metro station and you can be within the city centre in minutes. It's also much cheaper than most central Madrid accommodation, and you know you're getting a good standard.The only reason I can't award it 5 stars is because the rooms are still somewhat lacking - no safe's in the room, TV could only pick up a handful of channels and the air-con struggles if the temperature outside goes above 30. It's a two minute walk down the road from a good selection of local cafe's and restaurants, as well as a few burger places.Don't let any of the above put you off though - the staff were brilliant, the rooms were kept spotless. I'd stay here again.
hotelName:
27    ibis Madrid Centro Las Ventas
38    ibis Madrid Centro Las Ventas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this hotel last year and had a great stay, so we didn’t think twice about booking it again. We stayed in a superior room last time, which had a seating area next to the tv and a raised platform with seating next to the window.This year we decided to book one of the penthouse rooms with an outdoor terrace/patio expecting it to be as large as the room we had last year, we were wrong.On entering, the room was a weird shape, narrow entrance hall, straight into the desk area. There was a huge pillar in the centre of the room and there was very little room either side of the bed. The terrace though was brilliant! Large and quite private, with two chairs and a table. We loved the view over the city and las ventas. We were here during the heatwave in mid to late June.....the air con system just could not cope so we took matters into our own hands and purchased a room fan from the shop next door, €15 we didn’t have to spend but it made sleeping a lot easier!There are no tea/coffee facilities in these rooms so take a travel kettle! This led to another problem with the room, only one plug socket, under the desk. Annoying to the modern traveller, when you have phones and cameras to charge!The staff are really friendly here and our room was serviced daily to a good standard. Location is ok with a metro stop opposite and plenty of restaurants nearby. If you don’t want to stay in the thick of the tourist hotspots, this is your place! This is also reflected in the price, as it is much cheaper than other ibis/Accor hotels in Madrid city centre.
hotelName:
27    ibis Madrid Centro Las Ventas
38    ibis Madrid Centro Las Ventas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When I was there, I noted anything goods and bads. Breakfast was good, but Parking was bad. I reserved one type of habitation, but I received other different. The street was in maintenance, but no problem. Other things was good.
hotelName:
27    ibis Madrid Centro Las Ventas
38    ibis Madrid Centro Las Ventas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This facility is way better than the price would suggest. Great facility is a cool and clean part of town. I will definitely recommend to friends. Great service, friendly staff and very clean. Beautiful stay.
hotelName:
27    ibis Madrid Centro Las Ventas
38    ibis Madrid Centro Las Ventas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have been staying in different type of hotels during my trips to maybe more than 40 countries but I would like to really underline this hotel as a super experience... it has everything for a boutique experience... Nespresso and chocolates in the room, cava on arrival, friendly staff, perfect room sizes for people with babies that need a crib in the room...All amenities from Rituals.... and I even haven’t mentioned the location yet... it is in the very heart of Madrid... to the right gran via to the left cibeles... Very nice bar area warm and cozy for a chat...would definitely be our hotel when we are back... ❤️❤️
hotelName:
39    H10 Villa de la Reina Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I had a wonderful six night stay at the H10 Villa de La Reina recently. Immediately upon our arrival, we were greeted by the desk staff and offered a glass of sparkling wine as we checked in. The experience at the desk set the tone for the rest of our stay. During our stay, the desk staff never failed to say good morning every day and have a good day as we left and welcome back, when we returned to the hotel. Pablo was especially helpful at the desk, going above and beyond to be helpful. Our experience at the front desk extended to the other areas of the hotel. Our room was clean and nicely decorated.The bed was very comfortable and the sheets and blankets smelled fresh and clean. The breakfast was superb. Fresh cooked eggs, a good selection of fresh fruit and juices and several types of meats were available. Fran made sure that a basket of fresh rolls and croissants were on your table as soon as you were seated. The lounge/bar area was a very comfortable place to end the day and enjoy a drink. I was unfamiliar with the various vermouth served in Spain and was surprised to see that the bar had Yzaguirre Vermouth on tap. Geena offered me a sample and I became an immediate convert. What a great location to sit and relax, sip a vermouth and unwind. Another important part of the hotel is its central location. It is a short walk to most sights in central Madrid. We never needed a taxi to get around to see the sights. We had such a pleasant stay that we have already made plans to return to the H10 Villa de La Reina. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking in downtown Madrid for a great place to stay.
hotelName:
39    H10 Villa de la Reina Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel has an old-school charm. Very nice main lobby with bar area for relaxing. Our room was a moderate size with a good size bathroom with a nice shower. There were 2 closets, but no chests for clothing. The room was clean and the bed comfortable. There were also no windows. The staff was pleasant and helpful. They have a very nice breakfast area on the lower level, that served a yummy and hearty assortment of items each morning. We walked all over the city, seeing the sites (our first visit to Madrid), but getting a taxi was easy as well. Gran Via is a VERY busy street, full of shopping and restaurants. The sidewalks are always mobbed. We enjoyed walking in the neighborhood behind the hotel, which was much less crowded, but still had shopping and restaurants. We stayed 4 nights.
hotelName:
39    H10 Villa de la Reina Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely hotel - beautifully decorated. Clean and full of personality and charm, from the original elevator (there is also a modern one) to the tiles there is colour and character. We stayed in room 602 - top floor with a balcony and it was lovely. The housekeeping was also done very well. When we originally booked they could not supply us with the champagne we like (it was our wedding anniversary) however they contacted my wife months later as they had a new supplier and organised the champagne for us. A lovely touch! Would highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
39    H10 Villa de la Reina Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is clean and bed comfortable. However, I did not like this hotel. It is located in Gran Via and it was so overwhelmingly crowded. I also found the hallways very dark. It had no windows. Carpeting was black and lower portion of hallway walls were painted in black. They also used energy saver lighting which did not help at all. I felt that this made the hotel feel like a budget hotel. Breakfast was also a disappointment. Bacon was sitting in a lot of grease and eggs looked wet. They had Churros but no chocolate. Pastries tasted like they were purchased from a cheap supermarket. I ordered an omelette and it took them about 25 min to bring it out. I kindly asked them to follow up on it a couple of times and each time they said it was coming. When it finally came, it was so salty that I couldn’t really eat it. Housekeeping also made a lot of noise outside our room at 7:45 on Saturday morning so we could not really sleep in. All in all, not a very pleasant stay.
hotelName:
39    H10 Villa de la Reina Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I travelled with 16 ladies to Spain this October. We stayed at the H10 Villa de la Reina hotel on The Gran Vía (main street). My room was a Basic double room. We stayed for 3 nights. The hotel is centrally located and within walking distance to the famous Puerta del Sol. The regular room size is small (13-15 Square meter). The breakfast was very good, with tasty pan-fried eggs in olive oil. SEE photos.
hotelName:
39    H10 Villa de la Reina Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location on the Gran Via is excellent, very central. And I found it safe to go back in the evening with so many people still being on the street. Personnel is friendly and helpful, check-in was quick. I had a budget room which was larger than I expected - well enough for one person, maybe a bit tight for two. It had a window to the small inner court and thus didn't have any noise from the street. The interior wasbeautiful in a classical style, with all modern amenities in the bathroom. Breakfast was very good with lots of different things.
hotelName:
39    H10 Villa de la Reina Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a lovely hotel with a modern interpretation of Madrid decor. The bar and lobby are exactly as the pictures describe. The breakfast room is beautiful and provides a variety of breakfast items (cooked, continental, pastries, fruits, yoghurts etc..) The staff are friendly and we particularly liked Javier on reception. The location in my opinion was on the better end of the gran via. My only downside would be that we had what I would deem to be an Internal room - but given the reviews on noise from the gran via - perhaps this wasn’t a bad thing!
hotelName:
39    H10 Villa de la Reina Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We picked this as it is in between the museums and the Royal Palace. It is a refuge from the busy Gran Via. It has been modernize but still keeping some local color which we loved. The furnishings have been thought out well, except for two things in our room. Our window and there are two (one in the bathroom) are frosted since it faces the courtyard/air shaft and across the other 2 rooms. Although it was comfortable it could be claustrophobic after a couple of days. Another thing is that we were placed next to the maids closet. So it could be noisy during siesta. Lastly the signature artpiece in our room is forced into a corner when the facing wide wall is empty. It is a lovely hotel but we have to get a different room next time.
hotelName:
39    H10 Villa de la Reina Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: *Stay at this hosel from Oct 6th 2019 until Oct 9th 2019*This hostel located near the centre area where people always gather: Puerta del Sol, Gran Via. *The house keeping who clean the room threw away my luggage cover and I realize it when the last day I wanted to check out and couldn’t find it anywhere. The cleaning service must know the they cannot throw away people stuff. Please note this. Also my room mate told that she lost her tooth paste, and maybe it got “cleaned” by the cleaning service staff.Also the room is not everyday get cleaned. On the second day I stayed, when I got back to the hostel at night and found out the dust bin were full of paper toilet, nobody cleaned it.*The kitchen is adequate when speaking about the space, but I feel it is like a claustrophobic when you are doing your cooking in this kitchen because with the shut door, and it feels like you are trapped in the kithcen with no fresh air.
hotelName:
40    Las Musas Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Me and my friend had a great stay here. The room where clean, the locations was good and the beds where superduper great. The only thing we had a problem with was the thin walls... We could here almost every word spoken in the next room or outside the corridor. But all and all, nice place
hotelName:
40    Las Musas Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My stay at this hostel has been pleasant. It's in a very centric point in the city and it's surrounded by shops and other stores that you may need. The metro is close and you can go walking to several touristic places. The hostel is clean, cozy and cosmopolitan. The staff is friendly and of great help.
hotelName:
40    Las Musas Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is a great hostel to stay for a few nights. It has more perks than most hostels and the staff is quite attentive. The walls are thin but I slept well. Always hot water and breakfast provided by the hostel. It has plenty of light and the internet is very fast.Has lockers to store the goods. And the kitchen is fully equipped for cooking a meal.
hotelName:
40    Las Musas Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent a night here because it was available. I was surprised at how nice the staff is and how cool the bar area is. The rooms are okay and the location is good. This hostel doesn't get the greatest rep but its pretty cool.
hotelName:
40    Las Musas Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hostel, well organized, friendly staff, international environment and a lot of activities organized by the staff! About the latter, I tried the PubCrawl guided by Alan, and I had a lot of fun! 100% suggested.
hotelName:
40    Las Musas Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friend and I stayed in the hostel over a weekend and it was a good choice. The staff is super friendly, the hostel clean and the location perfect.Additionally, we joined the pubcrawl twice! Our guide Alan was courteous and we had heaps of fun, we can just recommend it.
hotelName:
40    Las Musas Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Worst hostel of my 2 month eurotrip. Late check in but with early(ish) check out in the morning. No hairdryers in private rooms with ensuite (only hostel I’ve stayed at that doesn’t have this), cold room with draft from ‘closed’ old windows. Paper thin walls they give you earplugs for. Meh location, heard women screaming down on the street 2X in the one night I stayed. Won’t be back. Staff not that friendly (except 1 guy), more consumed with chatting amongst themselves. Only positive I’d give is that it does seem like a social hostel with a busy kitchen/common room.
hotelName:
40    Las Musas Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in this hostel with a friend just for two nights, but it's been enough to say that it's a really nice hostel, well located and with great staff, in particoular Alan who leaded an amazing pubcrowl! :)
hotelName:
40    Las Musas Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is a relatively small boutique hotel in a quiet neighbourhood. We found the service to be very good with a helpful concierge and front desk. They recommended an excellent restaurant a short walk from the hotel and also gave us a discounted late check out as we were not departing for the airport until 8pm. Many other hotels would have stuck to the full over night stay charge despite there being an empty room!The breakfast was good with enough variety and everything was fresh.We were in a Classic Double room which wasn't huge but just large enough. To make the best use of the space you walk through the wardrobe and bathroom space to get to the bedroom. A little different but a good use of space. We were on the 2nd floor off a main road and we were not affected by noise. Beds were firm and comfy.Whilst we didn't find this a downside it is a bit of a walk or a taxi ride to the main tourist spots. We walked to the Retiro and Plaza Major with the odd stop off at a few markets (recommended by the concierge) before walking back to the hotel and we clocked it at 15km.If coming back to Madrid, I would stay here again.
hotelName:
36    Relais & Chateaux Heritage Madrid Hotel
41    Relais & Chateaux Heritage Madrid Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff was so warm and welcoming from the moment that we arrived. Our room was beautiful with a pleasant view and our bed was comfortable. Their turndown service was an added bonus. Food was above and beyond. Would definitely stay again!
hotelName:
36    Relais & Chateaux Heritage Madrid Hotel
41    Relais & Chateaux Heritage Madrid Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful room only surpassed by the friendliness of the staff. Nothing was too much trouble, including organising with trip to the gym. The quality of the decor and room made me wish I was staying longer.
hotelName:
36    Relais & Chateaux Heritage Madrid Hotel
41    Relais & Chateaux Heritage Madrid Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The front desk is the stand out for us during our stay. The staff was friendly, helpful and some of the best we have met. The room was clean, quiet from street noise and just the right size. Continental breakfast was good; we always leave a bit of gratuity for the wait staff and they were appreciative. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
36    Relais & Chateaux Heritage Madrid Hotel
41    Relais & Chateaux Heritage Madrid Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was excellent. All of the hotel staff were courteous, kind and very helpful. Service amazing. Location was great - did not have any street noise. Our only regret was that our stay was too short. We definitely will return here.
hotelName:
36    Relais & Chateaux Heritage Madrid Hotel
41    Relais & Chateaux Heritage Madrid Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautifully curated property with a magical roofdeck bar. Superb personal service by friendly staff who are knowledgable about the local restaurants, tapas bars, and sights. The excellent breakfast was a step above the usual.
hotelName:
36    Relais & Chateaux Heritage Madrid Hotel
41    Relais & Chateaux Heritage Madrid Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently stayed here two different times during our travels through Spain on our Family vacation. This hotel really feels like you are home, living in luxury. The hotel was upscale, had a relaxing vibe, very comfortable rooms and the staff is so helpful in every way. Also it’s easy to walk around to explore fight from the hotel. We will not stay anywhere else on our next trip. I hope you enjoy it as much as we did
hotelName:
36    Relais & Chateaux Heritage Madrid Hotel
41    Relais & Chateaux Heritage Madrid Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location a few minutes walk from the upmarket shops in Serrano, this hotel provided us with a pleasant stay. In keeping with its name, the hotel was decorated with that ornate classic look that seems part of the Spanish tradition. Though on the small side, our room was spotlessly clean and fit for purpose. The standard of service was great as every request was greeted with a smile. Their recommendations for good restaurants nearby was also first class. Their own restaurant served top quality, fine dining food, albeit the service was a bit too formal for our liking. It seemed quiet on the nights we were there, which seems a pity as we would recommend it without hesitation.
hotelName:
36    Relais & Chateaux Heritage Madrid Hotel
41    Relais & Chateaux Heritage Madrid Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in hotel Heritage for one night, on our way back from vacation on the Costa del Sol.In the past, we have never stayed in Madrid mainly because we were afraid of traffic inside the city but also because of a lack of high-end hotels at a reasonable price.Hotel Heritage proved us wrong and we will certainly return.First of all, the welcome was fantastic. We were travelling with my father who is both very old and has trouble walking (stairs are impossible). The personnel did everyting they could to help my father out of the car and into his room as fast and comfortably as possible.
