There are2 different entries to the hotel, but each of them offers an elevator so we could easily avoid the stairs. The personnelcouldn't be more helpful and friendly than they were.Our 2 rooms (we were 4) were very spacious and had everything we could hope for. Bath and separate shower, separate toilet, small lounge with 2 comfortable chairs, complimentary bottle of water, bathrobes, slippers,...We are regular visitors of Relais & Chateaux hotels all over Europe, so yes a lot of these things are common but the size of the rooms, the design ("vieux chic") and the fact that there was absolutely nothing to make a remark about, really made this hotel stand out.In the evening, we had a great meal in the hotel restaurant, again with very nice personnel and a perfect maitre d'hötel who made excellent suggestions.It was less important for us, but the hotel is also very nicely located if you want to visit the city: not very far from the big museums and the most important shopping area.
hotelName:
36    Relais & Chateaux Heritage Madrid Hotel
41    Relais & Chateaux Heritage Madrid Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived for 2 nights at this hotel , where we wanted to be at the center of things, so we chose this hotel and were not disappointed.Very beautiful and decorated rooms, With a view of the stunning Grand Via Street. Definitely helped us experience the best city Madrid.Highly recommended, we will certainly return there.
hotelName:
42    NH Collection Madrid Gran Via
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms are elegant and inviting. The location central to many major sites in Madrid we walked everywhere. The best part of the hotel is the staff. Warm, welcoming, and helpful from the minute we arrived early for checkin to the last minute before we left. I would highly recommend this hotel to any of my friends traveling. In addition I will seek out other hotels in the NH chain when traveling.
hotelName:
42    NH Collection Madrid Gran Via
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Incredible service . More specific about Lilian who help us since our check in. Can you think in one employee who dos everithing for you to feel as in your home? Lilian is this person. NH Management pay attention on this kind of employee . They are the ones who make the diference.
hotelName:
42    NH Collection Madrid Gran Via
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel has a fantastic location right at the Gran Via. It is modern, clean rooms, restuarant and a roof terrace. Food in the restaurant is really excellent and service as well. I would like to stay here againl
hotelName:
42    NH Collection Madrid Gran Via
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Worth a visit for the rooftop bar which has great views of the city! Staff very friendly and drinks were not too dear! Queue to get in when we were leaving so its popular! It gives you a different perspective of Madrid
hotelName:
42    NH Collection Madrid Gran Via
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was so happy with this hotel, the hotel was new (I think or remodeled) and modern, clean and good space. Nespresso coffee machines in rooms. Great view and position right on gran via and very walkable around the city. Extremely happy with the breakfast, both selection and quality. Exceptional service by all staff, particularly by Lilian on the concierge desk who went above and beyond to get me reservations at a major restaurant and very hard to get into restaurant in Madrid, her follow up and professionalism was brilliant. I would not hesitate to stay again and will certainly be recommending to family and friends.
hotelName:
42    NH Collection Madrid Gran Via
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent hotel in a top location . Ideal for exploring Madrid and for shopping .Rooms are elegant and well equipped but a bit small. The staff is very friendly and helpful . Very good breakfast .The bar on the 9th floor is very popular and from there you can enjoy excellent views of the buildings along the Gran Via .
hotelName:
42    NH Collection Madrid Gran Via
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pros:Beautiful view of Gran Via.The room was relatively new and modern.Toiletries were nice, I love the hair mask.You can check out on your phone and just leave the key in the room.We were able to leave our bags checked until our flight later on after check out.Great location, right by Gran via metro station.ConsThe mini bar prices were ludacris.Room service was also a bit expensive.The room was rather small.The lobby was also a bit small.You are asked to check in on another floor.Almost no vegan options for breakfast other than fruit and toast basically.We were left waiting for what seemed forever for a fried egg.All in all its a very nice smallish hotel. I would definitely consider staying there again however given the price I might look elsewhere too.
hotelName:
42    NH Collection Madrid Gran Via
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We visited Madrid for a long weekend in October and chose this hotel based on it's location and quality of reviews. We were not disappointed, the hotel is in a perfect location to walk to almost all of Madrid's attractions. Booking into a superior room (712), we were pleasantly surprised with how clean and high quality the room was (the bed was extremely comfy and the shower was brilliant). Check in process was very quick and easy with all staff being friendly making us feel welcome. Yes the room was a little small, but it's completely fine for a couple staying for for 3 nights. After checking in we visited the sky bar on the 9th floor which we ended up visiting more than we expected due to how good it was! Overall a really great hotel which we would book again in an instant if visiting Madrid. Didn't have the breakfast as €24pp seemed quite expensive.
hotelName:
42    NH Collection Madrid Gran Via
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First the location which is right in front of the royal palace and the vast plaza and beautiful gardens which welcome you as you step outside. Than the room which was very spacious, welcoming, beautifully furnished and so clean you can eat from the floor. And last but not least Michaela in the reception, so eager to assist and so helpful in every way as well as being warm and welcoming, always with a smile. A real gem.
hotelName:
43    Oriente Palace Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were on the fifth floor, in a studio with a lounge/diner/kitchenette with bathroom, and bedroom on a mezzanine level. Opposite the palace and next door to the wonderful Cafe de Oriente, this was the perfect location from which to explore beautiful Madrid, whilst also being very quiet. The building is old and sympathetically updated, with period looking furniture and ornaments, whilst also offering all the modern comforts like heating, aircon and a fabulous shower. The kitchenette offered microwave, fridge, oven & hob, along with a kettle, tea & coffee. A lovely touch was the Cava in the fridge and bottle of red wine on the side, laid out with suitable glasses on arrival, very welcoming. The staff were fabulously friendly and helpful, offering great advice of where to visit, which we took and had a lovely time. The only negative word we’d have is we found the bed and pillows (only one pillow each) very hard and comfortless, so unfortunately we did not sleep well. Otherwise, it was absolutely lovely.
hotelName:
43    Oriente Palace Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When you arrive at the address which is right across from the Palacio Real and Plaza de Oriente, you will not notice the place until you see a green door with a sign next to it saying Oriente Palace Apartments. But the minute you walk in into a small lobby, you will be Immediately welcomed by Mihaela. Spend a few minutes after checking in with her as she has a wealth of info on where to go in Madrid. When we got to our room or apartment, we were so surprised at how big it was. It was literally a one bedroom apartment with a living room and a full service kitchen. Some reviews complained about the noise but it was not an issue for us. It is truly a home away from home. When we go back to Madrid and I hope it is real soon, I would stay again at the Oriente Palace Apartments. Thank you Mihaela and Alex. You made our stay an experience we will never forget.
hotelName:
43    Oriente Palace Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for a first visit to Madrid on a 4 night break. The hotel is charming- lots of character the reception staff were great. Mihaela in particular couldn’t have been more helpful and spoke great English.There were two negatives to an otherwise lovely stay here. One is noise and the other is the breakfast arrangements. We encountered quite a lot of noise from the rooms above as the floors here are all a very attractive polished wood but they are are very creaky. The ceiling is exposed beams which again adds to the charm and character of the room but consequently there is probably limited soundproofing. I’d suggest booking a top floor apartment which would avoid being subjected to this aspect of noise. We chose a balcony room facing the palace which had great views but did prove noisy at night. I would recommend booking a rear facing room - which is probably cheaper too!The breakfast arrangements we had were vouchers that we could use at Oriente Palace Cafe just around the corner. It’s important to state the cafe is not owned by the Oriente Apartments and they have no direct control over them. We found the staff there unhelpful and offhand - especially when they saw we had vouchers from the hotel. The food the vouchers provided was very limited and on two occasions we purchased additional food - on one morning I ordered one croissant in addition to a small toasted roll with a portion of jam and I then got charged for the croissant! On the 4th morning we gave up and bought breakfast elsewhere. I would definitely recommend the hotel for its great location, character and lovely staff. If you’d be disturbed by the type of noise I mention be specific about booking your room and avoid Oriente Palace Cafe!
hotelName:
43    Oriente Palace Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had such a wonderful time at this hotel. They are right next to the royal palace, quiet but with restaurants all around and a lovely park out the front. The staff here were very helpful and the facilities were great. Lots of space with a washer/dryer. Can not recommend enough.
hotelName:
43    Oriente Palace Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location - Plaza Mayor and any number of fabulous eateries at a stone's throw, half an hour walk to the golden triangle of the Prado, Thyssen Bornemisza and Reina Sofia art museums. Lively square just outside - hard to resist join the draw of mediterranean lifestyle Special touch: daily breakfast at the elegant Bar del Oriente next door.Comfortable, clean, well furnished and very friendly staff.
hotelName:
43    Oriente Palace Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A large apartment in a quirky recently upgraded hotel. The Hotel itself is situated within sight of the Royal Palace ands the magnificent cathedral. Our room was at the front and overlooked the Palace. It was large and comfortable. The air-conditioning worked very effectively too.Each time we went out or came in, the duty staff gave us a warm and genuine welcome. They were friendly and offered plenty of advice. They seemed genuinely interested in what we were doing or what we had done.There were plenty of restaurants very nearby and an excellent bakery directly below, which we used to get our breakfasts./Within 3 minutes walk of the bus stop for the city tour bus.A great hotel in central Madrid.
hotelName:
43    Oriente Palace Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We wanted to love this property. The location is fabulous but difficult to find. The front desk person was charming and helpful. The room was clean and functional, large by European standards. The bathroom was excellent.The location on Oriente Plaza has benefits and drawbacks. It isn’t a difficult walk to numerous attractions including El Prado. Unfortunately, the plaza never sleeps. While we enjoyed the view, the open window (necessary to keep the room from stifling heat) allowed every noise to enter. Even when we broke down and closed the windows, there were epic bouts of dog barking, the emptying of nearby dumpsters (likely recycling since the sound was of 10,000 glass bottles), the disco music which did not come from the plaza but somewhere within the building. The “bump-bump-bump” of the bass line continued until after 3 a.m. Oh, and the playground full of screaming children (and I mean screaming) punctuated the day.We didn’t mind the old mechanical locks or the tiny lift. We didn’t mind the three keys necessary to access our room or the comfort of the bed. I normally don’t review beds or pillow since those preferences are highly personal, however, the pillows just didn’t work for me.This is a lovely old property in a grand location and a tremendous value. For us, however, it was just too noisy.
hotelName:
43    Oriente Palace Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We chose this hotel for our 4-night stay in Madrid for our first wedding anniversary and we absolutely loved it. First of all it is in a fantastic location with a great view of the palace and is very central within walking distance of all the main streets, and only 2 minutes away from the Opera metro station for going further afield. Secondly the staff, especially Mihaela, are super friendly and amazingly helpful, you are greeted with a smile and a 'hello' every time you come in. The room itself was beautifully decorated and was always nice and cosy which you need in February!There were a couple of little niggles which are the only reason I haven't given 5 stars:- The pillows are basically blocks of foam which may suit some people but we personally found them very uncomfortable and too hard, we ended up sleeping on the little decorative cushions instead which were much comfier!- One for the ladies: There was a nice big mirror on the wall but no plug socket near it or any surface for putting make-up/hair straighteners etc on so getting ready in the morning was a bit of a struggle. There is a plug socket next to the bathroom mirror but the bathroom is quite small so it's not really the ideal space- Being in such a central location, it does get very noisy in the street and never seems to really get quiet, so if you are a light sleeper this may not be the hotel for you - the walls of the hotel are also quite thin and squeaky floorboards being an old buildingOverall though, we loved our stay, and if we ever return to Madrid we would definitely stay here again. Thanks Mihaela and the team for making our anniversary so special!
hotelName:
43    Oriente Palace Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hostel was really great value! Very clean, friendly staff and spacious rooms. We did the walking tour, which was with another company but we were led by a member of staff to the meeting point which was very helpful. Great location!!! Less than a 15 minute walk to everything, but great transport with the metro just round the corner. Perfect for access to and from the airport. No common area really which is the only fault I have, not the best atmosphere for travellers looking to make friends but perfect if already with others.
hotelName:
44    Room007 Chueca Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room 007 looks amazing, with some great finishing touches and super clean rooms. The hostel is also ideally located in Cheuca, a vibrant LGBTQI+ friendly neighbourhood, close to everything Madrid has to offer. A few cautions, if youre are interested in that close-knit hostel vibe, this probably isn't your kind of place, as the hostel lacks any real common room to relax in. My room Also lacked any WiFi, which while a small inconvenience was a little annoying. During my stay, Madrid suffered a heat wave which the AC wasn't prepared for, this meant the rooms were a constant 32°C. Requesting a room on one of the lower floors would ensure that you don't have to live through the sweaty nights that I did.
hotelName:
44    Room007 Chueca Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I past great Time on this place, especially because Augustin who helps me a lot and i welcome him for thé Pub crawl!!!The pub crawl with him was a great Idea, very funnnnn and very cheap si was perfectttt
hotelName:
44    Room007 Chueca Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location and super friendly and helpful staff. They gave me some great recommendations about what to visit and where to eat. I also did the Pubcrawl with Agustin and had so much fun there! I definitely recommend it!
hotelName:
44    Room007 Chueca Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed twice in hostel. At the begging and the end of march 2019. Very convenient location. Good price. Friendly and helpful staff. Especialy Augstin who took us for pub crawl and recommened to see good spots for photos.
hotelName:
44    Room007 Chueca Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I went to Madrid for vacations and it was incredible! Loved the hostel but the best part was the staff and of course Agustin who was super friendly and kind! He invited me to the pub crawl and it was amazing I had one of the best night in Madrid!! Thank u!!
hotelName:
44    Room007 Chueca Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in this hostel for 4 nights and I absolutely loved it! It’s close to all the big highlights so I did everything by foot. The rooms were very clean and there was a bathroom in the room as well. The staff was super friendly and helped me to get the best stay as possible, thank you for that! I also joined the pubcrawl, organized by Agustin, which I really enjoyed with a super nice group!
hotelName:
44    Room007 Chueca Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff was super nice and helpful, Agustin was the kind of people you would love to be with throughout you trip and have fun with, especially when you can do the Pubcrawl with him.I do highly recommend the hostel.
hotelName:
44    Room007 Chueca Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: if you want to spend a memorable week end in Madrid, i truly suggest to stay in this hostel.This is not a real hostel, the location is super alternative. The room was big enough for 2 people, with balcony and we could have a view on Madrid. The room was bright and the cleaning good as well.The location is 5 min walking from the city center.The ladies at the reception were really welcoming and suggested us different places to eat and have fun.Gustado mucho!
hotelName:
44    Room007 Chueca Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friendly people ,shower and beds are very good and clean.Price of the room is good . Location is very good with trains and metro in front of the hotel including a shopping center.Breakfast is also good ,
hotelName:
45    Hotel Acta Madfor
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Surprisingly affluent hotel that’s deceptive from the outside. Room was large with plenty of room, slightly let down by lack of coffee/tea in the room but there is a facility on level L. Connecting bar which is also open to the street so locals wander in which adds to the overall ambience. Ideally placedfoethe metro being less than 100m fro. Principe Pio station with great access to the city and go to places. Definitely go again.
hotelName:
45    Hotel Acta Madfor
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed 4 nights here before we start a tour. It was so convenient. Only 20 minutes walk to the Gran Via and all the beautiful Plazas. The Palace and Park de Moro is just across the road. Breakfast was tasty and wifi good. Enrique who was at the Front desk each morning was exceptionally friendly and helpful. I would recommend the small hotel. We loved Madrid.
hotelName:
45    Hotel Acta Madfor
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you are after a hotel which is located right opposite a train Stanton and bus hub in easy walking distance to some great tourist attractions including a hop on hop of bus then this is the hotel for you.The downside? no fridge or even tea/ coffee making facilities in your room .BUT to compensate there is a fabulous very spacious lounge area on the first floor that we used for a meeting , it was quiet and uninterrupted even though the hotel was full. Another downside is the paper thin walls so if you have a neighbour , as we did, who is on Madrid time ie goes to sleep at 3 am and has TV blaring til then then then there is no blocking the sound....even through ear plugs!The breakfast is passable and most staff have enough English to get by
hotelName:
45    Hotel Acta Madfor
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked on VRBO thinking that this was an apartment. The pictures on the site were nothing like what we got. Very small rooms with 8 inch width balcony. We asked for a double room with a balcony and got a twin room with a step out window area you can’t even put a chair out Plus we paid Canadian $331.00 per night ( thought we would get something more deluxe for that price) Nowhere to put your clothes( 6 hangers) no mini fridge, asked for wine glasses....none available and had paper espresso cups. Overall very disappointing We have travelled all over Europe and this has to be the most overpriced small room and would rate this a 2 star hotel
hotelName:
45    Hotel Acta Madfor
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Acta Madfor is well situated in Madrid to enable one to explore the city by foot, Metro or bus. By foot if you aren't suffering any health problems that hinders walking. It is situated opposite the Principe Pio Station. It is also within walking distance to the train Station, shopping mall, restaurants, supermarket and cafes and bars that lined the street. A very good hotel with comfortable rooms, clean and minimalist. The only shortfall is the wall is a bit thin as you can hear movement from other rooms. Good rain shower. The hotel has a bicycle hire for €10.00 for half a day which will allow you to enjoy cycling in the park across the river. It also has a living room on the first floor with a coffee and tea making machine at €1.00 per coffee pod and tea bags.Practically Next door there is a very well stocked supermarket where you can by anything. You can go the hotel terras to soak up the atmosphere. Last by not least the staff extremely helpful. Thank you all reception staff you are the real asset to the hotel..
hotelName:
45    Hotel Acta Madfor
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was very comfortable.The lounge and coffee area on the first floor was an excellent place to relax.Very handy for tube and train station.Good shopping area and restaurants.Easy walk to royal palace
hotelName:
45    Hotel Acta Madfor
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is well located near Príncipe Pío station, which has several shops and restaurants. Also many bus EMT stations are near hotel.The staff was friendly and helpful, rooms have great space, were clean and comfortable.Sometimes may be noisy, depending on type of guests (like group of students by time I was there)
hotelName:
45    Hotel Acta Madfor
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was clean and had all the required amenities. The staff were incredibly friendly upon arrival and the check in process was efficient. The hotel is located opposite a metro station which is really convenient. Really great hotel. 4 star due to the lift being a bit outdated - we used the stairs for our stay.
hotelName:
45    Hotel Acta Madfor
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 3 nights here and were really pleased with the hotel. If is very convenient for exploring the city. Walking distance to many places but also very close to a tube station and several bus stops.Reception staff were lovely at check in and our room was good. Breakfast was very varied with just about every taste catered for.Special mention to the onsite bar/cafe which we did use each day. The staff were always friendly, the food was good and was very reasonably priced.All in all a very nice hotel.
hotelName:
46    Ganivet Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a lovely 3 days stay at the Ganivet. Our third time staying there. Our check in was very efficient and although we were early, the reception staff facilitated us and allocated us a lovely room that was suitable for my elderly Morher. The reception staff were very courteous and helpful with tourist information and bookings. Our room was perfect, comfortable and we could monitor the temperature to our liking. The shower was fantastic. We had breakfast daily, which was tasty and plenty of fresh fruit and hot/ cold buffet. Coffee could have been better. There was a water font on each floor which was lovely. The hotel is within walking distance to all the tourist attractions, but if you prefer to take a metro or bus, the nearby Toledo or La Latina metro is a few minutes walk. There are fabulous restaurants / tapas bars in Calle bajo 5 minutes walk & a lovely bar 50 m up the street for a beer/ wine or coffee & snack. Thanks to all in the Ganivet, we enjoyed our stay and will be back soon
hotelName:
46    Ganivet Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was centrally located in walking distance to Plaza Mayor. We arrived early at the hotel and our room was ready, very clean and quite. The staff was very helpful with suggestions for dinner, transportation, flamingo shows! We would stay here again on our next trip to Madrid!
hotelName:
46    Ganivet Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A comfortable hotel with good facilities and friendly staff. The inclusive breakfast was excellent. The hotel is well situated near good restaurants in La Latina district and a 10 minute walk to Plaza Major.
hotelName:
46    Ganivet Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel was good, clean. Breakfast decent, quality of orange juice could be better. We liked the location very much: in a few minutes by walking on Plaza Mayor, Royal palace and other sights/parks. Our favourite was plaza Plaja also very closeby with a lots of locals around.
hotelName:
46    Ganivet Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Recently stayed here for 4 nights. The hotel was in great location within an easy walk of any of the sites of Madrid. The room was not large but was very clean. There are may restaurants close by and we had breakfast just up the road in a small cafe which served good coffee. We would definitely stay in this hotel again.
hotelName:
46    Ganivet Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We found this hotel ideal for walking around Madrid. It was only a short walk to Plaza Mayor and a good location. There was a lovely local bar -Eduardo just a few minutes away too. We used the underground to visit the Bernebeau Stadium and found it extremely easy to use. The breakfast at the hotel was delicious and varied. The room was clean; we would have preferred a double bed rather than 2 singles pushed together.
hotelName:
46    Ganivet Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very clean and centrally located, with easy availability to the Hop-on-Hop-off buses and cabs. Lots to cafes/restaurants close by. The staff are very friends and helpful. Neighbourhood was always bustling with people so made it nice to stroll around.
hotelName:
46    Ganivet Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: THIS IS MY OPINION of my stay at Hotel Ganivet, Madrid, Spain in late September for 2 nights in room 408, a triple room with breakfast included. I reserved the room on Agoda.com for a total of 579 euros, taxes included, about 2 weeks before our stay. We were very pleased with the hotel & staff and would stay again. This is one of the nicer 3-star hotels we have stayed.The hotel is in the fun La Latina section of Madrid set between two close metro stops that made it easy to get around the city. The front desk staff spoke English on every shift and the lobby itself is plain with a few couches. There are full length windows looking out onto Calle de Toledo. At check-in we were given the choice of a street-facing or internal facing room, I chose street.Our room, 408, was a triple with 3 single beds squeezed tightly into the small room with just enough space to walk around. We had a desk, smaller flat screen TV, large wardrobe, a room safe (no charge +++), blackout curtains and nice lighting. The beds were comfortable but firm and there were extra blankets & pillows in the wardrobe. Surprisingly and happily, we didn’t hear anything from the street with the windows closed even though buses and cars are passing all day and night. The TV has a few English channels. Maid service was excellent so I didn’t hesitate to tip a few euros. No iron or ironing board. A kettle or coffee maker; not sure if there was one but we used the desk for our suitcase stand so can’t remember. I did not notice a refrigerator or mini-bar. One final room note, the air conditioner had its own controls and it worked flawlessly & super quiet! The bathroom was well lit with a toilet, shower and tub. The large sink had basic amenities like small soaps, shampoo and shower cap. The bonus here was real glass glasses, not plastic cups. Not a spec of mold/mildew and water pressure was good with lots of hot water! A soak in the tub after tons of sightseeing was very welcomed.Hotel décor is standard & two modern elevators were quick to come. Wifi worked well with no complaints. We didn’t see any computers/Printers but we didn’t need them. There is a little café off the lobby that makes good coffee. On the top floor is a large whirlpool/pool. We didn’t realize it was there until the last day so we didn’t use it. It’s a nice roof deck with relaxing chairs and a bathroom. We were sad we didn’t know about it. It also has a great few of the south side of Madrid.The only downside of our stay was the included breakfast. We only used it 1 of the 2 mornings so I can only judge on using it once. We overslept the 2nd day and missed the 10:30 closing time. We gave it a grade of C mostly due to the fact we didn’t like the coffee, we felt the fruit juices were odd tasting and they barely cooked the bacon which was not crisp. The fruit and ham/cheese selection was nice. If we returned and had our choice to reserve without it we would skip it and eat elsewhere. One final note about the Hotel Ganivet’s great staff. We brought our own pillows from home. When we checked out we forgot them in the room. However, we were still in Madrid and went back to get them and they said they would look for the pillows. We returned the next day and not only did they find them, but they washed and put them in plastic bags for us. Kudos!!Yes, we recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
46    Ganivet Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hello everyone!! I recommend this Hotel cause it’s really magic . Rooms are always clean and nice . Hotel is very confortable and relaxing . People are very kind and human . Especially in the reception Sara is just amazing person . Thank you so much . I will cherish forever . Warmest regards Ruben from France
hotelName:
47    11th Principe by Splendom Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were really impressed with the staff. They are very friendly and helpful. We were able to check in much earlier than the normal check in time and it was really appreciated as we just spent 22 hours flight. The apartment was very clean and equipped with complete amenities. It was raining everday when we were at Madrid, so having a complete kitchen set was really helpful as we were able to cook simple meals for dinner (there is a carrefour express next to the hotel). The hotel is also well located near tourist attractions and shopping streets. We were able to walk everywhere. And there are many restaurants nearby. The one next door was suggested by the receptionist but unfortunately we weren’t able to try it as it was always very crowded.
hotelName:
47    11th Principe by Splendom Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Besides the minor issue of not having daily top ups of soaps and shampoos and the bath area not having a place for you to put the soap/shampoo bottles, everything else was perfect. Clean, huge room. The staffs were EXCELLENT. Best staffs I came across during my stay in Europe. Extremely helpful, polite, and ensuring I had a pleasant stay/travel.
hotelName:
47    11th Principe by Splendom Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Bag stolen from this hotel luggage storageThis happened in a family holiday in Madrid. After check-out, we asked to leave our bags in the hotel luggage storage while we went on a last walk around the area. After 2 hours we returned and asked for our bags back, but one of them could not be found. We filled a police report and travelled back home.When we left the bags in the hotel we were given a ticket/receipt, so there was no doubt that the bag was in fact received by the hotel staff. The police investigation did not produce a conclusive result of what happened (the security cameras weren´t operational, and no one in the staff remembers seeing anything out of the ordinary).We made a written complaint to the hotel and requested compensation for the loss of the bag. After a few exchanged emails with the hotel management, they simply stopped responding without ever given an answer to our request. I could understand if they had refused to pay claiming some legal reason (that I could not prove the contents of the bag, for example), but their attitude towards the problem was simple to ignore it and stop all communications. I’m a foreign citizen so the trouble of pursuing legal action isn’t worth the value lost with the theft of the bag. So, in conclusion, beware of this hotel as its management culture may not be focus toward solving customer problems or assuming responsibilities…
hotelName:
47    11th Principe by Splendom Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked this hotel based on the good reviews and I am not disappointed at all. Sergio made the check-in process easy and all the reception staff speak English. I was given a quiet room as requested because i need a good night's sleep after a long flight. My suite room came with a kitchenette, living room, spacious and clean bathroom and a very sizeable bedroom. The rooms are well cleaned and the air-cond works very well. They provide frew coffee, muffin and cereal at the lobby. The only that was not working so well for me was the wifi. It seems that 2 of their routers were blown so wifi was very spotty and weak. This is easily repaired so i am sure it will be ok in the future. There's a supermarket about 10 steps away and plenty of restaurants and cafe to choose from.
hotelName:
47    11th Principe by Splendom Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Discretely tucked away in a buzzing cobbled road, this hotel is located in a great part of town. For someone who'd never been to Madrid before, it was easy to walk around from here to explore the gorgeous architecture and sample great food. The rooms worked well - we had a duplex suite which very comfortably accommodated all four of us, and as a bonus had a lovely verandah allowing us to soak in the twilight. Also, the suite had a galley kitchen which could be handy. A Hotel can live or die by its staff - they couldn't have been friendlier. Next time we return to Madrid we will book here again - thoroughly recommended.
hotelName:
47    11th Principe by Splendom Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friends and I came here for our first time in Madrid. The staff was very nice and accommodating. The room had a nice view and soft bed. The hotel was nice. I would come back here. The location is good but the streets are real narrow. The city uses their alleys a lot for transportation. The food is amazing. Even though the water is not free, the bottled water they use is very good and refreshing. I had a great time!
hotelName:
47    11th Principe by Splendom Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed two nights in the beautiful studio in the location absolutely incredible. The reception is nice. There’s a coffee machine and compliment coffee for the hotel guests in the reception. The elevator is very small. The studio is huge and beautiful, very equipped, very good and spacious bed. The bathroom is spacious and beautiful too. Very good amenities but without replacement in the second day. The same for the coffee capsules. I really don’t understand as I payed the same rate per day. There’s inclusive a service to clean your shoes. Really good. I loved this place. I always visit Madrid and this place will be my first choice next time. Congratulations.
hotelName:
47    11th Principe by Splendom Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This apartment was located almost halfway (walking distance) between Prado and the Royal Palace (armory at place was well worth visit). Room ok, limited tea/ coffee during our stay, bed firm, kitchen has hot plate and microwave only. Would stay here again although at time of staying there was roadworks being undertaken and differcult for taxi to access.
hotelName:
47    11th Principe by Splendom Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Yesterday was my final stay for the year here. The staff and Management do everything possible to make your stay such a pleasure.Each time i visit the Executive Lounge the staff gets more and more friendly. The food is a pleasure.My suite as always so clean with little evening welcome gifts.Pablo M --thank you for all your help.
hotelName:
48    Madrid Marriott Auditorium Hotel & Conference ...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Alejandro checked us in. After a red eye to Madrid, it was comforting to be welcomed so warmly and to hear that we were being expected having taken advantage of mobile check-in. Alejandro made us really feel like valuable customers, patiently answering our questions on Madrid, but also suggesting activities. Knowing that we had an early flight outt he offered a packed breakfast for each of us that we took with us to the airport. We picked this property because of his closeness to the airport. The hotel provides shuttle services to the airport and to downtown Madrid. Alvaro, from the Guest Relations desk was also very helpful and courteous. The Executive lounge served breakfast that includes omelets made to order. We would definitely stay in the property again.
hotelName:
48    Madrid Marriott Auditorium Hotel & Conference ...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent one night at hotel before morning international flight. It was an excellent decision and the facility was perfect for that need. We had a good meal at the bar/restaurant and a good sleep before travel. The shuttle was efficient and we met all our deadlines.
hotelName:
48    Madrid Marriott Auditorium Hotel & Conference ...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am a Marriott Titanium Member and I stay at a lot of Marriott Hotels for work and pleasure. Let me say, this is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at. I was in Madrid for 2 nights before flying to Barcelona for 2 nights, and then returned to Madrid for 2 nights. Thus, I decided to stay at a hotel near the airport. I am happy I did, because let me give you all the reasons this hotel is wonderful.I used my suites night certificates for both stays, and the upgraded room was wonderful. The refrigerator in the room was stocked with some drinks, which were free/complimentary in my upgraded room. The suite was wonderful compared to other hotels I have been at, where the suite room is not much better than the normal room.I was a Titanium member so the hotel left a gift of some delicious biscuit/cookies in my room, which was delicious.The executive lounge was wonderful and had delicious food. It was open from 6:00 in the morning to midnight every day, which is great and provides plenty of options regardless of when your flights gets in. The food in the lounge was wonderful, high quality, with smoked salmon, desserts, and with free drinks. It is honestly one of the best Executive Lounges I have ever been in. The lounge attendant asks for your room number when you first walk in to confirm that you can use the Executive Lounge, which was a bit confusing for someone not used to it because in the USA you just scan your keycard and walk in. However, this is understandable and after the first time they will recognize you for following lounge visits.As a Marriott Titanium member, you can also have breakfast at the buffet on the lobby floor, which has similar food but some more options.The hotel has an ATM in the lobby which is very convenient for travelers.There is a line of taxis outside the hotel, and also a free shuttle bus to the Madrid airport. From the airport, you can catch a train to the Madrid city center. There is also a free shuttle to a shopping mall near the hotel.My only tip to management is to find some way to make the shuttle schedule more easy to find on the website. I have included a picture of it, but it would be helpful to know ahead to time so that I can see whether I should rush to catch it after my airplane lands.Overall, the hotel is a great value, and I will be staying here next time I am in Madrid. The amenities and service was wonderful, and it is one of the best hotels I live ever stayed at. I highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
48    Madrid Marriott Auditorium Hotel & Conference ...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for one night before our flight home. If you have Marriott status, this is the place to stay. First, we purchased two rooms on points. Both rooms were upgraded to suites. The executive lounge hours are 6:30 to 12:30 AM. The alcohol starts and 1 PM and runs until close. The lounge has good food all day and dinner from 5:30 PM to 7:30 PM. We ate our meals in the executive lounge. We did not see any restaurants within walking distance. The hotel offers a free shuttle to/from the mall. Also, the hotel is only 30 minutes from downtown Madrid. You can catch the bus right outside the hotel and have a quick transfer to the underground….and you are downtown. Everything was easy. From check-in to round trip shuttle to/from the airport. If we ever fly through Madrid again, this is where we are staying.
hotelName:
48    Madrid Marriott Auditorium Hotel & Conference ...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There is no better feeling after a long-haul flight than checking into a hotel and being welcomed by the loveliest possible receptionists - absolutely priceless! This hotel provides free-shuttle service from and to the airport every 30 minutes. Easy!By the way they have the best beds ever!The gym is huge - way better than mine back at home. And finally, their breakfast is top notch! Top top top hotel!
hotelName:
48    Madrid Marriott Auditorium Hotel & Conference ...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here twice over the last year. The hotel was well equipped and well maintained. Room is spacious and comfy. Lounge offers a nice variety of snacks and drinks. Service staff are very welcoming and hospitable. It offers shuttle bus to pick up guests from the airport which is convenient. The only downside is it’s not close to downtown, so visiting the city takes some time.Overall highly recommended for airport transfer. Can’t believe it’s only a category 2 hotel by Marriott system.
hotelName:
48    Madrid Marriott Auditorium Hotel & Conference ...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at the hotel for two nights during a conference. It doesn't happen often, but I didn't have a single thing to complain about. The complimentary airport transfer bus was clean with helpful staff. Check in was quick and the hotel room was very clean and roomy. The room AC was almost soundless. The bathroom was spotless and the TV in the room was very large. English TV channels was sparse, but on the other side - I was not there to watch TV.The in-room ironing board and iron was in good shape and the room was re-filled with complimentary bottled water and coffee every day. The breakfast was truly excellent, and the restaurants at the venue was all good - we tried them all. They work well even if you are a vegetarian. If you are into running outdoors, there are plenty of sidewalks to run on starting from the hotel.
hotelName:
48    Madrid Marriott Auditorium Hotel & Conference ...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel offers a modern and clean room with friendly staff. It is a great hotel to stay if you are looking for accommodation with proximity to Madrid airport. Staf was very helpful when come to getting the right mode of transport to the city (Taxi, Cabify or Uber) and where to go during your visit to Madrid.
hotelName:
48    Madrid Marriott Auditorium Hotel & Conference ...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I normally get my first impression of the hotel when I send emails inquiring about booking. Their prompt replies and feedback to my queries already gave an insight that the way they deal with their patrons is very professional. In fact we ended up arriving late as we had a delay, and when I sent an email to inform the hotel, they replied to my email immediately. When we finally arrived after a three hour delay, we were warmly greeted by Yadian at the reception. He was so helpful going through various things and giving us tips not only on the day, but throughout the whole week we stayed there. Our room was on the top floor as I had requested, it was a nice spacious airy room, with a good sized bathroom and kitchenette . I was surprised how well insulated the rooms were as we did not hear any noise providing us with restful nights. The room was very spacious and immaculately clean as was the bathroom. I was surprised to say the truth with the items provided for example the hairdryer. Such a simple thing but personally I find it's a nightmare to blowdry my hair with the ones usually provided. Their attention to detail and needs of their guests left me quite astounded. Breakfast was delicious too and the staff were really nice. Also the terrace has a breathtaking view of the palace. It was a pity that we visited in December as it would have been nice to sit there and have a drink, but it was too cold in the evenings to stay for more than a few minutes. The hotel is equidistant to two metro stops - Plaza Espana and Principe Pio. This was another plus, apart from the fact of having bus stops just a few steps away from the hotel. Also it's a few metres away from the Royal Palace and walking distance to most of the sights.I would not like to mention names, as I don't want to leave out anyone, but all the staff are so friendly and professional in their approach. You are always greeted with a smile and very helpful in every way. Thanks to everyone for making our short break a memorable and relaxing one. Should we revisit Madrid, obviously we would not even consider looking around anywhere else.
hotelName:
1     ApartoSuites Jardines de Sabatini
49    ApartoSuites Jardines de Sabatini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have stayed There for 3 nights last month and we had a really nice stay. The staff is just as professional. The views are the best. Our apartment was a studio, but really nicely equipped. I will recommend this hotel to all guests
hotelName:
1     ApartoSuites Jardines de Sabatini
49    ApartoSuites Jardines de Sabatini

review_body: This was an outstanding hotel choice for us. The location is great for anything you need in the central Madrid area but more importantly were the amazing suites with plenty of room and the most comfortable beds. The staff is very friendly and helpful. We really enjoyed the breakfast as well. Highly recommended!
hotelName:
1     ApartoSuites Jardines de Sabatini
49    ApartoSuites Jardines de Sabatini
