review_body: The hotel is about 10 mins walk from Metro and 5 mins walk from the Palace. The staff at the hotel are friendly and helpful. The view from the rooftop terrace is beautiful. The included breakfast buffet is good too.
hotelName:
1     ApartoSuites Jardines de Sabatini
49    ApartoSuites Jardines de Sabatini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First of all, we made a stupid mistake and booked the hotel for the wrong nights! It was past those nights when we figured it out. They were kind enough to give us a small discount on the correct nights (we understand they had to charge us for the nights we screwed up). Everyone in this hotel bent over backwards to be helpful and pleasant. The room was amazing - large, clean, comfortable. Location provided lots to walk to in our short two night stay here.
hotelName:
1     ApartoSuites Jardines de Sabatini
49    ApartoSuites Jardines de Sabatini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: ApartoSuites was a great end to our two week trip. The suite felt like home. The rooftop was lovely, even though it was too chilly to hang around up there for too long. The front desk staff were all very helpful. We enjoyed the breakfast and appreciated the variety of food and beverage.
hotelName:
1     ApartoSuites Jardines de Sabatini
49    ApartoSuites Jardines de Sabatini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location, beautiful room with view on the Royal Palace and extremely nice and helpful staff made our stay in Madrid quite memorable. We liked the special deal on daily breakfast. We were also lucky to see our room upgraded to a suite...
hotelName:
1     ApartoSuites Jardines de Sabatini
49    ApartoSuites Jardines de Sabatini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very modern and beautifully decorated apartment hotel in the vicinity of the Royal Palace. All the mod cons, comfortable bed and sofa, well equipped kitchen, clean and spacious. Reception staff spoke English (not a common feature in Madrid), were very professional and helpful. Every request was attended to and every query answered. There is no restaurant for evening meals but they do provide a fantastic breakfast in a bright and cheerful hall downstairs. The hotel is a short walking distance from Sabatini Gardens, Royal Palace and local restaurants. Our only regret was not being able to extend our stay.
hotelName:
1     ApartoSuites Jardines de Sabatini
49    ApartoSuites Jardines de Sabatini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Variety of food and taste were very goodLocation very convenient ,Excellent viewRoom very cleanBottle of wine given good tasteFresh fruit good presentationPersonnel very professional,friendly and helpful
hotelName:
1     ApartoSuites Jardines de Sabatini
49    ApartoSuites Jardines de Sabatini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is at the heart of Madrid and is within walking distance to almost everything you would want to visit. We hardly had to use any public tansport.Their unique selling point is the fact that they are environment friendly and do not use single use plastic. We were very impressed with this. The kitchen is a nice addition with an excellent coffee machine, kettle, microwave sofa, dining table and TV. They also separate their waste for recycling. The kitchen is accessible 24 hours a day.The hotel is clean with large comfortable beds. Staff are friendly and approachable. They also give you a goody bag with fresh pastry, muffins and a paper bottle of water everyday- which was very handy for us.Our balcony was on the 5th floor and we got a great view of Puerta del Sol. However, it got noisy at night, so you may want to use the earplugs provided if your room is on the front side.
hotelName:
8     B&B Hotel Madrid Centro Puerta del Sol
50    B&B Hotel Madrid Centro Puerta del Sol
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic location at the edge of Puerta del Sol. Spacious, immaculately clean and thoughtfully accessorised rooms. A special mention for the excellent rain shower. Very quiet despite the hotel’s busy location. Highly value additive common room in the basement with good coffee. Strongly recommend for anyone seeking to stay in central Madrid.
hotelName:
8     B&B Hotel Madrid Centro Puerta del Sol
50    B&B Hotel Madrid Centro Puerta del Sol
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've been to madrid many times and have never gone back to the same hotel twice - but I will definitely be goign back to this hotel. It is clean, modern and quiet even though it could not be more central. The room we had was huge and the bathroom is excellent. There is a communal kitchen where you get drinks all day and in the mornign they hang a wee bag of pastries on yrou door for breakfast. To top it all there is a great rooftop terrace bar and restaurant - its expensive but you get a great view over the rooftops as you watch the sun go down.
hotelName:
8     B&B Hotel Madrid Centro Puerta del Sol
50    B&B Hotel Madrid Centro Puerta del Sol
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I just spent 5 nights in this hotel along with my family; we had two spacious rooms on the 5th floor. From the outside maybe one would not think much of it but the stay here is very comfortable. Security is awesome as the main doors and the lift both require key card access.Check-in is a breeze and we were up to our rooms in no time. Our room comes with a king size bed. Room amenities are as per usual. It’s clean and very comfortable. Even their bathrooms have a 4-star hotel feel to it.The hotel is a real gem, well priced and located near to everything you could want to visit in this interesting city.Puerta del sol is a minutes’ walk from the hotel and is always buzzing with activity. So is the Metro and it is the best way of getting around Madrid. Avail of the T10 card (very economical and one card can be used by all members of your family) which can also be used on the bus.The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful; it feels a little like staying with family as they greet you with a smile as you return from a day wandering in the streets of Madrid.The hotel has some lovely features on offer. The basement cafeteria is open 24/7 where you can enjoy fresh fruits, juices, tea, coffee and cookies all day long.Stay at the B&B Hotel Madrid Centro Puerta del Sol, you will not be disappointedMany thanks to the staff there for a wonderful stay. I would gladly recommend this place to others.
hotelName:
8     B&B Hotel Madrid Centro Puerta del Sol
50    B&B Hotel Madrid Centro Puerta del Sol
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. It is in a very central area and is close to metro and busses. The hotel is very clean and the staff courteous and polite. We had a private balcony room overlooking a busy street. The balcony has a table, chair and egg chair and is a nice place to relax or admire the views over the rooftops. There is a lot of foot traffic on the street till the early hours but it wasn't enough to stop us from sleeping. The hotel also comes with a communal kitchen which is available 24/7 and provides coffee from a coffee machine, tea, juices, water, fresh fruit, a microwave and ice etc. It is a very welcome free service. There is a free breakfast pack left at the door each morning which contains croissants, muffins and water. The bed is huge and very comfortable and the shower has a rainwater shower head, great pressure and easy to regulate temperature. There is free parking at the rear of the hotel and free reliable wi-fi. We would stay here again and would recommend to family and friends.
hotelName:
8     B&B Hotel Madrid Centro Puerta del Sol
50    B&B Hotel Madrid Centro Puerta del Sol
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect location just steps from plaza mayor and nearby puerta del sol—single room with single bed was small but more than adequate for a two night stay; priced at 50€/night for a limited budget;Free coffee and rolls and fruit available 24 hours a day Excellent reception service
hotelName:
8     B&B Hotel Madrid Centro Puerta del Sol
50    B&B Hotel Madrid Centro Puerta del Sol
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a very cool, very Central hotel albeit hard to find at first. It's tucked away to the side of a noodle bar. It clean and modern. There is a communal area which provides coffees fruit and biscuit's. The hotel provides a breakfast bag served to you door every morning with a pastry and water. The roof bar is a must it takes you out of the city buzz to a beautiful view.
hotelName:
8     B&B Hotel Madrid Centro Puerta del Sol
50    B&B Hotel Madrid Centro Puerta del Sol
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The only problem was the cab couldn’t get to the front door. He was able to get us very close, but we had to walk a busy, narrow street about a block, no big deal. The rooms are clean. The staff friendly and helpful. The coffee bar with fresh fruit in the basement was nice too. Didn’t realize how important having air conditioning in the room was until now, bit it is a must and worked great. We would definitely stay here again!
hotelName:
8     B&B Hotel Madrid Centro Puerta del Sol
50    B&B Hotel Madrid Centro Puerta del Sol
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Actually a very decent room and a rather good roof top bar makes this centrally located hotel work well. It was a bit too low key / low staff for me and my breakfast hanging on my door handle in the morning is not my style but in terms of location, quality and value for money I could not knock it. But not for me.
hotelName:
8     B&B Hotel Madrid Centro Puerta del Sol
50    B&B Hotel Madrid Centro Puerta del Sol
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent hotelNew and modern Excellent location: Plaza de España / Gran víaAmazing boutique breakfast - on the 14th floor with great viewsVery good service- from everyone at the hotel,Jorge the waiter was a specially nice, super friendly and remembered our preferences after the first day Madrid is amazing Super recommend
hotelName:
25    Dear Hotel Madrid
51    Dear Hotel Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel ,great view from the roof , good service , convenient location ( close metro station ) , clean rooms , tasty breakfasts , pleasant and professional  stuff  , especially  at the restaurant   Special thanks to waiter Alvaro !
hotelName:
25    Dear Hotel Madrid
51    Dear Hotel Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We love the rooms the staff and the breakfast. All through the day and night you can get food, service and answers about the activities in the city.Our waiter in breakfast Jorge was helpful and very nice. We are sure to return here!
hotelName:
25    Dear Hotel Madrid
51    Dear Hotel Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am quite facy with hotel but the Dear Hotel in Madrid near Plaza Epaña, on Gran Via, is a great great Hotel. The room is modern and the bathroom very nice. The breakfast/restaurant area, the service was perfect, especially with Abraham. He was always attentive to our needs. Thank you also to the rest of the team.
hotelName:
25    Dear Hotel Madrid
51    Dear Hotel Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is in a brilliant location on Gran Via and there are plenty of restaurants and bars around. Despite being on the Main Street next to a metro station, you could not hear much traffic at night apart from the occasional sirens. Very helpful staff and very informative. The room was very clean and stylish. The only small issue we had was that our room was on floor 11 and the lift sometimes took up to 3 minutes to get to our floor as it was quite slow especially if other people were using it. However this is a very minimal problem and it certainly would not put me off returning to the hotel for future visits to this beautiful city. Many thanks!
hotelName:
25    Dear Hotel Madrid
51    Dear Hotel Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very comfortable hotel with very clean rooms. Exceptional service by their friendly staff. Especially Esther who was very patient helped a great deal when we were facing problems communicating. Will definitely stay here again on the next trip!
hotelName:
25    Dear Hotel Madrid
51    Dear Hotel Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very chic and clean hotel with super friendly services. Shout out to Esther who helped us when we needed assistance with speaking to a Spanish over the phone to settle a courier issue with UPS. We enjoyed our stay in Dear Hotel and will definitely come back again when we visit Madrid in the future! :)
hotelName:
25    Dear Hotel Madrid
51    Dear Hotel Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: LoveliesVennessa and Maria, the best service ever. You made ourstay plesent and with worm . I will sure return backtostay here becouse of you. Thanks again.You direct us to the best places, resturants, shows and dire ctions.
hotelName:
25    Dear Hotel Madrid
51    Dear Hotel Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a great stay this noviembre. We were welcomed by Gador at our check in and check out. Al was arranged for and the service was impecable. We definitely will Come back.Also the welcome drink was serves with pleasure and great views over Madrid.
hotelName:
25    Dear Hotel Madrid
51    Dear Hotel Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We came in with no reservations and we loved this hotel! Excellent location in the middle of everything...close to all. Every morning there is a goodie bag on your door with breakfast a bottle of water. There is coffee machine juice and cookies and fruit all day long on the 5th floor. And a beautiful outdoor balcony. The staff is very helpful, caring and smiling.I would stay there again for sure!!!
hotelName:
15    B&B Hotel Madrid Fuencarral 52
52    B&B Hotel Madrid Fuencarral 52
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is very central and this is the best part of it. The rooms are clean but small. The staff is kind and helpful. The common room could be cleaner (and better quality teas!). Overall, pleasant stay but without praise or blame.
hotelName:
15    B&B Hotel Madrid Fuencarral 52
52    B&B Hotel Madrid Fuencarral 52
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location was close to metro station, walking distance to Plaza Mayor and any major attractions, bust street, my room was luckily not facing the street so it was quiet. The room decor was simple but very comfortable, shower was very good! Air conditioning was so-so, couldn't adjust it.Front desk staff not very engaging. I asked for a taxi to get to the airport in the early morning, they tried calling the taxi service once and then apologized they didn't answer and told me to stand on the street...No taxi's came in 15 minutes so I requested an Uber.I didn’t like that you don’t truly get a breakfast even though the property is called B&B. You get a bag delivered to your door daily with the same items, croissant, lemon muffin and one water-even though we were 2 guests we only got one water per person however we did get 2 of each mini pastry daily. If you want coffee to go with it, you need to go to the 5th floor to get it. Coffee, tea and juices available all day on the 5th floor. Vending machine is an option for snacks.I personally just wished it was your typical bed and breakfast spread that I experienced in other properties in Europe where I could sit and enjoy breakfast before leaving for the day.
hotelName:
15    B&B Hotel Madrid Fuencarral 52
52    B&B Hotel Madrid Fuencarral 52
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel entrance is a single door tucked in between 2 shops, blink and you'll miss it like the Leaky Cauldron so look up for the large B&B sign. It's opposite a Decathlon and Starbucks, plenty of shopping and food up and down the street. There may be a little bit of noise at night but I had no trouble getting to sleep. Check-in was quick and easy, the staff were friendly and always exchanged a greeting. The room is fairly spacious with a balcony that overlooks the street. Power points are built into the platform bed and easily accessible. Breakfast is a muffin, pastry and bottle of water hung on your door at around 7am. There is free tea/ coffee provided on the 5th floor as well.
hotelName:
15    B&B Hotel Madrid Fuencarral 52
52    B&B Hotel Madrid Fuencarral 52
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This little hotel on a busy shopping street in central Madrid met all our needs and more. It was quiet, had comfortable beds and pillows, a great rain shower, is in a safe and central location, has helpful staff, rooms have little fridges, and the upstairs terrace is a great meeting place with beverages and food available at all hours. We could easily walk on a side street to the interesting university district with restaurants, shops and markets. And the San Miguel Market isn’t too far away. The Tribunal metro stop is only about 10 minutes walk from this hotel.We also appreciate that this is the first hotel chain in Spain that has removed all of the disposable plastic in its rooms. The hand and shower soaps are in dispensers and are only lightly scented.Rooms are modern and functional rather than cozy, and that’s just great for a hotel.
hotelName:
15    B&B Hotel Madrid Fuencarral 52
52    B&B Hotel Madrid Fuencarral 52
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This B&B met all my expectations. Right in the centre, affordable priced, friendly staff, and very clean. What else would you need. The bed was good, the sanitary also. On the fifth floor there is a very nice terrace where you can take coffee, juices, bites (all inclusive)
hotelName:
15    B&B Hotel Madrid Fuencarral 52
52    B&B Hotel Madrid Fuencarral 52
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Well maintained hotel with good view. Perfect location. Rooms were small, but clean. We had balcony attached to our rooms, which gave us the view of the street below. It also had a common area, with continuous supply of coffee, fruits, juices, and fruits. Staff were polite and cordial. They helped us with the directions whenever asked. Location was also good. We could walk anywhere from the hotel. Overall we had a great experience, and could not have hoped better.
hotelName:
15    B&B Hotel Madrid Fuencarral 52
52    B&B Hotel Madrid Fuencarral 52
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stylish boutique style city centre hotel. Good value for standard of rooms and location. Bathroom modern and great shower. Big king sized bed but mattress a little soft for me. No street noice with balcony doors shut. Breakfast basic but hot and cold drinks and snacks available free of charge 24/7. Reception staff very friendly. Would definitely stay again.
hotelName:
15    B&B Hotel Madrid Fuencarral 52
52    B&B Hotel Madrid Fuencarral 52
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great little hotel!! Unassuming from entry but very nice and new on the inside. The front office staff were great especially Andrea. They have 25 hr. coffee, tea fruit available on the 5 th floor. They leave a little goodie bad on your door in the Am with a muffin, a pastry and a water. Very quiet as it is at the beginning of a pedestrian street that takes you down to the Gran Via. Highly recommend!!
hotelName:
15    B&B Hotel Madrid Fuencarral 52
52    B&B Hotel Madrid Fuencarral 52
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Every aspect of my stay was a step above and beyond what was necessary. I truly was sad to check out! Fabulous hotel located in the heart of central Madrid on the very popular Calle Gran Via. Front reception staff was actually friendly (hard to find in Madrid) who helped me get checked in.The lady also gave me a helpful map and pointed out where the 2 museums were that I wanted to visit. I arrived a bit early but it wasn’t a problem at all and I was able to have access to my room right away. My room was practical yet stylish. I loved the floor to ceiling mirror that also doubled as the bathroom door. As is common in Europe, the room card must be placed in the slot by the door for the electricity to work. In the bathroom, there was a narrow counter above the sink to place toiletries. There was a magnifying mirror next to the sink which was very much appreciated. The 1/2 glass shower door meant that the bath water did not spill out onto the floor. The drain worked well. There was a placard with instructions to work the shower however it made no sense at all and unfortunately was not helpful at all. The shower seemed to have one temperature, which was hotter than I cared for, a rarity in Europe where most often the problem seems to be the inability to get hot water. I appreciated the amenities that were provided, shower gel, shampoo, LOTION(!), a shower camp and a sponge. The shower drained well. Electrical outlets on both side of the bed were very convenient. The only possible drawback was that my room faced Calle Gran Via and was pretty noisy. I slept fine but others might find it a problem. There was a rooftop patio that explored one night but it was closed (December) while I was there
hotelName:
53    Vincci The Mint
82    Vincci The Mint
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of Vincci The Mint is phenomenal for sightseers and nightlife goers alike. It's no more than a 15 minute walk to any tourist destination you want to see, but also just behind the hotels is a series of back streets with local pubs and restaurants to Michelin star fine dining. The hotel was exceptionally well appointed and a great, fun place to hangout while in-between activities. Core vitals: the service was excellent, the hotel was clean, and the beds were comfortable. When I come back with friends, I will stay here again.
hotelName:
53    Vincci The Mint
82    Vincci The Mint
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 4 nights at the hotel during our first visit to Madrid. The staff at the hotel was probably the most welcoming staff we have ever encountered - they all did their best to make sure we will enjoy our stay.The hotel itself is located right at the heart of the Gran Via, within a walking distance from most of the major attractions.
hotelName:
53    Vincci The Mint
82    Vincci The Mint
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband, adult daughter, and myself stayed seven nights at Vincci The Mint room 409, a triple junior suite The reception staff was extremely friendly and helpful with transportation advice. We paid for the included breakfast and it was excellent. Instead of a buffet or a buffet combined with hot order, you simply order what you wanted from the expansive menu (everything from an Iberian ham platter to a cheese tray to yogurt and muesli to eggs, waffles, etc.) - the food was uniformly delicious and the wait staff (shout out to Alejandro) was so friendly. They even had soy milk for my dairy-sensitive daughter. We could not have been happier. In the rooms, the beds were very comfortable (they provided a third bed for my daughter instead of the pull-out couch that is customary in Europe triples and less comfortable) and it was behind a partial wall for some privacy. The bathroom was very spacious (especially by European standards) with double sinks, a towel warmer, and a tub shower with consistently good pressure and temperature control. The mini bar items were reasonably priced, there were ample outlets for our devices, and there were individual adjustable lamps beside the double bed. Extra touches: they left a typewritten multi-page list of the neighborhoods in Madrid and the activities, sites, favorite staff restaurants in each one. There is a gorgeous rooftop bar; however, it was too cold to enjoy that during our visit. There are tons of great restaurants within yards of the restaurant and the hotel is less than a 15 minute walk to the popular Puerto de Sol. Taxis are plentiful right outside the hotel door. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.
hotelName:
53    Vincci The Mint
82    Vincci The Mint
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing Property! Excellent staff and great common areas. It has a great location. Breakfast was excellent as well with plenty of options.it walking distance to main Madrid’s highlights and attractions. I’ll come back in the future for sure.
hotelName:
53    Vincci The Mint
82    Vincci The Mint
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent from check-in to check-out.Comfortable bed booked a junior suite which was spacious and quite.Very clean.Only issue which wasn't a problem for us, however, is you are less mobile the shower over the bath could be problematic if trying to step in due to the fixed shower panel meaning you were stepping into the slant at the back of the bath which was a bit unbalancing with no handrails.
hotelName:
53    Vincci The Mint
82    Vincci The Mint
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location in centre of Madrid close to Riquel park . Breakfast incl very generous. The rooms are very comfortable. Decoration at reception was original and fun. During the summer the rooftop is said to be a great hangout place for drinks.
hotelName:
53    Vincci The Mint
82    Vincci The Mint
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect place to visit Madrid! Breakfast is generous and very good. Super charming in reception, bar and house keeping always helpful. We traveled with a toddler got a nice cute cot for her and a special bathtub for baby without asking.
hotelName:
53    Vincci The Mint
82    Vincci The Mint
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I'm quite pleased to return to this place, almost every quarter for business. The location is great, and yet if there are some changes in the product portfolio they carry, the people there make all the difference. Always receiving with a smile and more importantly handling issues with a smile and feel of ease.
hotelName:
53    Vincci The Mint
82    Vincci The Mint
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Hotel Catalonia Las Cortes for 5 nights in November, 2019. Had originally booked a premium room but decided to upgrade to a superior room which was a great decision and worth the extra money. We had a corner suite with windows on two sides but the room was very quiet and well appointed. The bathroom had a bathtub and a full shower room. The front staff were VERY helpful, friendly and professional. The bar area off the lobby was convivial and made me killer g&t's! Having tapas and snacks available in the afternoon and evening was great. The Huertas barrio is calm, and walkable to so many great restaurants and bars. I can't wait to return to Madrid and would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
54    Catalonia Las Cortes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: In spite of the numerous road works around Madrid the hotel has a nice quiet but central location. Five minutes walk to the Prado or Puerto del Sol.I had a room on the first floor overlooking the central courtyard. Spacious with a well equipped bathroom including bath and separate shower stall, toilet and bidet.Close to lovely little restaurants.Breakfast was terrific - including a variety of meats, pastries, fresh bread, mixed fresh juices (eg carrot orange and ginger) and smoothies. And churros - freshly made. You can also request fresh eggs cooked a variety of ways including an omelette. The afternoon snacks included soup, coffee, sandwiches, cake, salads and a variety of local savouries.Nicely tucked away, this is a great option for those wanting to explore the central city on foot.
hotelName:
54    Catalonia Las Cortes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location. Extremely helpful and competent staff. Free snacks after 1 pm. Perfect room with mini-fridge, nespresso and water boiler. I actually would not know of any weak spots. Breakfast is charged separately (20 € pp but 18 with reduction). If you are satisfied with a coffee and a toast you may prefer to go out, but if you want a healthy breakfast that will last you for the rest of the day the hotel breakfast will be a very good choice. It is extremely varied and complete. And what you don’t see they may be able to provide anyway. Just ask. Free of charge.
hotelName:
54    Catalonia Las Cortes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room 504 is a moderately sized room on the top floor of this charismatic hotel housed in a former wealthy merchant’s mansion. It is situated 100m from the Plaza Santa Ana, so there are plenty of restaurants and bars readily available.It has an in-room safe, an iron and ironing board, an excellent Nespresso coffee machine and enough hangers for a short stay. There is a small work area with reasonable lighting. It has a suitcase stand at the end of the bed, our other case fitted underneath. The large bathroom had a shower over the bath and a bidet. It would be helpful if there was a non-slip bath mat and a face cloth, but we loved the heated towel rail.Breakfast was a very good selection of tasty hot and cold dishes with cereals and juices, with excellent coffee from a commercial Nespresso machine.The hotel offers a selection of free snacks during the afternoon and evening.
hotelName:
54    Catalonia Las Cortes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a great stay at the Catalonia Las Cortes hotel. Our room was lovely with a huge bed, very nice bathroom, and a great street view. The staff was very helpful and courteous. We enjoyed having drinks at the bar a few times during our stay, and very much appreciated the complimentary afternoon snacks. We did not partake in the breakfast buffet.
hotelName:
54    Catalonia Las Cortes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: rooms are very spacious and comfortable..I enjoyed my stay a lot indeed..good location with easy access to places..Worth spending money on..I would actually suggest it to everyone flying for business trips.
hotelName:
54    Catalonia Las Cortes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was very nice. Breakfast was fine. Tapa-like food items were offered from the afternoon on at no extra cost. In-house restaurant was limited in its offerings. Our windows overlooked the street and the street was quite noisy on a Saturday night.
hotelName:
54    Catalonia Las Cortes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A nice hotel in a convenient central location. I stay is here every year I'm in Madrid. Comfy beds and clean and quiet rooms. The breakfast is good, with plenty of choice.Room size varies hugely. This year I have a huge room - almost like a suite
hotelName:
54    Catalonia Las Cortes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed two nights while on a "road trip" through Spain.Excellent location for all the sights.Quiet just off the main road but near a great square with bars and restaurants.Good rooms although a little disappointing when you book two rooms at the same price and one is quite a bit bigger with a bath and shower and one is smaller with just a shower.Underground car park 2 minutes walk away, expensive but a small discount is available through the hotel.Would definitely recommend for a few nights stay.
hotelName:
54    Catalonia Las Cortes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We just came back from a trip here to see the Christmas lights in Madrid. This hotel was very well located and had the BEST towels I have had at a hotel in a long time. Add in great water pressure and you are assured a great rinse the minute you land after a long plane ride. The bed was the usual European fare but the pillows were nice. Rooftop bar was very nice, even on a December evening. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel
hotelName:
55    Hotel Atlantico
73    Hotel Atlantico
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had an amazing stay at Hotel Atlantico. The staff was friendly and helpful. Everyone at the front desk spoke English which was very helpful. The room was neat and clean and the bathroom was spacious. We had a great room on the 8th floor with a balcony where we could see and hear the sounds on Grand Via. It was nice to hear the street performers singing and playing music. When the door was closed we didn’t hear anything so it was great. This hotel is in the perfect spot for visiting Madrid. This is a main shopping and eating area and there is so much to explore in convenient walking distance. We will definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
55    Hotel Atlantico
73    Hotel Atlantico
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing location, near Puerta de sol, subway stations, pedestrian downtown, great rooms and beds, And all personnel, they were all fantastic, kind and willing to help. they have a wonderful terrace, you can have your champagne, watching all the happenings from top floor terrace, looking down on Grand Via. Breakfast Buffett is just amazing, all you can eat, from all cured and lunch meats, eggs, cereals, breads, fruit, juices, coffee and yes, great view. I'm going back in July 2020 and I will go back to Hotel Atlántico Madrid without a second thought. *****+ And also, a fair price for location, location, location and good quality.
hotelName:
55    Hotel Atlantico
73    Hotel Atlantico
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great welcome by friendly and efficient staff. Stayed twice at the beginning and at the end of our 3 week trek around Spain. Spacious, clean and beautifully decorated room, both times on the 8th floor. Relaxing and peaceful lounge. Hotel in a good position easy amble through the market on Sunday down to Plaza Mayor then to the rugby scrum in the excellent Mercardo! GF bread on request, plenty of other food choices available. Breakfast lady personable and fun! About 7 mins away is Celicioso cafe, Totally GF cafe, food was brilliant. We had a fantastic time in Spain, train services was excellent and efficient. Spain is full of life and they know how to have a good time so don't forget to pack some good earplugs. We bought mighty earplugs on line $25 before we left and had no problems sleeeping. Would stay again at this hotel.
hotelName:
55    Hotel Atlantico
73    Hotel Atlantico
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 6 nights here and really enjoyed it. From the moment we walked in the lobby, jet lagged from our flight from the USA, the front desk was so accommodating and helpful. I wish I’d gotten the name of one gentleman in particular who checked us in and helped us several times. Our room was perfect. A corner room on an upper floor. View with balcony over Gran Via. The housekeeping kept it spotlessIt had a luxurious bathroom. And a large variety of pillows of different firmness. We ate breakfast every morning. The room was large, good assortment of food and coffees. The terrace is lovely but when it’s was too cool the inside facilities were lovely and spacious. Bernardo took excellent care of us, we were up there almost every night for wine and food. In fact we looked forward to seeing him every evening. I would definitely return to this hotel. Everything is nearby. The location is brilliant. Thanks again for such a wonderful stay.
hotelName:
55    Hotel Atlantico
73    Hotel Atlantico
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked this Hotel online for a long weekend. It was not my first choice and was less expensive than I was prepared to pay. I had some reservations, as I was concerned from some of the pictures I saw online that it may be a little faded in its appearance, but I need not have worried. I arrived three hours before check-in hoping they would be happy to hold my luggage while I went in search of lunch. The staff at reception were most welcoming and spoke perfect English. Without me asking, they checked my reservation and found my room was ready. The room itself exceeded all my expectations. It was vast, clean, very well appointed and had a huge bathroom. The bathroom is worth a special mention, because the shower is without doubt THE finest shower I have ever experienced in any hotel anywhere in the world. The bathroom was palatial, with bidet and two sinks, a massive shower and an equally sized bath. The bedroom was similarly well appointed, the bed and bed linen perfect, there was an ironing board and iron, a safe, a minibar, all the usual things you find in a hotel room, but everything was of excellent quality. I have stayed in many hotels all over the world, over the last forty years but this ranks as good as the very best. I would not consider staying anywhere else in Madrid on my next visit. The hotel staff were fantastic and nothing was too much trouble. The location is also superb for a stay in the city.
hotelName:
55    Hotel Atlantico
73    Hotel Atlantico
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a room overlooking the Main Street. It was very large and had all we needed. The only drawback was the noise from the streets. The music went until 11pm per regulation. Aside from this it was a great stay.
hotelName:
55    Hotel Atlantico
73    Hotel Atlantico
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a great stay here in Madrid. The location is central to everything, we walked everywhere it was great. We didn't have any issues with noise and slept very well. We were upgraded because of Expedia which was nice. The hotel was very clean, I'd stay again!
hotelName:
55    Hotel Atlantico
73    Hotel Atlantico
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am really impressed with this 4* hotel in Madrid! Great service, comfortable rooms, nice terrrace and perfect location. In terms of value for money you do not find better hotel for business or pleasure in Madrid.
hotelName:
55    Hotel Atlantico
73    Hotel Atlantico
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: On a quiet street in Madrid that you'd miss if you weren't looking for it is this gem of a hotel. Beautiful place with well-appointed rooms, super comfortable beds, room to spread out. The staff is unfailingly excellent. We had cocktails at the bar a few times (highly recommend La Mula) and enjoyed every minute. It's in the literary part of town, which is also a delight (Calle de Cervantes, por ejemplo.)
hotelName:
56    Gran Hotel Ingles
91    Gran Hotel Ingles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Surprising. We only stay for one night and it's amazing how the staff can make you feel better than in your own home; the difference: it's a great luxury home. Prince, Almudena, Giulia and David welcomed us, gave us advice and said goodbye as if we were close for life. The reception in the hands of Isabel, Anabel and Sara was an absolute attention to any detail that we might need to have a more comfortable stay. The room service is impeccable, detailed and tidy. In the Lobo 8 restaurant we were lucky enough to be recommended by Chef Angelo and pastry chef Sergio, who would define the gastronomic concept as modern, personal, high quality and careful with the product. The restaurant service was very professional for the detailed description of each of the elaborations that served us as well as the concern for food intolerances. Alejandro, Raul, María and Marta serve you at breakfast and in the restaurant as pure lovers of their trade, they transmit their love for what they do. Lobbyto Cocktail Bar is the space of the lobby of the hotel converted into a spectacular cocktail of the 20s United States at a price more than fair for the quality of the signature cocktails of the hand of Mike and Fabri.Finally I prefer that you experience on your own the comfort, quality and luxury of the rooms and each of the details that are throughout the hotel. We'll be back next month yes or yes! Thank you Gran Hotel Inglés!
hotelName:
56    Gran Hotel Ingles
91    Gran Hotel Ingles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I returned last night from Madrid. We stayed in Gran Hotel Ingles for four nights and had a lovely time. The hotel is centrally located and in walking distance from a lot of hot spots.What makes it stand out is the staff who provided lots of nice personal touchea and made us feel special.For example, we received a handwritten welcome note in our room and later another note offering a spa discount.When I was disappointed by the shumai in the lobby restaurant, not only were the waiters apologetic and took the food off the bill, they later delivered chocolate cake to our room. It was a nice touch.When we told the manager how fabulous one of the concierge staff was (she got the Netflix adapter working and helped us watch TV in English), they later sent up two bottles of Coke Light, our beverage of choice with two glasses of ice. It was sweet that they noticed what beverage we liked and appreciated our compliment.Overall, we had a great stay here.
hotelName:
56    Gran Hotel Ingles
91    Gran Hotel Ingles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for 5 nights this September. I really liked our room which was located at the second floor and facing the small street in front of the hotel. I love the design of this boutique hotel.All of the staff were really helpful and properly trained. My Rating :Ambiance - 5 out of 5Service - 5 out of 5Food Quality - 5 out of 5Cleanliness - 5 out of 5Price Points - 5 out of 5
hotelName:
56    Gran Hotel Ingles
91    Gran Hotel Ingles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 4 nights, best indicator of how well located the hotel is that we didnt use a bus or taxi once. Room was very nice with very comfortable bed and great facilities. Staff were very friendly and attentive without being overbearing. Provided some very nice touches to make my sister's 50th Birthday that bit more special.
hotelName:
56    Gran Hotel Ingles
91    Gran Hotel Ingles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for one night and thought the hotel was excellent! Perfect location - central but on a quiet side street. Walking distance to the Prado museum and many other attractions. It is a luxury hotel with very helpful and friendly staff, from the man who checked us in to the concierge to the restaurant and bar people. The lobby is spacious, elegant and comfortable with a variety of places to sit and have a drink or just rest for a minute. The room was tastefully decorated with many amenities and comforts, and it all appears to be recently remodeled or new. We loved this hotel and would definitely return when we have more time to explore Madrid.
hotelName:
56    Gran Hotel Ingles
91    Gran Hotel Ingles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We could not have had a nicer stay in Madrid than at the Gran Hotel Ingles. I cannot say enough about how wonderful the staff was. From the first time we entered the hotel and got a hearty greeting from the doorman (well, really every time...), to check-in when our room was ready despite arriving quite early, the excellent service in the lobby bar, and the wonderful concierge who helped us with restaurant reservations and helped us sort out our train reservations that somehow went awry, the staff really made our stay great. The hotel is beautiful and well, truly luxurious. Our room was an absolute dream. I would absolutely stay at the Gran Hotel Ingles again in the future.
hotelName:
56    Gran Hotel Ingles
91    Gran Hotel Ingles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had such a wonderful time at the Gran Hotel Ingles. The staff are so friendly and work all very professional and are very focused on every detail. A truly 5 star hotel! We loved the full experience! We will definitely return! Keep up the great job!
hotelName:
56    Gran Hotel Ingles
91    Gran Hotel Ingles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A wonderful warm greeting when we arrived very early. Our beautiful room was quiet with a decadent bath. Perfect location in a quiet street with very little traffic. Delicious, fresh breakfast in a delightful dining room with expert and friendly service from Emanuella and others. This is without doubt the most delightful hotel we have stayed in for many years. It is the staff that make it so special. Everyone without exception - from reception to wait staff to bar staff and housekeeping - were all genuinely enthusiastic and keen to help make our stay so special. They all appeared to really enjoy their work and it showed. Some of the special people we came across were Lorena, Anabel, Julio, Jorge and Emanuella. Bravo to all of you! I hope we can return to Madrid soon and we would not consider staying anywhere else.
hotelName:
56    Gran Hotel Ingles
91    Gran Hotel Ingles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very large room and bathroom. Cleaning everyday. Nice and helpful staff. Very good location near a shopping center and Alsacia metro station (line 2 red - about 25 minutes to Sol station, in the hart of the town). Good breakfast with a great range of food.
hotelName:
57    Silken Torre Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms are clean and spacious. They were cleaned every day. Has a metro station 100 m away and a large grocery store with shopping centers. The place is quiet and peaceful. The staff is helpful and kind.
hotelName:
57    Silken Torre Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am not happy with hotel. We planned to visit a garden which is specified in the name of hotel, but this garden is for some reason closed and there is no place to spend time in the evening absolutely. In the evening in bar you should have coffee in it is dazzling bright light then your eyes hurt. On a reception personnel not friendly, without attention for you. In number an unpleasant smell from the air conditioner, it is impossible to sleep with such smell. I think that ventilation is never cleaned. At departure from hotel the retsepshionist wanted to take money for a breakfast, without having checked that we already paid for it. We will never return to this hotel!!! For this money it is possible to find good hotel 4 stars!!! We moved to other hotel
hotelName:
57    Silken Torre Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was the best we stayed at, during our one week trip to central Spain. All the basics hotel needs are there and our room was very spacious and enough electricity outlets.The only thing we didn't really like was the bed, as it was a queen size single mattress. My gf and I prefer to sleep in the same doubel bed but on separate single mattresses. Also, don't expect things to be in tiptop shape. The interior design and furniture are a bit dated and here and there worn down. These little things don't affect comfort but prevent me from giving this hotel 5 stars. For Spanish standards breakfast was very nice, with a great assortment of food and drink options. For northern european standards breakfast was a bit basic.Staff was very nice though and helped us with printing our boarding passes.Location is also excellent with free street parking, not a lot of traffic noise, and close proximity to metro/subway station and shopping mall.
hotelName:
57    Silken Torre Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very clean and comfortable hotel conveniently situated to explore the centre of Madrid. The Metro is just a few minutes walk away, but if you prefer you can take an Uber cab into the centre for around 14 euros or less. The waiting time for an Uber in this area is about 3 minutes.At the hotel itself there is plenty of outside space but at the time of our visit these areas were closed. Overall the staff could have been a little more friendly and whilst the buffet breakfast was adequate staff could have kept a closer eye on keeping the buffet refreshed during service.Having said that, I would not hesitate to return to the hotel again as a base to explore this amazing City.
hotelName:
57    Silken Torre Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Silken Torre Garden is still a good hotel, even if signs are everywhere, that a refurbishing would be very welcomed. For us, the main attraction is its location. When our flight arrives in Madrid, where we spend only one night before with the hired car we start to explore Spain; Silken Torre Garden is an excellent choice to avoid the traffic of the city center. Their breakfast is nothing special, but with their offers, everyone can have a decent meal. For me, the breakfast is called a good one, if I can have Pan con Tomate- Tostada di Tomato. A few years ago I fell in love with it, when we visited Spain, and it is still one of my favorites. The hotel has spacious rooms, a decorative foyer, but the wind of decay is swirling everywhere. If your eyesight isn't sharp anymore, or if you aren't examine everything with critical eyes, probably you can be fully and foolishly satisfied. For example, maybe you don't notice, or, don't care about the good quality, but already greyish towels, the rotting bottom of the bathroom door, or the patches on the carpet. We can say that all these are just a flaw in beauty and do not affect the comfort of travelers, which is partly true because otherwise, we would have chosen a different hotel. Still sad to see, maybe, because of a lack of money or negligence, they leave a high standard hotel to go down. I hope that next year if we drop in again, this accommodation will shine in its old light.The staff is nice, courteous, and there is - or at least during our visits it was - a free of charge unlimited time parking on the street. If you aren't that lucky, the hotel offers to park in its garage for € 11- / night.
hotelName:
57    Silken Torre Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice hotel. It is 2 min from the metro, 3 min from a carrefour and mall. Clean! WiFi doesn’t work pretty good at the rooms but it works good in the lobby. I will use it again. Staff very friendly.
hotelName:
57    Silken Torre Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Visited with a group. Bed was ok. Hot shower. Lotsa road noise. Wifi was essentially non functional from 6-midnite. Clearly to many users for too little WiFi. It was acceptable for the group, but I’d prolly step up a bit if it was just me. It was a typical European hotel.
hotelName:
57    Silken Torre Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The ataff are very friendly and welcoming. The hotel is great value for what you get, amazing big room and bathroom, the view was great - beautiful at sunrise and sunset. The hotel is close to the metro which is 15 minutes away from the city centre.The breakfast was simple but there is lots to choose from. I would fully recommend and I already have. Couldn't ask for anything better.
hotelName:
57    Silken Torre Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful boutique hotel with modern comfortable rooms. Great location. Staff were super nice and super helpful. We were made to feel so welcome. They even got our son a present on Christmas Eve - and it was his favorite gift of all! It’s the sort of hotel you wish all hotels were like.
hotelName:
58    The Principal Madrid
64    The Principal Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is an excellent choice for a stay in Madrid. The hotel is close to the biggest sights and the rooms are well maintained. The vibe of the hotel is more masculine and dark, but we found it an excellent choice as a family with a small child, especially as the hotel provided us a crib for our stay. If we ever return to Madrid, I could see us staying here again.
hotelName:
58    The Principal Madrid
64    The Principal Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What can I say about the Principal? A trendy cool and sexy hotel located in the heart of Madrid right in the middle of the Gran Via a kind of Broadway with European flair. The staff is incredibly efficient and genuinely friendly: faultless real hosts The common areas located on the 6th floor are really appealing with comfy sofas and a stunning terrace overlooking the impressive Avenue and a big chunk of Madrid's finest buildings. The room was incredibly big with a huge window with front views of the Metropolis Building, great gigantic bed and modern bathroom with super shower. Lunch at the Atico restaurant by Ramon Freixa is also a great opportunity to get to know to the richest Spanish produce through its diverse dishes. Breakfast is served in the same place with a very nice buffet and a wide range of hot dishes cooked a la minute. All in all: the place to be in Madrid
hotelName:
58    The Principal Madrid
64    The Principal Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked a superior room with breakfast at the Principal for my husbands 30th birthday. We were not disappointed - and only wish we booked for a longer stay! The room itself was a good size, it had everything we needed (including birthday champagne and chocolates from the hotel), and the breakfast was very very good (mix of buffet and a la carte). The location of the hotel was really great - we could walk everywhere from the hotel, and anywhere that was too far to walk we were very close to the Metro station. The service was excellent and we got an extended check out time. One negative - is we asked the hotel to recommend somewhere for Tapas (we like to eat like locals), and were advised to go to Gran Via to find somewhere (which is full of tourists), and not the kind of recommendation we were expecting. Would not hesitate in recommending this hotel otherwise.
hotelName:
58    The Principal Madrid
64    The Principal Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I chose the principal hotel in Madrid to be the place where I would propose to my now fiancé and it was a great decision. The hotel itself was amazing and perfect in itself but what took it to the next level was the staff. All of my requests no matter how complex were welcomed with enthusiasm and brought to life. A few examples are things such as communicating with the photographer, arranging a beautiful and stunning stage on the terrace, greeting us by name at every chance and personal congratulations from all staff after the proposal. I have no complaints in any form and encourage everyone to choose the principal Madrid for a magical experience. I am so happy I chose them for such an important night which was completely perfect.
hotelName:
58    The Principal Madrid
64    The Principal Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is good, breakfast and breakfast staff, very very good.The bed, possibly the best sleep I have ever had in any hotel in any country.Now comes comes the negatives,Internet works well but very annoying as you have to sign in every day with laptop and phone, most hotels it's every three days.I tried room service twice, the pasta could only be Penne and served hard as if uncooked.The 'Do Not Disturb' sign is ignored. I had to complain at Reception.The room cleaning people shout outside all the rooms every day as if selling fish in a market, even after I shouted at two of them on different days, not great if you happen to be working nights or want to sleep in after a long night out.
hotelName:
58    The Principal Madrid
64    The Principal Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a very good time in Madrid, the hotel was super central and they helped me a lot when I needed something or some recommendations for sightseeing. It was a very good experience! Thanks a lot to the kind staff :)
hotelName:
58    The Principal Madrid
64    The Principal Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Principal is well located for access to the museums, the Royal Palace, the Wizink Centre, and Madrid's wealth of shopping options. The staff are helpful and friendly, the rooms are well serviced, clean and generous. Breakfasts are excellent, the choices broad. Taxis are always easily called to the door and good restaurants and more simple eateries are a short walk away. Who wants more?
hotelName:
58    The Principal Madrid
64    The Principal Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here our last night before returning to Toronto . We wish it could have been longer. After staying in over 5 hotels in Spain , one 3 times the price and a 5 star .. the Principal is our favourite , demonstrating bigger and more expensive isn’t better. While it’s small , the junior suite was the largest thus far. The service is what sets this elegant hotel apart. As avid travellers , it was one of our top 10 in the world. Right from check in , to their stunning patio and restaurant food , to the airport transportation . Each and every member of their staff were not only welcoming , but pleasant and happy people . If I could rate this hotel a 6, I would ! (Also, perfect location !, close to everything one needs)
hotelName:
58    The Principal Madrid
64    The Principal Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very good location next to everything right on the gran via very nice and helpfull stuff especially Pablo who was so nice and kind breakfast was delicious .if I will come to Madrid again I will certainly choose this hotel again.Very reccomend. Thank you Orly
hotelName:
59    Petit Palace Triball
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Again and again I really enjoyed my stay in petit palace triball. This almost my tenth stay there. Every thing amazing as usual breakfast, cleaning, comfortable bed and the most friendly staff I have been met. They do their best to help me at anything and everything. Amazing hotel, amazing staff, amazing location
hotelName:
59    Petit Palace Triball
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is well located and clean. It is rather basic with minimal toiletries. Quality of sheets and towels could be improved.Its breakfast is excellent with wide choices and fresh fruit, all you need for powering up to walk around Madrid. Overall I feel it is a good value hotel!
hotelName:
59    Petit Palace Triball
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great stay.. very kind serviceA hotel that dont waste plasticGreat breakfastAmazinggggClean roomsLucia and lidia from the reception are very kindWe will come back for sure Huan is great also :)
hotelName:
59    Petit Palace Triball
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful hotel located right in city centre just next door to Primark on Gran Via. I highly recommend this boutique hotel which was perfect for us - Central, quiet, clean, friendly, welcoming, very accomodating, quality bedding + toileteries. Room 903 with its beautiful huge terrace + spacious room was incredible. Congratulations and we will be back. A very special thank you note to Pablo at reception who was fantastic, professional and vey kind to us. He even brought our bags to the taxi boot parked in the street. We were very touched. Many thanks indeed Pablo. Congratulations to the whole team for our unforgettable stay with you in your beautiful hotel and stunning city.
hotelName:
59    Petit Palace Triball
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is great and the staff friendly. I loved the healthy choices for breakfast. Everything was fresh and delicious with good options for vegan/vegetarians. The bathroom was big enough, clean and fresh while the room was a bit small. The corridors of the hotel a bit rundown and thus in sharp contrast with the hall and the rooms. Overall, I had a pleasant and comfortable stay.
hotelName:
59    Petit Palace Triball
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is ideally located off Gran Via and easily walkable to most major sites. There’s a metro stop nearby if you prefer. The front desk staff are friendly and very helpful. A special shout-out to Daniel, who couldn’t have been more accommodating.After emailing the hotel about the rooms, we chose to be in the annex, mostly because they promised the rooftop patio to offer spectacular views of the city. However, the only views are the sky above. The walls around the patio are so high that it’s impossible to see through or above them. All you can see is wall.We travelled with friends, and reserved the same category room. We made it clear in booking that we were couples traveling together, While our rooms were neighboring, Our friends received a room which was actually a suite, while we had a room so tiny that we had no place to put our luggage. We pointed this out to the front desk, and they contacted an “acting manager”, who arrived several hours later. She explained that there is one superior room and our friends just happen to get it. So while they had a bedroom with a large bed, hallway, and sitting room and large bathroom, we paid the same to have a tiny room.We requested, in exchange, free breakfast and a room discount, We did receive the breakfasts, but no adjustment was made to our bill. While we were promised an email from the manager regarding this issue, we never received any wordIn addition, the walls of the rooms are so thin, we could hear conversations in nearby rooms. We literally spoke with our friends through the walls.We expected better from this hotel.
hotelName:
59    Petit Palace Triball
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It has no laundry room but no hotel in Europe does. Great location,close to everything. Elevators are tiny, only two can fit with luggage. Great and friendly staff. They called and reserved a flamenco show that was the highlight of our vacation. And recommended what was also The best food we had on the entire trip (paella fron " la paella de la Reina").
hotelName:
59    Petit Palace Triball
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived at the hotel at 11am and received the room even though the official check-in time is at 2pm. Lucia from the reception received us amazingly, was patient, and explained everything we needed to know. We had a small problem with the room, but as soon as we called the reception Lucia helped us very quickly, was attentive, offered solutions and even came to the room and eventually moved us to another room which was excellent.The hotel location is amazing - close to all the important spots, and gives an amazing shopping experience- get to the room, put in the new items we just shopped, freshen up and move on to the next shop. We didn't use the metro at all because each destination was up to 15 minutes walk.Breakfast was excellent, full of fruits and vegetables and health products.The service of the hotel staff is outstanding, I have been to a lot of hotels in Europe and around the world and nowhere have I encountered a staff so dedicated to helping. Thank you for everything!
hotelName:
59    Petit Palace Triball
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was clean, comfortable and pleasantly decorated. It was also quiet. Not terribly roomy, but normal for Europe. It's very centrally located, too. The staff was extremely helpful. I forgot an expensive dental device in the room, and they very kindly mailed it to me. No one could have wrapped more carefully than they did. We will stay there again.
hotelName:
60    Hotel Moderno
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is located meters from Plaza del Sol. Staff was friendly and helpful. Room was adequate. mine was to the back of the hotel so it wasn't noisy, I assume those rooms facing Plaza will be quite noisy. The only cons: bed was quite short. I am 5'9" and my feet hung from the edge when totally stretch and can't control the heater/air conditioning. Again. glad my room faced to the back so I was able to open the window to cool the room.
hotelName:
60    Hotel Moderno
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very comfortable hotel in the best area for seeing all the main sites of Madrid. The staff are very pleasant and helpful. Would always stay here when I visit Madrid.I had an unfortunate booking for a tour that I had made online in the UK and it did not exist, Jabien on reception was so kind in helping me sort the matter out, I was so grateful for all the trouble he took to help me.
hotelName:
60    Hotel Moderno
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at the Hotel Moderno for a 3-night weekend break. Found it to be an excellent budget hotel, unbeatable insofar as location goes given that it stands bang on the Puerta del Sol, with consequent easy access to practically all the city's main landmarks! In any case, Madrid's efficient Metro system is just a few steps away. We had a top-floor room which had a small private terrace facing a side street. Room space was sufficient if smallish, and bathroom amenities were more than adequate. Hospitality services were good and the web price-included buffet breakfast was plentiful and varied. Reception staff were helpful and efficient. In short, Hotel Moderno offers very good value for money and we would readily stay again and/or recommend to friends.
hotelName:
60    Hotel Moderno
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just off the Puerta del Sol with most of the major downtown attractions within walking distance, the Moderno is a worthy stay in the heart of Madrid. The rooms are snug but tolerable, it's a solid choice in a prime location
hotelName:
60    Hotel Moderno
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is in the heart of the Spanish capital next to La Puerta del Sol, which allows the traveler to witness all events that take place in such a busy plaza and besides it is a at walking distance from important places such as El Museo del Jamón, San Miguel Market and La Gran Via among others.The hotel rooms, although not too spacious are cozy and the hotel staff is friendly. If I ever went to Madrid again, I would choose Hotel Moderno again
hotelName:
60    Hotel Moderno
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely hotel, clean and adequate room size. The staff was very courteous and helpful. The breakfast had a very nice selection. Within walking distance to many sites, restaurants, and shopping. Would recommend.
hotelName:
60    Hotel Moderno
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Moderno was the perfect finale to our October 2019 visit. Our room was very nice w/a balcony, the daily breakfast was plenty and delicious.The staff was pleasant and informative, recommending restaurants that wer found wonderful and fairly priced. We returned multiple nights. The location was superb, most sites within walking distance.
hotelName:
60    Hotel Moderno
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 3-5 October 2019: Just steps away from Puerta del Sol, Hotel Moderno is wonderfully located near restaurants, shops and the Metro. The staff was very friendly and efficient! When we asked front desk staff for assistance in completing an online purchase of bullfight tickets, they quickly took us to the office of Hotel Manager Santi Bello, who offered us his extra tickets for that night. At the bullfight he gave us a private lesson throughout the event on all of the intricacies of the bullfight. Absolutely wonderful! We love Santi! He and his staff also made reservations for us at Cafe Gallega, a nice seafood-focused restaurant just a few minutes from the hotel. In addition, we highly recommend the Superior room with terrace and Arenal street view. Ours on the sixth floor was very clean, efficiently laid out, in very good condition and had a great view overlooking Calle del Arenal. The lounge/sitting room (with computer) located on the first floor was also quite comfortable and large. We will definitely return to Hotel Moderno!! Thank you very much to our great friend Santi and his staff!!
hotelName:
60    Hotel Moderno
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked this hotel for its location and ranking on Trip Advisor. Lobby, common area and breakfast/bar area are modern and elegant. Our room was spacious and had a California king bed. The bathroom offers a rain shower and a large bathtub. We came in December and yet enjoyed the views from the rooftop deck that is worth visiting. Our room rate included the breakfast which was worth it and offered a nice buffet and the option to have eggs made to order. I recommend the Spanish omelette.
hotelName:
61    Gran Melia Palacio de Los Duques - The Leading...
63    Gran Melia Palacio de Los Duques - The Leading...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Elegant and charming hotel. Breakfast rooms and food quality was excellent. Different choice of food and drinks. Room was small but overall good. Bed was comfortable and pillows choice was good. Common area very nice and classy. Staff nice and welcoming. Very good top floor swimming pool with very kindly staff.
hotelName:
61    Gran Melia Palacio de Los Duques - The Leading...
63    Gran Melia Palacio de Los Duques - The Leading...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Special thanks to Vie and Jay in the breakfast restaurant. Once again great service .Hotel whilst looking a bit tired is more than worthwhile just based on the service alonwRecommend the melia to everyone. Best breakfast and service in Asia
hotelName:
61    Gran Melia Palacio de Los Duques - The Leading...

review_body: First, book through COSTCO. If you don't, you're crazy. They get you the best rates, and even if you scrape and find the same rate, you have COSTCO standing behind you if there is a problem, and none of these hotels want a problem with COSTCO. Our reservation included a nice "black car" transfer from Madrid airport. We arrived early (around noon) and they bought us a cocktail while we waited 30 minutes for our room. The service from the front door folks, front desk, housekeeping and concierge were all top notch. The location is perfect for all the important sites around the Palace and the historic district. Heat and A/C work great, and they had plenty of USB connections to charge phones. The street it faces is very quiet at night, except for the night there was a small riot with tear gas out front. Nothing the Hotel could do, and it was happening all over town. It was a minor demonstration, but the Police take it very seriously. Not kidding about the tear gas. The breakfast buffet was outstanding and the service would remind you of the best hotels state side. We could all the wait staff helpful and friendly. You can't miss with this hotel. STAY HERE!!

63    Gran Melia Palacio de Los Duques - The Leading...

review_body: A great choice in the centre of Madrid; easily accessible by public transport and from the airport by Metro. The hotel is within walking distance of all the attractions that central Madrid has to offer.The staff were friendly and helpful and check in was efficient. My room on the 7th floor was adequate for a city stay - typical European size, but spacious enough not to feel crammed. The room was clean and in good condition with complimentary tea/coffee making facilities. The en-suite washroom with a shower had complimentary Avena products as well as large comfortable dressing gowns.Breakfast was served at El Gato Canalla and although not massive had everything you’d need from a breakfast buffet - cheeses, meats, vegetables, juices, breads, cereals and more. Gluten free products are available on the buffet as well as bread rolls on request. If your rate is inclusive of breakfast then in addition to the buffet, you get the choice of a hot meal from the a la carte menu. The evening menu is also very interesting and reservations are recommended especially at the weekend, as we were not able to get a walk in table, even though we arrived early while the restaurant was still empty.The bar by reception is also a nice place to relax and have a drink.During our stay, the Sky Lounge and rooftop pool were closed for renovation. The one thing that I found extremely disappointing about my stay, was the initial contact I had with the hotel prior to arrival. Three days prior to arrival, I e-mailed the hotel advising of my late evening arrival and requesting a room close to friends who were also staying at the hotel at the same time. Without even acknowledging my request, the reservations staff proceeded to pre-charge the payment for the room (I booked a flexible rate), and for some reason were unable to do so. I then received an email informing me of this and advising me that if payment is not sorted within 48 hours they would have to cancel my booking. I found this to be very unwelcoming, and had my friends not been staying at the hotel too, I would have cancelled and booked elsewhere. Having spoken to my bank, I responded that there was no issue with the card they had on file, and requested they try again, which they did with no issues. A day later, they acknowledged my initial request. I feel they could have managed this in a more welcoming manner - if it was important for them to pre-authorise payment that early, given that my rate allowed me to cancel free of charge until the evening before arrival, they could have pointed it out and still acknowledge my request. In a way, I was being told that without a guarantee of payment, they would not consider any requests.All in all, this was a very good stay in Madrid. There is a vast choice of hotels in the city, and I would still consider the Indigo, but I would certainly look at other options before deciding.
hotelName:
30    Hotel Indigo Madrid - Gran Via
62    Hotel Indigo Madrid - Gran Via
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Indigo brand has become my favourite in the IHG group as they are rapidly expanding the number of properties around the world. So when I was given a two day assignment in this area of Madrid it seemed like a good option. I was particularly taken by the line in the hotel's IHG Website PR; "take a cooling dip in our rooftop infinity pool" you just might expect to be able to do a few laps in the morning before starting work. Photos of said pool with a sunset background at the "right angles" looked far bigger than reality, it had me sold. Even better a few days before arrival I noted as a Spire member I had been upgraded to a suite.On check-in the supervisor apologised that my upgraded room had been sold you know how it is... well not really. But to make up they would give me the other suite for my second night. I explained I had an evening flight when I check out would it be possible to keep my room to just before 3pm (past the usual 2pm extension). He paused then agreed locked in I thought. First morning I headed to the pool which is part of their themed bar, with sunbeds and pool area down some steps for an early swim. No luck! Access via the bar does not open until 10am. So I go back a couple of hours later only to find a lone barman starting to set up. He says he will take me down as the changing room area was still locked. As I enter the area I trip on a raised door frame and the drop to the lower floor inside and fall flat on my face, quick reflexes limit my injury to a bruised hip and arm. In full view of the barman he is concern, and says it is a dangerous step and informs me a woman had broken her arm (or was it a leg) just a few weeks prior same spot... OK so NO SIGNS warning guests in any language or better still a ramp to avoid the drop. I mention it at the front desk to a couple of staff and nobody seems particularly concerned or aware of the woman's injury. As for the pool it is barely more than a plunge pool maybe 15m and is not heated so no more than 16C, so yes you will get "a cooling dip" as the sun does not hit the pool until the afternoon!My first room had no view other than the next building with limited natural light, the suite was spacious and comfortable but has no natural light whatsoever. The only highlight of the hotel for me is the sunset at the rooftop bar with some nice light food options to go with your drinks. I have waited until I returned home to write this review as I was too angry after checkout to give a fair appraisal. I landed at reception at 2:45pm to make my way to the airport. An inexperienced young lady on reception processed my account and advised me I had been charged fifteen Euros for my late checkout. I explained to her I had spoken with a supervisor when I arrived and he had approved the extension. She would have none of that and kept insisting on the payment. I asked to see the supervisor then the Duty manager until then she remained insistant. Around twenty years with IHG as a loyal member most in recent years at Spire level. The standard of staff (training) here is hit or mainly miss, especially if you don't speak Spanish. You are paying for the location.
hotelName:
30    Hotel Indigo Madrid - Gran Via
62    Hotel Indigo Madrid - Gran Via
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We staid there a total of 9 nights and the staff was incredible. We had interaction with several staff members and they were all just the best. They gave us great recommendations, helped us book train tickets, helped us with shows, etc. The location was perfect, the hotel super clean, beds were sooo comfortable. I will be staying again when I return to Madrid.

62    Hotel Indigo Madrid - Gran Via
