review_body: Great location, 2 mins from Callao metro station, round the corner from loads of lovely restaurants & within easy walking distance to everywhere we wanted to go in Madrid. Staff friendly, helpful & very efficient. Room fab with huge bed & great shower. Loved the roof top bar too. We will definitely stay here next time we are in Madrid. Highly recommend.
hotelName:
30    Hotel Indigo Madrid - Gran Via
62    Hotel Indigo Madrid - Gran Via
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a fantastic time in Madrid at the Hotel Indigo Gran Via.Anastasia and Alex, enthusiastic staff that went well beyond to ensure we had a wonderful time and provided invaluable recommendations and answers to our numerous questions.Thank you very much for your incredible service.The hotel is in a great location with easy access to the many sites Madrid has to offer. The Metro is very close by along with many good eating options and shopping.We had a fantastic stay. Thanks !
hotelName:
30    Hotel Indigo Madrid - Gran Via
62    Hotel Indigo Madrid - Gran Via
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Slightly mystified by this hotel’s rating. It’s OK but nothing special. Best bits are location and the excellent breakfast choice (though at €17 it should be good). Be aware that all the standard rooms face onto a very dark internal lightwell. The window also faces the bathroom so if you’re in bed it feels like you’re in a windowless cell! We asked to be moved as our first room on the 5th floor was so claustrophobic. They kindly moved us to the 9th floor which was a bit brighter as closer to the sky but still not great. Make sure you check out the Malasaña neighbourhood a couple of blocks north across Gran Via - lots of cool bars and cafes.
hotelName:
30    Hotel Indigo Madrid - Gran Via
62    Hotel Indigo Madrid - Gran Via
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 4 star boutique style hotel. Very modern and very clean. Staff eager to make sure you have all you need and that you’re happy with it. Rooftop bar has lovely view across the rooftops and good view of sunsets. Staff there really friendly. Had a great weekend (4nights) with hotel perfectly positioned in center of Madrid so you can reach any of places of interest easily. The only ‘average’ thing about the hotel was it’s food. Very unimaginative although quite tasty.
hotelName:
30    Hotel Indigo Madrid - Gran Via
62    Hotel Indigo Madrid - Gran Via
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were promoted to a nice spacy corner room at higher floor for being an elite member. Stepped into our room, found one bottle of local red wine as a courtesy welcome. Unfortunately, the A/C was not working. We had to "downgrade" to another double room. They offered complimentary breakfast for our inconvenience. The upscale breakfast is a surprise beyond our expectation. Super close to subway stations for all attractions. Calle Gran Via is active day and night for tons of activies and eatery. The only down side was the consturction next door at the time we stayed.
hotelName:
30    Hotel Indigo Madrid - Gran Via
62    Hotel Indigo Madrid - Gran Via
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The only positive thing about this hotel is location and reception staff.Extremely disappointed with the hotel itself, the lifts are painfully slow, they only have 2 and you can wait 10minutes for a lift to arrive.The rooftop pool is poorly designed, most of the sun is blocked by a canapé.It was also closed 2 out of 3 evenings we were staying due to ‘private’ functions. This is Not good.They have a very small bar downstairs in the courtyard.There is also construction work next door.It feels like the hotel has been squeezed in between 2 buildings.This is our first and last stay.
hotelName:

62    Hotel Indigo Madrid - Gran Via

review_body: We booked this hotel for its location and ranking on Trip Advisor. Lobby, common area and breakfast/bar area are modern and elegant. Our room was spacious and had a California king bed. The bathroom offers a rain shower and a large bathtub. We came in December and yet enjoyed the views from the rooftop deck that is worth visiting. Our room rate included the breakfast which was worth it and offered a nice buffet and the option to have eggs made to order. I recommend the Spanish omelette.

review_body: Wonderful boutique hotel with modern comfortable rooms. Great location. Staff were super nice and super helpful. We were made to feel so welcome. They even got our son a present on Christmas Eve - and it was his favorite gift of all! It’s the sort of hotel you wish all hotels were like.
hotelName:
58    The Principal Madrid
64    The Principal Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is an excellent choice for a stay in Madrid. The hotel is close to the biggest sights and the rooms are well maintained. The vibe of the hotel is more masculine and dark, but we found it an excellent choice as a family with a small child, especially as the hotel provided us a crib for our stay. If we ever return to Madrid, I could see us staying here again.
hotelName:
58    The Principal Madrid
64    The Principal Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What can I say about the Principal? A trendy cool and sexy hotel located in the heart of Madrid right in the middle of the Gran Via a kind of Broadway with European flair. The staff is incredibly efficient and genuinely friendly: faultless real hosts The common areas located on the 6th floor are really appealing with comfy sofas and a stunning terrace overlooking the impressive Avenue and a big chunk of Madrid's finest buildings. The room was incredibly big with a huge window with front views of the Metropolis Building, great gigantic bed and modern bathroom with super shower. Lunch at the Atico restaurant by Ramon Freixa is also a great opportunity to get to know to the richest Spanish produce through its diverse dishes. Breakfast is served in the same place with a very nice buffet and a wide range of hot dishes cooked a la minute. All in all: the place to be in Madrid
hotelName:
58    The Principal Madrid
64    The Principal Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked a superior room with breakfast at the Principal for my husbands 30th birthday. We were not disappointed - and only wish we booked for a longer stay! The room itself was a good size, it had everything we needed (including birthday champagne and chocolates from the hotel), and the breakfast was very very good (mix of buffet and a la carte). The location of the hotel was really great - we could walk everywhere from the hotel, and anywhere that was too far to walk we were very close to the Metro station. The service was excellent and we got an extended check out time. One negative - is we asked the hotel to recommend somewhere for Tapas (we like to eat like locals), and were advised to go to Gran Via to find somewhere (which is full of tourists), and not the kind of recommendation we were expecting. Would not hesitate in recommending this hotel otherwise.
hotelName:
58    The Principal Madrid
64    The Principal Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I chose the principal hotel in Madrid to be the place where I would propose to my now fiancé and it was a great decision. The hotel itself was amazing and perfect in itself but what took it to the next level was the staff. All of my requests no matter how complex were welcomed with enthusiasm and brought to life. A few examples are things such as communicating with the photographer, arranging a beautiful and stunning stage on the terrace, greeting us by name at every chance and personal congratulations from all staff after the proposal. I have no complaints in any form and encourage everyone to choose the principal Madrid for a magical experience. I am so happy I chose them for such an important night which was completely perfect.
hotelName:
58    The Principal Madrid
64    The Principal Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is good, breakfast and breakfast staff, very very good.The bed, possibly the best sleep I have ever had in any hotel in any country.Now comes comes the negatives,Internet works well but very annoying as you have to sign in every day with laptop and phone, most hotels it's every three days.I tried room service twice, the pasta could only be Penne and served hard as if uncooked.The 'Do Not Disturb' sign is ignored. I had to complain at Reception.The room cleaning people shout outside all the rooms every day as if selling fish in a market, even after I shouted at two of them on different days, not great if you happen to be working nights or want to sleep in after a long night out.
hotelName:
58    The Principal Madrid
64    The Principal Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a very good time in Madrid, the hotel was super central and they helped me a lot when I needed something or some recommendations for sightseeing. It was a very good experience! Thanks a lot to the kind staff :)
hotelName:
58    The Principal Madrid
64    The Principal Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Principal is well located for access to the museums, the Royal Palace, the Wizink Centre, and Madrid's wealth of shopping options. The staff are helpful and friendly, the rooms are well serviced, clean and generous. Breakfasts are excellent, the choices broad. Taxis are always easily called to the door and good restaurants and more simple eateries are a short walk away. Who wants more?
hotelName:
58    The Principal Madrid
64    The Principal Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here our last night before returning to Toronto . We wish it could have been longer. After staying in over 5 hotels in Spain , one 3 times the price and a 5 star .. the Principal is our favourite , demonstrating bigger and more expensive isn’t better. While it’s small , the junior suite was the largest thus far. The service is what sets this elegant hotel apart. As avid travellers , it was one of our top 10 in the world. Right from check in , to their stunning patio and restaurant food , to the airport transportation . Each and every member of their staff were not only welcoming , but pleasant and happy people . If I could rate this hotel a 6, I would ! (Also, perfect location !, close to everything one needs)
hotelName:
58    The Principal Madrid
64    The Principal Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: great location, in the heart of the Grand Via st. positioned between the best restaurants and shopping area. great facility, welcoming stuff, room are well equipped. the shower was large, spoiling and new. water were FOC and I could get as many as I can.
hotelName:
65    Hyatt Centric Gran Via Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Superbly situated hotel Restaurant was great attentive staff and great food Staff were very helpful when I needed assistance. Would definitely stay againHighly recommend this hotel next time your looking for a break in Madrid
hotelName:
65    Hyatt Centric Gran Via Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is located in the heart of shopping in Madrid. You can walk to so many great stores and restaurants. We had a small suite on the second floor overlooking Gran Via. You could hear slight noise from the street in our room, but the bed was comfortable so we had no trouble sleeping. The room was cleaned daily and the maids did an outstanding job. The only thing I don't recommend was the room service- although it was late at night when we ordered so perhaps that is why the food wasn't great.
hotelName:
65    Hyatt Centric Gran Via Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I love Hyatt hotels in general but this hotel is next level amazing. Its great location helps when you have a limited time in Madrid, which we did. Everything was within walking distance including the plaza mayor. The staff member who checked us in was so nice and professional. He even allowed us to have a late checkout which is a biiiig deal when you have a baby. They had a bed ready for my baby and even toiletries. This was sooooo amazing after we had traveled for hours and had no sleep. Perfect way to settle in.
hotelName:
65    Hyatt Centric Gran Via Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good hotel, excellent services, excellent location in a very nice city.Room service excellent, fast and very very good food. Christmas time with lights on the streets, amplified the feeling of good.Thank you,
hotelName:
65    Hyatt Centric Gran Via Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Maria could not have been more helpful. She was wonderful, welcoming, checked in on us and gave us great recommendations. After our first day in Madrid and her fantastic recommendations we just kept going back to her to ask her what to do and where to go eat. Would highly recommend the Hyatt Centric. Very modern design in an old building. Does not feel like a chain hotel, feels like a small boutique hotel that truly cares for its guests.
hotelName:
65    Hyatt Centric Gran Via Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Have stayed here 3 times now and would never stay anywhere else, excellent location, excellent rooms, excellent staff and amazing food in the restaurant - I highly recommend the tuna tartare, the best I have ever tasted ! Everyone that works here are so nice and helpful.
hotelName:
65    Hyatt Centric Gran Via Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect location, great staff, beautiful hotel. This was one of our favorite hotels of our trip. Such a great modern yet cozy feel. Room was larger than I expected and was well appointed. Would return in a heartbeat.
hotelName:
65    Hyatt Centric Gran Via Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was celebrating a 50th birthday with girlfriends throughout Spain and this hotel was our favorite! The staff is very kind, the room was very comfortable, and the location of the hotel is centrally located so we were able to get to any attraction we wanted to see easily. I highly recommend staying here.
hotelName:
65    Hyatt Centric Gran Via Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have stayed here befor but this will be our last, the hotel staff was very nice, we were greeted with a glass of CS a, the first room was like a box of matches and dark, we upgraded for 40 euro still a small room but with a threat view and might I add tremendous acoustic coming from the bathroom next door into our bathroom.Christmas evening we could not get in the restaurant as outside guest had taken some of the spot, OK well at least we could get a drink NO WAY they said we are booked, I inquired about getting the drinks and having them in the lobby, NO! We tried everything but NO drinks, so we we left no choice but to stand outside taps tap and wait to be seated and have drinks and a small bite, not what you would expect Christmas Eve!!!! I just called to se if we could get a late check out, No Way we are booked.The rooms are small that I can put up with but the stains in the carpet, dinginess and lack of empathy and service no way, we will never be back and I come to Spain often, Zi was born here! The location is great but there are many nicer hotels with such a location.
hotelName:
66    ME BY MELIA MADRID Reina Victoria
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in the hotel for our wedding night and it was amazing - hotel full of details that made our stay unforgettable. We enjoyed a drink in the rooftop and the views of Madrid are great. Thanks for everything.
hotelName:
66    ME BY MELIA MADRID Reina Victoria
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The single word that comes to mind when I think of this hotel is FANTASTIC. I travel about 70% of the year for business and this hotel made me feel at home. The rooms are simply great, the beds second to none. The location is in the heart of Madrid, making it fun to walk around and explore. I have to say that there is a staff member that stood out from the rest for his attention to detail and outstanding guest service; Iñaki Gomez (Front Desk), crated an awesome and memorable stay for us. I want to congratulate the hotel and I hope to be back soon! I totally recommend the ME Madrid.
hotelName:
66    ME BY MELIA MADRID Reina Victoria
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel has exceeded our expectations each time we have been there, the front desk team is exceptional and always ready to help, the break fast at the Santa Ana restaurant is fabulous and the attention that you receive from everyone working there is superb.We took our kids in this last trip and they came to our bedroom several times expressing their "whoa" effect they got with their room and the service from the people that work at the hotel.
hotelName:
66    ME BY MELIA MADRID Reina Victoria
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing location, comfy bed, hot shower, good assortment for breakfast!!Starting with swift communication with Victoria from reservations, can find no faults with this hotel, the quick check in with beautiful Tatiana, to the amazing Aura touch and warm welcome from Patricia. All of them very welcoming and accommodating, were helpful with all my questions and had good suggestions for the local attractions. The room technology was fun to play with, from mood lights to connecting my phone to the sound system, fast wifi etc. And even turndown service had Wonderful Lora with perfect english to offer water. thank you all so much I had a great time!
hotelName:
66    ME BY MELIA MADRID Reina Victoria
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you are visiting Madrid I cannot recommend this place enough. Get a balcony room overlooking the Plaza De Santa Ana, bustling with life, restaurants and bars all serving top tapasThe hotel does excellent breakfast, the staff are friendly and helpful, and a great rooftop bar. Taxi rank close by with lots of opportunities when departing. On the down side, you only get free water for the first night! And the Iron cable is very short, but apart from that first class in every way
hotelName:
66    ME BY MELIA MADRID Reina Victoria
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have now stayed 3 times. The hotel is well run, smart and very well positioned in an historic building in central Madrid. A favourite. The staff are well trained, knowledgeable and friendly. It is on Santa Ana square and very convenient for the adjacent streets full of life.
hotelName:
66    ME BY MELIA MADRID Reina Victoria
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My boyfriend and I spent a few days in Madrid at this hotel. It is certainly incredible, all the facilities are so modern and pretty. Also, it´s just in the city centre so, you can go everywhere by walking. There are so many shops, bars, and restaurants nearby. We wanted to try real Spanish food and because of the huge amount and variety of options, we were so lost that we couldn´t decide where to go. That is why we wanted to especially thank Alex, from the Aura Team that helps us make our choices and gives us really good advice about restaurants and the area in general. Our favourite area was Malasaña which is an alternative and amazing area of Madrid. We will come back for sure to continue discovering the city and of course to the best hotel ever.
hotelName:
66    ME BY MELIA MADRID Reina Victoria
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice hotel, perfect location and very nice staf.Breakfast was very good and the room was not so big but very convenient.The female concierge was wonderful, she helped us with everything we needed.
hotelName:
66    ME BY MELIA MADRID Reina Victoria
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my second time at a Pestana hotel and oh boy, room sizes keep shrinking. Everything was lovely, except the size of the room, talk about tiny, not enough closet space for two people, no actual bathroom, there’s a toilet in a tiny space, a shower stall and the sink next to the bed, I absolutely hated that, it was awful. Checking in and out was a breeze. Breakfast was excellent, staff was very friendly and attentive and the location was absolutely perfect. If I return to Madrid for 2 or 3 days I would stay at Pestana again, if I stay longer I would look for a bigger room in a different hotel.
hotelName:
67    Pestana Plaza Mayor Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed our stay at Pestana Plaza Mayor in Madrid. Staff is amazing, swimming pool is stunning and location is great. Hotel staff is always eager to support and help you.We loved it. Only one comment I can make is that it would be nice to have more vegetarian options in breakfast.
hotelName:
67    Pestana Plaza Mayor Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is well located on the Plaza Mayor, walkable to the museums and other sites if you don't mild walking a mile or so. We came in on the train, cab from Puerta de Atocha station was about 8.50. Left by air, cab to the airport was fixed price of 30.00. Lots of shops and things around the plaza, but it seemed to be under construction for a temporary christmas market while we were there.Hospitality was average. When we arrived there was not a doorman on duty, and the desk staff were busy discussing something with each other, so we had to manage the doors with our hands full and all our baggage. Desk staff spoke English and were polite enough. At check-in they offered to have bags taken to our room, gave us a map, told us about the pool and spa. There was a doorman there when we checked out, and they were helpful arranging for a cab to the airport.Room was small but clean, comfortable, quiet. Amenities included robe and slippers, hairdryer, free wi-fi, large flatscreen TV, minibar, nespresso machine. No iron. We were reluctant to use the nespresso machine because the minibar price sheet listed the cost of coffee as 4.50, but we realized later this referred to the bottle of iced coffee in the fridge, and the nespresso was free. We didn't use the laundry service. Biggest problem was the terrible dank smell in the room. I should have paid more attention to this complaint in other reviews. We probably should have asked for another room right away, but I guess we thought it might improve if we opened the window to air it out. Then, once we were settled in, we didn't want to repack all our stuff to move to a new room. Keeping the window open all day helped a little, but we had to put a note on the window asking the maid to keep it open. Not only our room, but some hallways also smelled bad (like a backed-up drain), I think they have a plumbing problem. When I mentioned the smell, they acted all surprised, I can't believe they don't know about it.Hotel amenities include a rooftop terrace (pool closed for the season when we were there), small but lovely indoor pool, sauna, gym (all free to guests), spa services (for a fee, did not book). Spa staff were very friendly and accommodating, gave us a tour. They have a changing area and a few lockers. Indoor pool area was a bit crowded, and another guest took my towel. They have a very nice lounge overlooking the plaza, with fireplaces etc, but we didn't know it was there until the end of our stay. They also have a second entrance right off the square, which would have been convenient except that we could never get the door to work with our keycard. We did not use the restaurant, it seemed expensive, and the menu was a little strange.So it was a nice enough place, a good value for the price. We might have enjoyed it better if we had complained right away about the smelly room, if we knew the coffee was free, if the plaza entrance worked. Wouldn't rule it out to stay again, maybe if they offered us a special deal, but would just as likely try another hotel next time.
hotelName:
67    Pestana Plaza Mayor Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good service great room and professional polite staff. What more do you need for a visit to Madrid. The Pestana Plaza made us welcome from day one until we left 4 days later.The range of rooms can fit just about anyones budget
hotelName:
67    Pestana Plaza Mayor Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel has Perfect location un the heart of Madrid. Some rooms and meeting spaces has a super nice view of Plaza Mayor.Clean and spacious rooms. Very confortable. Nice food in the restaurant and good breakfast. Super nice staff.
hotelName:
67    Pestana Plaza Mayor Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The AC unit only blew hot hair. Plaza Mayor is too loud to sleep with the windows open. It wasn't great sleeping. Brought it up with the staff and someone came to check it out and suggested "oh yeah you have to leave it on auto". I'd obviously tried that. Nothing worked. It was a couple of hot nights sleep.
hotelName:
67    Pestana Plaza Mayor Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful rooms, spa, great front desk staff and amazing area.anyone that gives this place a poor review is nuts...it is an amazing experience. location, boutique service, and hospitality. the staff make great recommendations. truly impressed.
hotelName:
67    Pestana Plaza Mayor Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very friendly staff.Spacious room with wonderful view overlooking Plaza MayorMadrid as aleways lively and full of great places to eat and drink.Lovely relaxed hotel to come back to after a busy day and night in the city
hotelName:
67    Pestana Plaza Mayor Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed at Pestana Plaza Mayor Madrid early October 2019. We were greeted at the gate by Juan who was welcoming from the beginning. All of the staff were more than helpful. Mario in the bar made us special cocktails to celebrate our anniversary. The location was beautiful and we had a wonderful view of Plaza Mayor. This was our first trip abroad and we picked a great place for our first hotel. Thank you for making our trip so special!
hotelName:
67    Pestana Plaza Mayor Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful in every way. The staff really cares and the gummies are a nice touch!!! Location was outstanding and the cleanliness of the rooms was amazing!! I would definitely recommend this property for both business and leisure!!!
hotelName:
11    Barcelo Torre de Madrid
68    Barcelo Torre de Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great service, nice and cozy rooms, the breakfast is good but I'll suggest you'll skip dinner. The location is close to all the shopping centers and restaurants. It was the second time I visited Madrid and that hotel was way better than other 5 stars hotel.
hotelName:
11    Barcelo Torre de Madrid
68    Barcelo Torre de Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Always enjoy staying here, great staff clean and comfortable rooms and close proximity to most everything in the city. My colleagues always enjoy happy hour at the bar to start the evening before heading out to dine and enjoy the offerings of the city.
hotelName:
11    Barcelo Torre de Madrid
68    Barcelo Torre de Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When we arrived at the hotel via taxi, we were met and greeted by one of the employees. He immediately took our bags and directed us to the check in area located on the second floor. We were greeted and provided water as we completed the check in process. The service provided was excellent. Our room was surprisingly spacious. Robes and slippers were provided as well as great toiletries. The room was well kept and very clean. We did not take advantage of the breakfast at the hotel and kind of regretted it. Good breakfast locations were hard to come by and after all was said and done it cost us as much without a decent selection. Something to think about!Hotel location was also great. We were able to walk to all the points of interest. The concierge at the hotel was extremely helpful with information regarding points of interest and restaurants. We were very pleased with our entire experience at Barceló Torre de Madrid. We highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
11    Barcelo Torre de Madrid
68    Barcelo Torre de Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Extremely luxurious hotel in the centre of madrid.Pro's....Good size room. Very modern hotel. Welcome at public relations very good. Location brilliant. Rain effect shower lovely. Breakfast very good with great range. Customer service very efficient. Cons...Slight issue with some of the foreign channels on the tv which for a deluxe room is disappointing. Could be a internet issue. Slight noise but to be expected. Also don't think it's a hugely fun environment a bit like being in a art gallery afraid to touch anything.
hotelName:
11    Barcelo Torre de Madrid
68    Barcelo Torre de Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We've just returned from a three night stay at the Barcelo Torre and it was lovely, we were welcomed as soon as we arrived with a water and alcoholic shot and all the staff were very helpful. The room was lovely, a decent size, a big bathroom with a walk in shower and bath, and then an even bigger bed. We sadly didn't get the opportunity to eat at the hotel but there are many wonderful restaurants nearby. The bar was really good at the hotel and the cocktails were amazing!!!!Great location, and everything was great - I'd definitely recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
11    Barcelo Torre de Madrid
68    Barcelo Torre de Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a wonderful hotel with perfect service in every area. The first nice touch was being offered glasses of water as we were checking in. A simple touch, but welcomed after two flights. Room was large, bathroom was very large with huge walk-in shower, deep soaking tub, plush towels, etc. Everything you could ask for! Bed was comfortable with a full menu of pillow options. Breakfast was fantastic with absolutely anything you could imagine wanting from omelettes made to order to platters of hams, smoked salmon, a large variety of yogurts, fresh breads, fruit, cheese, danish, cakes, churros. It goes on and on and everything is available in a bright, contemporary lovely room with large windows.From the concierge to the cleaning staff everyone was accommodating. There's even a gym and lap pool. Sadly the Plaza di Espana is being renovated so we didn't have a view of that, but we did look straight up the Gran Via which was lovely. Convenient location added to the stay. Would come back in a minute and are looking to stay at another Barcelo hotel soon.
hotelName:
11    Barcelo Torre de Madrid
68    Barcelo Torre de Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very pleasant stay at Barcelo Torre de Madrid. Just off Plaza de España/ Gran Via in a historic building everything there great excellent breakfast pool staff gym comfortable bed great waterfall shower spacious room
hotelName:
11    Barcelo Torre de Madrid
68    Barcelo Torre de Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: An extremely well located hotel with very friendly and efficient staff. The concierge(tall lady) was incredibly well informed and helpful. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. The buffet breakfast is high quality and comparable with other top class hotels.On balance, an enjoyable stay thanks to the wonderful staff.
hotelName:
11    Barcelo Torre de Madrid
68    Barcelo Torre de Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel has the perfect location.The rooms were very clean and comfortable. It is worth it to pay for breakfast at the hotel. All staff members were very kind and helpful. i definitely recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
69    ICON Wipton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We took great care in choosing where to stay in Madrid and, for us, it paid off. The hotel is in a great neighborhood location in the heart of the city. Upon arrival at the ICON Wipton, we received a very warm and friendly welcome from Ester and her staff at Reception. Indeed, throughout our week-long stay she remained the ultimate professional, always friendly, ultra-helpful, willing to go the extra mile, not only with us but also every other guest we witnessed her interact with. Actually each one at the desk was also very kind in helping us organise our tours, calling for taxis and answering our many questions. Our room was spacious enough for our needs and spotlessly clean. There was a wide screen TV, fridge, ample wardrobe space, safe and tea/coffee making facilities. The bathroom was well stocked with good quality toiletries and we had clean towels every day. Our chambermaid always smiled and greeted us every time she saw us. Although breakfast is set out buffet-style, one may also request individual items, such as an omelette. The buffet itself offers a choice of hot and cold options, providing for a good range of preferences. Even though the buffet is self-service, the staff are always on hand and quickly respond to any requests. We thoroughly enjoyed this facility on 3-4 occasions and had great fun meeting other guests and swapping stories over a drink. For other meals, we ate in a couple of nearby restaurants, with The Captain down the road (as recommended by staff) being our clear favorite. Each staff member was always prompt, polite and friendly. We had a wonderful stay at the ICON Wipton hotel which we found to be comfortable, welcoming, clean, well-run and ideally located. What made the difference for us though, was the warmth and kindness of the staff members that we came into contact with, We wouldn’t dream of staying anywhere else on our next visit to Madrid.
hotelName:
69    ICON Wipton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very well decorated boutique hotel; within a walking distance of 4 minutes from - not one, but two! - metro stations; extremely nice and available staff; delicious and diverse breakfast served by the most welcoming waitresses.Rooms for large families available.
hotelName:
69    ICON Wipton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: very nice decoration hotel, staff extremly kind and helpfull .Breakfast very tasty with large variety of food.Location exceptional at Madrid in shipping area, many good restaurants nearby .Will be back surely.
hotelName:
69    ICON Wipton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is beautifully decorated and well maintained. The area in which is located is very upscale with various options for food and drink around. Some amenities could be improved but overall we were really happy with our choice!
hotelName:
69    ICON Wipton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel has so much character and charm. Staff were incredibly helpful. It is located in a very trendy, upmarket area with some great bars and restaurants. Room was great, good size and very clean. Close to the park and a bit of a walk to other tourist areas however the metro is pretty close by. Would definitely recommend.
hotelName:
69    ICON Wipton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Modern hotel with amazing service. Perfect location next to huge beautiful park. Very clean and modern rooms. I had a terrace and the breakfast is out of this world. Loved the food and the place where I had breakfast. Highly recommend it. It was perfect for my one night business stay.
hotelName:
69    ICON Wipton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel located in a great place where all trendy bars and restaurants are. 5 min walk from great shops and from Park Del Retiro. the breakfast food was very good too and the overall design and decoration of the hotel and room made us feel like at home. We will definitely come back on our next stay in Madrid.
hotelName:
69    ICON Wipton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pretty good service! Very nice hotel to stay at Madrid, with a very good location.The staff is all very nice and helpful, either solving your problems or giving you the sugestions and orientations you ask for
hotelName:
69    ICON Wipton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We went to Madrid to visit museums and this hotel is ideally positioned with all the main museums within easy walking distance. Our room was very comfortable, with a seating area on a lower level and a small balcony overlooking the square, and a well -equipped bathroom. All the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet was beautifully laid out, with cooked options to order. We actually ate in the (tapas) bar in the hotel for lunch when we arrived and the food was delicious enough to persuade us to eat there the next three evenings, being both tired from art viewing so not wanting to struggle to find anywhere else, and we could eat earlier than is normal in Madrid. The staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel has an interesting collection of antiquities. We would happily stay there again.
hotelName:
70    Hotel Villa Real
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is lovely and we had a very quiet room. The hotel is just a few minutes walk to museums and the Plaza Mayor. Lots of excellent restaurants and cafes nearby along with a small grocery store just a few minutes walk from the hotel.
hotelName:
70    Hotel Villa Real
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Another fabulous stay at the Villa Real.The hotel itself is perfectly located.The staff from reception,to bar staff,door men,to maids are all a joy and take pride in their work and looking after their guests.Cannot recommend this hotel enough,considering we have now stayed multiple times and will continue to return on every trip to madrid.You wont/can't be disappointed with a stay at the Villa Real
hotelName:
70    Hotel Villa Real
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My first impression of this hotel was that it looks tired and dated. There's a lot of beige and dark wood everywhere. The room was split level which made it quite hazardous. In effect, the bed was at the top of a small flight of stairs, and the polished wooden floor was very slippery. A knee level balustrade made this even more dangerous. I am quite surprised that health and safety rules permit this. I had to move very carefully if I needed to get up in the night and anyone with even minor mobility issues would be in difficulty.There is much, however, that is good about the hotel. The location is excellent. The staff are helpful and friendly. Breakfast is good. It would be churlish to focus only on the negative. I have mixed feelings about the antiquities on display. If they are genuine they are surely of international importance and should be in a museum where they can be curated to the highest standards.
hotelName:
70    Hotel Villa Real
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We chose this hotel based on location and amenities and were not disappointed. Almost everything worth seeing were within walking distance. The room was comfortable and clean, the bar was fantastic and when I told the staff it was my wife's birthday they brought her a piece of cake with a candle - a wonderful touch. I have two minor negatives (which is why this is not a five) - we had a room overlooking the square and it was extremely noisy in the night, with lots of shouting. And the skateboarders outside were a real pain. And the biggest gripe - massive foam pillows. Very uncomfortable. But these are really minor details and the biggest compliment is that I would certainly stay here again if I were in Madrid. Excellent!
hotelName:
70    Hotel Villa Real
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is a very good 5 star hotel with affordable medium high prices. Clean and nice rooms, friendly staff and a great location in the center of the city. Also a reasonable good breakfast (23 euros per person) and a absolutely fantastic housekeeping. The cleaning staff is one of the best I've seen. The hotel can use a little upgrade here and there but overall a great value for money on the high segment.
hotelName:
70    Hotel Villa Real
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is located in the city center. all attractions are on walking distance The Room was not to big , has a split-level floor and an balcony . we missed some furniture.The bed were comfortable. The bathroom was small but very complete. All amenities were there. The breakfast was partly buffet, eggs were served, quality was average.Staff was friendly.
hotelName:
70    Hotel Villa Real
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was delighted with the great service and wonderful facilities of the Villa Real Hotel.Well located, the staff are very friendly and made me feel at home. Very nice and elegant decoration and the room s are very comfortable.
hotelName:
70    Hotel Villa Real
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect location - especially if you want to visit the museums. This hotel is ***** and reasonably priced. The room we had was spacious and well appointed. We overlooked the "square." Making the reservation via their web site was easy. Check in was easy and the staff was extremely helpful during our stay. Villa Real is right across the street from the Spanish "congress" so the area is very well guarded. Lots of great restaurants in the area. The city center is about a 10 minute walk. We hope to return on our next visit to Madrid.
hotelName:
70    Hotel Villa Real
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely hotel....the customer service was awesome. The place has a great classic feel with a couple a great cafe in the first floor.It is centrally located and very charming. Honestly, not real complaints....couldnt get the TV to work but why would you need it?
hotelName:
71    Iberostar Las Letras Gran Via
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent Reception Staff namely Ana, Anthony, and Marcus. Warm welcome we feel at home, gave us drinks, champaign and our room is available 2hours earlier. Gave my wife a surprise Chocolate Birthday cake andGreeting birthday glowing board.Gave us ideas where to go and places to eat. Excellent room, very spacious and romantic. The hotel cafe/bar and restaurant always opens good food very reasonable and jolly waiters serving you. The hotel provided us a luxury taxi MB with female driver courteous. Hoping to come back to this hotel. Thank you very much.
hotelName:
71    Iberostar Las Letras Gran Via
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is at walking distance to all recommended amenities, staff was super friendly, great bar/restaurant within, size, cleanliness and necessities of rooms was exceptional, thank you for a wonderful experience!
hotelName:
71    Iberostar Las Letras Gran Via
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall, The Iberostar Las Letras Gran Via was a great hotel. Check-in went smoothly, the room was spacious ( for European standards) and the room was clean. I will say that it is about time for the bathrooms to renovated. The bathroom looked a bit aged. The grout in the shower would benefit greatly from a re-do. I loved the location of this hotel; as it is on the main shopping strip and only a few minutes walk to the main square and tons of restaurants. The hotel does offer breakfast, but that was not something I utilized. I will stay in this hotel again on my next trip to Madrid.
hotelName:
71    Iberostar Las Letras Gran Via
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: These people rock. Very friendly and cool reception. Upgraded me to a fantastic room with an outside jacuzzi looking over the rooftops of Madrid! Comfy, quiet, lots of nice little touches. Great part of Madrid, swimming with restaurants and bars. I really rate this hotel and part of town. Thank you!!
hotelName:
71    Iberostar Las Letras Gran Via
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room was a suite. It was very spacious. Very clean rooms. Service was good. It has a great location. Good if you are travelling and have a tight schedule. The hotel doesn't have that may options as far as restaurants in the hotel.
hotelName:
71    Iberostar Las Letras Gran Via
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing experience, at the Restaurant and bar they were so kind and very attentive. The front desk guys are amazingly helpful, they made reservations for restaurants and recommended the nicest places to go. They arranged transportation to the airport, another great experience. Hotel is so clean and beds are super comfortable. Walking distance to the most amazing restaurants and shops.
hotelName:
71    Iberostar Las Letras Gran Via
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic stay in the heart of Madrid. Walking distance to everything as the hotel is centrally located, and easily accessible. Kudos to Anthony, Anna, Beth, Ursula & Cesar who were attentive and super friendly and helpful. Wanted to check in early after a long red-eye flight, so that I could wash up and maybe catch a quick nap before a full day of sightseeing, Anthony and Anna made it happen. Even though there was an issue with the room assigned, they managed to promptly fix it and offer breakfast while they resolved the issue. I was very impressed with the genuine care and attention they provided as well as the level of service (and always with a warm smile). Thanks for going above and beyond... You made it a great stay! Will definitely stay here again when I come back.
hotelName:
71    Iberostar Las Letras Gran Via
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at this hotel Mid-September '19 and it was fantastic. The location is central making everything walkable from there. Rooms are adorable, it has a rooftop seating/pool area as well as a great cafe/restaurant. Service was great!
hotelName:
71    Iberostar Las Letras Gran Via
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent a lot of time debating where to stay in Madrid and am very glad I picked this location versus something a bit farther west more in the heart of the tourist district. Those popular sites are walkable from this hotel, and a Metro stop is right around the corner, Plus, the hotel is close to the museums and Retiro Park, which was our favorite spot, as well as close to Mallorca, which is an amazing breakfast spot and restaurant. Staff were friendly and answered all our questions. The room was pleasant and clean and had a nice sitting area, as well as a refrigerator. You need your own coffee for the coffee maker, however, but I suggest just going to Mallorca! Beds were very comfortable.
hotelName:
72    VP Jardin de Recoletos
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is located on a quiet road, 5 min walking to the Jardines de las Delicias, 15 min to Prado, 25min to plaza Mayor.Modern, spacious room, which even included a kitchenette.Complementary drinks in the fridge.Huge bed with a very good mattressClean throughout.Very good wifi, plenty of sockets. Delicious breakfast and professional service.
hotelName:
72    VP Jardin de Recoletos
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: nice hotel in a great location. lots of restaurants nearby. Buen Retiro Park is a few blocks away. museums are nearby. the hotel is clean, the staff is helpful and accommodating. there is a restaurant/bar in the hotel for breakfast but there are plenty of options around the corner.
hotelName:
72    VP Jardin de Recoletos
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent hotel. The service was super, the room nicely furnished and spacious. Location cannot be beat. A short walk to everything, but just outside of things so the hotel is on quiet street. Only one very small "nit" - while the room has a coffee maker as part of the basic kitchenette in each room, there is no coffee. Other than that, really loved this hotel.
hotelName:
72    VP Jardin de Recoletos
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Despite a 5-month in advance, confirmed, pre-paid, re-confirmed reservation, my superior room mysteriously "disappeared" at 1:36pm on the day of arrival. Apparently, a regular guest called in a favor and was given 3 rooms already promised to other travelers. Over strenuous protests, I was sent to an inferior VP hotel more than 3 km away in a far less desirable location, even though I made it clear that I expected to be accommodated in the same neighborhood as my original booking. I refused the trade, demanded a refund, and sought refuge at Hotel Orfila which welcomed me with open arms. VP Jardin de Recoletos cannot be trusted with your money or with your careful travel plans. Stay elsewhere.
hotelName:
72    VP Jardin de Recoletos
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed five nights at the comfortable and stylish VP Jardin de Recoletos and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Modern stylish decor, in a quiet street, close to some superb shops and restaurants in the upmarket Recoleto/Salamanca area, large room with roomy balcony, comfortable beds, very friendly and helpful staff. We could walk to most sites, and there were a number of Metro stations just 5-10 mins away. Travelling by Metro was fun, cheap and very efficient. We chose the hotel because it listed a kitchenette in each room as a benefit. We thought maybe we would be able to make our own quick breakfast and enjoy it on the balcony before a heady day of sight-seeing. As it turned out the kitchenette was not very well stocked with utensils, we were surprised to find there was no coffee maker, not even a kettle in the room to make morning coffee and tea (there was a microwave oven). There were no tea/coffee supplies either, no washing up liquid, no supplies of any kind other than soft drink. So if you're looking for effective kitchenette facilities look somewhere else. But if not, then this is a great place to stay.
hotelName:
72    VP Jardin de Recoletos
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice & comfortable hotel within easy walking distance of the places you’d want to see & visit. Maybe a maximum 30 minute walk to the farthest place. Roughly 20 minutes from the airport for a fixed 30 Euro fee (taxis will take 4 people with hand luggage).Good efficient & friendly staff with good English. Nice rooms (usually twin beds – smaller than doubles but bigger than singles), decent bathrooms with good showers. Lift & stairs (just 3 floors anyway). Small enclosed rear garden area with seating & tables to eat. Quiet side street location and close to a number of places to eat & drink.Breakfast offers a very good cold selection with hot (usually eggs, omlettes etc) options made to order. Evening dinner offers good choices and good dishes, Oxtail dishes recommended. No food complaints at all. Very nice. A good but small selection of decent beers (Spanish, German Belgian) and wines. Nothing too expensive.Overall very nice.
hotelName:
72    VP Jardin de Recoletos
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We totally agree with the last two reviews. We would rather not have to leave today. Quiet, roomy, clean, well maintained, lovely friendly staff. We had breakfast twice overlooking the courtyard garden, excellent! We did not use the garden much, but we often saw folk drinking or dining there.We felt extremely safe and comfortable in Madrid. Despite food and drink being everywhere, we did not see a single drunk disorderly person, and far fewer fatties than back home in Oz. We will come back, and will not think twice about a return visit to this lovely hotel.
hotelName:
72    VP Jardin de Recoletos
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Let's see ... Check-in was perfect, they helped print boarding passes, the room and bathroom were excellent. Add in a great location on a quiet street along with wide opening french doors in the room and you have a winner. The location was very near the prado and botanical gardens and in an area wiht high-class shopping, out of the heavy tourist zone. Highly recommend.
hotelName:
72    VP Jardin de Recoletos
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We just came back from a trip here to see the Christmas lights in Madrid. This hotel was very well located and had the BEST towels I have had at a hotel in a long time. Add in great water pressure and you are assured a great rinse the minute you land after a long plane ride. The bed was the usual European fare but the pillows were nice. Rooftop bar was very nice, even on a December evening. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel
hotelName:
55    Hotel Atlantico
73    Hotel Atlantico
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had an amazing stay at Hotel Atlantico. The staff was friendly and helpful. Everyone at the front desk spoke English which was very helpful. The room was neat and clean and the bathroom was spacious. We had a great room on the 8th floor with a balcony where we could see and hear the sounds on Grand Via. It was nice to hear the street performers singing and playing music. When the door was closed we didn’t hear anything so it was great. This hotel is in the perfect spot for visiting Madrid. This is a main shopping and eating area and there is so much to explore in convenient walking distance. We will definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
55    Hotel Atlantico
73    Hotel Atlantico
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing location, near Puerta de sol, subway stations, pedestrian downtown, great rooms and beds, And all personnel, they were all fantastic, kind and willing to help. they have a wonderful terrace, you can have your champagne, watching all the happenings from top floor terrace, looking down on Grand Via. Breakfast Buffett is just amazing, all you can eat, from all cured and lunch meats, eggs, cereals, breads, fruit, juices, coffee and yes, great view. I'm going back in July 2020 and I will go back to Hotel Atlántico Madrid without a second thought. *****+ And also, a fair price for location, location, location and good quality.
hotelName:
55    Hotel Atlantico
73    Hotel Atlantico
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great welcome by friendly and efficient staff. Stayed twice at the beginning and at the end of our 3 week trek around Spain. Spacious, clean and beautifully decorated room, both times on the 8th floor. Relaxing and peaceful lounge. Hotel in a good position easy amble through the market on Sunday down to Plaza Mayor then to the rugby scrum in the excellent Mercardo! GF bread on request, plenty of other food choices available. Breakfast lady personable and fun! About 7 mins away is Celicioso cafe, Totally GF cafe, food was brilliant. We had a fantastic time in Spain, train services was excellent and efficient. Spain is full of life and they know how to have a good time so don't forget to pack some good earplugs. We bought mighty earplugs on line $25 before we left and had no problems sleeeping. Would stay again at this hotel.
hotelName:
55    Hotel Atlantico
73    Hotel Atlantico
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 6 nights here and really enjoyed it. From the moment we walked in the lobby, jet lagged from our flight from the USA, the front desk was so accommodating and helpful. I wish I’d gotten the name of one gentleman in particular who checked us in and helped us several times. Our room was perfect. A corner room on an upper floor. View with balcony over Gran Via. The housekeeping kept it spotlessIt had a luxurious bathroom. And a large variety of pillows of different firmness. We ate breakfast every morning. The room was large, good assortment of food and coffees. The terrace is lovely but when it’s was too cool the inside facilities were lovely and spacious. Bernardo took excellent care of us, we were up there almost every night for wine and food. In fact we looked forward to seeing him every evening. I would definitely return to this hotel. Everything is nearby. The location is brilliant. Thanks again for such a wonderful stay.
hotelName:
55    Hotel Atlantico
73    Hotel Atlantico
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked this Hotel online for a long weekend. It was not my first choice and was less expensive than I was prepared to pay. I had some reservations, as I was concerned from some of the pictures I saw online that it may be a little faded in its appearance, but I need not have worried. I arrived three hours before check-in hoping they would be happy to hold my luggage while I went in search of lunch. The staff at reception were most welcoming and spoke perfect English. Without me asking, they checked my reservation and found my room was ready. The room itself exceeded all my expectations. It was vast, clean, very well appointed and had a huge bathroom. The bathroom is worth a special mention, because the shower is without doubt THE finest shower I have ever experienced in any hotel anywhere in the world. The bathroom was palatial, with bidet and two sinks, a massive shower and an equally sized bath. The bedroom was similarly well appointed, the bed and bed linen perfect, there was an ironing board and iron, a safe, a minibar, all the usual things you find in a hotel room, but everything was of excellent quality. I have stayed in many hotels all over the world, over the last forty years but this ranks as good as the very best. I would not consider staying anywhere else in Madrid on my next visit. The hotel staff were fantastic and nothing was too much trouble. The location is also superb for a stay in the city.
hotelName:
55    Hotel Atlantico
73    Hotel Atlantico
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a room overlooking the Main Street. It was very large and had all we needed. The only drawback was the noise from the streets. The music went until 11pm per regulation. Aside from this it was a great stay.
hotelName:
55    Hotel Atlantico
73    Hotel Atlantico
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a great stay here in Madrid. The location is central to everything, we walked everywhere it was great. We didn't have any issues with noise and slept very well. We were upgraded because of Expedia which was nice. The hotel was very clean, I'd stay again!
hotelName:
55    Hotel Atlantico
73    Hotel Atlantico
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am really impressed with this 4* hotel in Madrid! Great service, comfortable rooms, nice terrrace and perfect location. In terms of value for money you do not find better hotel for business or pleasure in Madrid.
hotelName:
55    Hotel Atlantico
73    Hotel Atlantico
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at this hotel for three nights with my husband and our 7 year old son while we were exploring Madrid. The hotel is very modern and recently renovated. We enjoyed the breakfast and the ambience of the hotel and the fact that its location was ideal; close to 2 subway stations,walking distance from Gran Via e.t.c What is really worth mentioning is the staff,from the moment we arrived ( check in was very quick by the way)till the time of the check out, every member of the staff was very kind and helpful. A special mention goes to Andrea,whose an asset to the hotel, very kind, helpful and professional with a great smile that even got my son's attention ( he made a Christmas drawing just for her while she gave him chocolate treats)...Keep up the good work. Thank you for a wonderful stay... Until the next time... Eva& Nikos & Manos (the greek family that stayed in room 109 from 3/12-06/12)P.S. When you visit Madrid you should definitely go the Prado Museum (you can book your tickets on line)and get the chance to admire wonderful artwork from great artists like Velázquez, Goya, El Greco, Titian, Rubens etc ... The Royal Palace is also a " must" visit...
hotelName:
74    Mercure Madrid Plaza de Espana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect locatiom for an affordable rate. Renovated rooms. Breakfast very good. Overall good stay, my only critcism is that the staff at the restaurant and breakfast seems to be in a rush. Running, running and running.
hotelName:
74    Mercure Madrid Plaza de Espana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic hotel as a base from which to explore Madrid. Reasonably priced but offering quality accommodation. Great breakfast and tasty evening dishes. Bedroom was clean and spacious. The staff, from the moment we arrived until we left, were excellent; nothing was too much trouble! We won't hesitate to return here the next time we're in Madrid!
hotelName:
74    Mercure Madrid Plaza de Espana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here in October for 2 nights with my husband. We arrived early in the morning and they offered us a twin room which we accepted since we were checking in early. The room itself was spacious, nicely decorated and very clean. Lots of room to get ready in the morning as well. We never had the breakfast here. We had no view as on the first floor. The hotel is right next to a main tube station which is handy and also a small area right outside the hotel offers different restaurant options. You are about a 10 minute walk to the main squares. Everywhere was pretty walkable from this hotel which I enjoyed. I would recommend a stay here as it was reasonably priced also.
hotelName:
74    Mercure Madrid Plaza de Espana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location to Royal Theatre and Palace. The Royal Palace a must see the audio is fantastic. For food can’t go past Plaza Mayor. Walking around was very easy. A visit to Prado Museum was amazing saw great works by Goya.
hotelName:
74    Mercure Madrid Plaza de Espana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Checked in today with car and dog. We drove straight into the car park, plenty of space available. Checked into hotel and we were given an upgrade to a fabulous suite as Platinum card holders, which is fantastic with the dog having his own space. The bar and front office service is first class, supplied with snack to accompany the complimentary wine and beer. We cannot speak highly enough of this wonderful hotel and its very obliging and friendly staff. Highly recommend a visit here, and a credit to the AccorHotel group. We will be back!
hotelName:
74    Mercure Madrid Plaza de Espana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in this Hotel, the staff were very friendly and informative, the room was a decent size and clean, the mattresses were outstanding quality and felt like brand new. Massive choice of breakfast items, the let down was the coffee machine in the restaurant area which needs updating to be able to keep up with demand on busy mornings. The location of this hotel is perfect if you like to walk and explore at your own pace, situated close enough to Gran Via and from there most of Madrid is easily accessible. The road works around Plaza De Espana make navigation a little interesting currently but nothing to deter us from recommending this hotel to anyone who doesn't need all the pricey add ons that many of the more expensive places in Madrid have to offer. We would be more than happy to re-visit should we ever find ourselves in Madrid again.
hotelName:
74    Mercure Madrid Plaza de Espana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice stay for 4 days, very friendly staff at the reception they helped me a lot with an issue i had with my transfer to the airport. clean "cozy" hotel, romms with good space. The breakfast was with good quality food , the location of the hotel was perfect very close to the metro station nice restaurants nearby.
hotelName:
74    Mercure Madrid Plaza de Espana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent two nights here and it was very nice stay. Big thank you to Ana, she is a super star! Very welcoming, always smiling, extremely helpful, I believe she knows the answers for all the possible questions! All her recommendations were great. Nothing you complain about the room, clean and spacious, bed is comfortable. We really liked breakfast as well, a lot of options, all tasty. I would be happy to come back here. I definitely recommend.
hotelName:
74    Mercure Madrid Plaza de Espana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Petit Palace is nice and always be one of the top places to stay at again. It is near the center of the city. There is an official store of Real Madrid just beside it and small souvenir shops lined up in front of the hotel. The staff was friendly and very prompt to help us and handle our request. The metro is very near to the hotel.
hotelName:
75    Petit Palace Puerta Del Sol
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This 3 stars hotel is very good. Clean, good room service, service at the breakfast is fantastik, the girls like Mary, and all of them at the breakfast are very helpful and nice. The staff at the front desk very helpful. Kids friendly lobby. Very good food at the breakfast. I highly recommend this hotel for family vacations.
hotelName:
75    Petit Palace Puerta Del Sol
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rich and healthy breakfast, really good, we recommend you to try itAlso very clean hotel.Close to everything.1 min away from the metro even though you don't really need it ifWe had a lot of funRich and healthy breakfast, really good, we recommend you to try itAlso very clean hotel.Close to everything.1 min away from the metro even though you don't really need it ifWe had a lot of fun
hotelName:
75    Petit Palace Puerta Del Sol
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For a first visit to Madrid this hotel was perfectly located with many attractions an easy walk. I had the benefit of a 6th floor street facing room that came with a spacious outside deck, perfect for evening drinks. Room was well appointed although a little tired. A refresh would go a long way to lifting hotel status. Staff were friendly and helpful. While the place didn’t blow my socks off I had no complaints either
hotelName:
75    Petit Palace Puerta Del Sol
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Positives: Central location, comfy beds, friendly staff and affordable prices. Negatives: air conditioning is hideous. The room doesn’t get cold enough and is an absolute hot box when it’s 30 degrees outside. Despite asking them to look into the AC, the staff said it was operating as intended (I.e. we centrally control the AC putting our cost management ahead of customer comfort). If the AC worked, I would have rated this hotel 4 stars. Also the rooms are more tired than the marketing photos portray.
hotelName:
75    Petit Palace Puerta Del Sol
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There's so much meat in Spain, that it's worth noting that this hotel had enough on the breakfast menu to fill up a vegan--juices, nuts, fruits, breads. We did not see that in other hotels in Spain. The hotel entrance is on a pedestrian pathway near the Puerta Del Sol--a huge public square. For this reason, taxis can't come to the front door. They can park and wait less than a block away, but it's worth noting if you have heavy bags or elderly walkers. We could not tell if the hotel was accessible; our triple room was not. Otherwise, it was a clean and quiet affordable hotel in a very busy area. English speaking staff.
hotelName:
75    Petit Palace Puerta Del Sol
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was clean but a little neglected. The room was hot due to the bath not being vented. The breakfast was good. The staff had limited English but pleasant. If you want a "Times Square" type experience this location is hard to beat. Be aware "Petite Palace" is like "Best Western" in the US and there are many in this area. So pay attention if you want to avoid demanding entry to the wrong hotel.
hotelName:
75    Petit Palace Puerta Del Sol
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a wonderful experience. Arrived very early in the morning and the rooms were not ready. Within a short while they told me one was available. Unfortunately, it was not the size room I had paid for. I asked to be changed and there was no problem except it would not be available until 2:00 p.m. and it was only 10:00 a.m. We were waiting in the lobby and within 1/2 hour, Pable came to tell us they had a room available. Thank you Pablo. All staff members were very kind and helpful. The ladies at the breakfast buffet were wonderful. Only thing I missed was a restaurant, but they do have room service available.
hotelName:
75    Petit Palace Puerta Del Sol
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For a 3* hotel, it is surprisingly good in the heart of the city, close to everything. They would easily deserve 4*. Unfortunately, nights are noisy but this is not the hotel's fault.Staff are very helpful and nice. Breakfast excellent, fresh and varied. Caroline in the breakfast room prepares the dishes with a lot of care each morning.To absolutely recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
75    Petit Palace Puerta Del Sol
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is great, and the price is also good compared to the value. Rooms are clean and comfortable, though not gorgeous. Breakfast is also good, and most of the people you meet there are quite friendly.
hotelName:
76    NH Alonso Martinez
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Charged 150 euros on my card with absolutely no warning after I left because they say a coffee machine went missing from my room. When I called to protest, I was initially met with an attitude of: 'the machine is missing and we're charging you.' No attempt to listen to the fact that as a regular business traveller, I don't steal machines, simply a rigid 'you've been charged.' A front desk manager eventually said they may refund, but four hours later I have still to receive any written confirmation. I don't recommend this hotel, and if surprise debits are NH policy, I would steer clear of the chain.
hotelName:
76    NH Alonso Martinez
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff are very helpful.The breakfast is particularly good.The location is fantastic for seeing central Madrid.Our first room smelled of drains and in the morning there was bath water coming up through a drain cover.The second room was fine.
hotelName:
76    NH Alonso Martinez
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was perfect for our stay in Madrid. We stayed in August and it was of course quite hot but the air conditioning worked well. Our travel company had messed up and said we would get the breakfast, so there was some confusion about that, but the staff worked with us. (The breakfast seemed pricey for what you get, so I would only do that if discounted). We were able to sleep in some days when we wanted, and the room and bed was quite comfortable for that. Very close to metro. Taxis also right outside.
hotelName:
76    NH Alonso Martinez
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is pretty decent, very clean, well maintained and a had good selection for breakfast but what really stood out for me was the friendliness of the staff. Everyone, from reception to the cleaners always had a smile and were happy to stop and chat. They had great local knowledge and directed us to some really cool places to see, eat/drink.It’s very well located too with great public transport links, next time I’m in Madrid I will definitely stay here.
hotelName:
76    NH Alonso Martinez
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel staff very friendly and helpful and a credit to the hotel. Particularly cleaning and breakfast staff. Our room was very clean and comfortable. Late breakfast times at weekend really appreciated. Great location for exploring Madrid.
hotelName:
76    NH Alonso Martinez
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am a NH Rewards member. I was not asked if I was member or would like to be. I received poor service, very small room with the worst view ever. I was not asked how my stay was. Will not recommend or stay with NH in the future.
hotelName:
76    NH Alonso Martinez
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent Location. Close walk to city center through lovely and safe streets. Coming from united States we arrived early in the day but the staff were able to find us room with about an hour while we sat in the next door cafe. Rooms are clean and beds are comfortable. Loved the professional treatment we received from the staff . From the restaurant staff to front desk they were super helpful & friendly.
hotelName:
76    NH Alonso Martinez
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Is not the first time that I stayed in this hotel, however this time was a shorter period. I was a bit disappointed with the room that I got allocated, by bathtub was filthy. Had someone else’s hairs on it, which I find extremely unpleasant, also have to say that is the first time this happens to me on an NH hotel. So I want to be believe it was a one off! It was also the first time, as a gold member, I haven’t received any extra special treatments, like bottle of water, sweets or anything like that, so I suppose that was a bit disappointing.
hotelName:
76    NH Alonso Martinez
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is right in the heart of Madrid, just blocks away from Puerta del Sol. The room is tiny but clean and the personnel very friendly and informative. Building has an elevator and private bathroom. The bathroom is tiny which for privacy was a bit uncomfortable. Coffee & tea behind lobby in a small room where one can hang out. The hotel offers a discount for a neighboring cafe for breakfast (toast, oj & coffee). Close to many shops, pharmacies, small markets. Great price for location!!!! Quiet at night which is a plus!
hotelName:
77    Room007 Sol
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Small, modern, clean hotel, definitely worth the price. Staff was lovely and held out bags for us before and after our check-in/check-out times. No problem communicating in English or Spanish. It is a perfect location-we walked everywhere from the hotel without a problem. You can see into the shower stall from the room, so be aware of that if it's something that concerns you. We would happily return to stay here on a budget!
hotelName:
77    Room007 Sol
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: One of the best hostals I know. A fresh and young crew with tips for places to visit. Always helpfull and smiling. No matter which time it is. Thanks to them. The rooms are clean and comfortable. Fresh towels and a balcony. More you don`t need for a trip in a city. You`re close to all the lovely places, the palace, opera, plaza sol....the metro is near and some fine restaurants.Next time n Madrid - Room007 Sol :)
hotelName:
77    Room007 Sol
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is a rip off. First, we booked a room with a king size bed. We didn't get one and when we asked, we were told that the hotel does not have rooms with king sized beds. Funny, a king sized bed was confirmed on my booking print out.The shower and toilet have been added to what is clearly an old hotel. The shower is acceptable, sort of, but not the toilet. When you sit on the throne, it is not possible to close the door. I am not a prude, but this is somewhat beyond the expectations of reasonable decency.Now for the rest of the room. If you have luggage bigger than 30cm, it is impossible to put it anywhere apart from the floor. The chair in the room is more uncomfortable that a rock and totally unsuitable if you wish to do any work.There is also constant road noise, the windows need double glazing.In short, a glorified back packers
hotelName:
77    Room007 Sol
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Ok, this hotel is basic, but for such a low price you get a great location, a clean and modern room, and very friendly English speaking service. The rooms aren’t huge (especially the bathroom facilities which are intimate!) but the aircon was good and the view we had (room 301) was excellent. The location is also first class, right next to the metro and with a plethora of shops and restaurants close by. Overall an excellent budget choice in Madrid!
hotelName:
77    Room007 Sol
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Was conveniently situated near Opera Metro station. However, the layout of the room was a bit awkward. The shower stall was a bit cramped it impossible to stop water from leaking once you completed a quick shower. There was also no wardrobe space to facilitate hanging of outdoor coats or wet towels (for re-use). Just make your expectations aligned before booking, this is definitely a boutique hotel.
hotelName:
77    Room007 Sol
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall we had a pleasant stay at the hostel. We found our room very clean and the located in a great location of the city. Only downside was you did not have very much privacy in the bathroom. The toilet and shower both had glass doors and not completely closed off to the rest of the room. If you wanted privacy you would have to the restroom that is shared with the entire hostel.
hotelName:
77    Room007 Sol
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room had all of the essentials only without feeling basic. Great modern boutique feel without breaking the bank. They wall socket had USB port ms which was a life saver. The shower situation is a bit strange, but manageable. Definitely would stay here again and would highly recommend to others.
hotelName:
77    Room007 Sol
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Ok this hostal has one or two issues, I'll come to them later, but for price and location it's hard to beat.The location is five minutes walk from the Royal Palace and Sol and Mayor squares. Its not much further from Gran Via either.For 1 night we paid £58 which gave us the basic double bed room. The room was very clean and a modern minimalistic look about it . However it still had free wi-fi, towels, hair dryer, usb sockets and Tv.Ok the downside, the toilet! Its within the room and i mean that literally. Its very small and larger guests may struggle, im 5'10 and average build and it was fine for myself. The pillows are very thin and need beefing up. But those complaints aside, id recommend this hostal, especially if only staying a night or two
hotelName:
77    Room007 Sol
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If a Diamond Member you will be very happy. Executive lounge has great food and drink. Breakfast in the morning a large selection. Loved our room with hot tub and European type frameless shower. Service staff very attentive.
hotelName:
78    Hilton Madrid Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was amazing!! We stayedt for 2nights and loved it!! The staff a friendly, service was great!! Not a single complaint!! we were a group of 29 yr old picky girls and we had a fantastic service!! Thanks
hotelName:
78    Hilton Madrid Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel, nice staff, near the airport with mall nearby, but could use a renovation.Positives:- comfortable room- gym and indoor pool available- great breakfast- executive floor bar with snacks is a nice touchNegatives:- gym should be in its own area, at the moment it's in the hallway to the pool making it awkward for everyone when somebody walks through to or from the pool - restaurant and food are crazy prices given the low quality. They're taking advantage of there not being many options nearby except the mall.
