Get food delivery rather than eating their sub par €30 dry/burnt chicken breast Would stay again for work, but if you're visiting to do tourist stuff go closer I to the city, this is very far.
hotelName:
78    Hilton Madrid Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed three nights recently on a business trip to Madrid. The hotel has a free shuttle bus to/from Madrid Barajas Airport, running during the day every 30 minutes with service to all terminals. I don’t know what the after-hours bus schedule is.Hotel rooms are clean and comfortable, mine had a glass door that allowed me to let in fresh air from outside. My king bed was very comfortable with 4 pillows. The room floor was hardwood, which I liked very much. To me, carpeting never seems as clean as wooden or tiled floors. Bathroom had a tub, separate shower, toilet, bidet, large glass sink and ample mirrors. Food here is very expensive. I ordered fish and chips for lunch on day one, 22 euros before I added a coke. I ordered a “Burger Party” cheeseburger on day three for dinner, 24 euros (for a hamburger and fries!!!!) before I added a coke. I ordered a pizza from room service later that same night, the total, including a coke and “tray fee” came to 30 euros. There aren’t many (any?) restaurants nearby so be warned .. you may need to Uber to eat, or just be ready to shell out a lot of cash.My waters (2 free per day) were never replaced.. day one I had two waters however on the next two days I was never given more. My coworker had the same experience so this is not isolated. I only received one bar of soap which I needed to shuttle back and forth from the shower to the sink.Executive lounge had extremely limited food choices during the 1800-2100 hours of operation that included alcohol. However, there was an ample supply of Spanish bottled beer and other spirits.All in all, I would return here. The positives far outweighed the few negatives I mentioned. Next time I will be better prepared by researching nearby restaurants as Uber was a cheap way to get around.
hotelName:
78    Hilton Madrid Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I just returned from visiting the beautiful city of Madrid and stayed at the Hilton near the airport. At first we were concerned we would be far from everything, but they had a shuttle that costs 3 EUROS to get to the city each day at 11am, 12 and 1pm. Alejandro checked us in and was very nice and friendly. We came to the front desk a few times to book shuttles and ask for directions and always received a welcoming smile from Veronica, the front office supervisor. She was kind and helpful. She gave us a map and circled all the places we should visit and how to get there and back to the hotel. She even explained how to use the Metro to get back.We told her about us coming all the way to Madrid for the soccer game (athletico vs. barcelona) and she told us that the Athletico Madrid team actually sleeps at our hotel the night before each game so that we can come at a certain time when they arrive to see them!It was a dream come true for my husband!Besides all of that, the breakfast was wonderful each morning! We were very pleased and will definitely come back to this hotel the next time we are in Madrid.
hotelName:
78    Hilton Madrid Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a layover in Madrid and booked this Hilton mostly for short distance/convenience. While I expected a clean room and a comfortable stay, I did not expect such great service and luxury! I was recognized as a Hilton Diamond member and was upgraded to king relaxation room which was awesome. It was in a corner on the 5th “Presidential Floor” one floor above the lounge. The room was very well equipped with a large jacuzzi, separate Roman-style spa shower music system and built-in desk, and flat screen TV. It even had a little Juliette balcony that opened.I had dinner at the bar which was great service and used the shuttle to and from the airport. I also stopped in the 4th floor executive lounge which was very nicely setup.Overall a terrific stay and I would highly recommend this property to others. Someof the best Hilton service in a long tome!
hotelName:
78    Hilton Madrid Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Whilst by no means the best airport hotel I've stayed at, the Hilton Madrid Airport is certainly adequate for an overnight stay. As you would expect from a Hilton property, it is clean and has all the facilities you need as a business or leisure traveller.However, I do have a few comments. Firstly, the hotel is some distance from some of the airport terminals (particulalry Terminal 4), so you will need to use the hotel shuttle (available every 30 minutes) to transit to and from the hotel. This is not in itself a huge issue, it's just something you need to make provision for in your timing.Secondly, the airconditioning in the room didn't seem to be particularly efficient and it resulted in a fairly stuffy night's sleep.Thirdly, the Executive Lounge is at best, basic particulalry compared to many others I've used over the years. Both the drink and food choices are limited and the room itself doesn't have great ambience.Finally, the property is located in a light industrial area, so it's not possible to walk out and grab a meal at a nearby restaurant. As a result, you're virtually obliged to use the hotel's restaurant which is of adequate quality, but is a very high price compared to most restaurants in Spain of a similar standard.As a thoughtfull touch, the hotel provides complementary coffee, juice and pastries in the lobby for guests leaving in the early morning prior to the availability of a full breakfast.In summary, the Hilton Madrid Airport served its purpose as somewhere clean and quiet to stay overnight between flights. However, compared to similar standard airport hotels around the world, I wouldn't say it's the best of the breed.
hotelName:
78    Hilton Madrid Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here one night, flying in from Barcelona and flying home the next day. I chose it because I like Hilton and it was close to the airport. I really appreciated the hotel's free airport shuttle for both our arrival and departure. The staff was extremely helpful, and the room was both beautiful and comfortable. I would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
78    Hilton Madrid Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The best airport hotel in Madrid. The hotel is very specious and welcoming. The room was clean and had all the comforts of Hilton hotels. Very comfortable bed gave a good sleep. Breakfast was superb. I did not use the shuttle bus service, since they run every 30 minutes. Taxi from the hotel is reasonable and much faster than the shuttle which goes trough all terminals. Both check in/out was fast and efficient - friendly staff!
hotelName:
78    Hilton Madrid Airport
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 5 nights with bus trip to Granada. This hotel location was extremely convenient for all the purposes. Same goes for the facilities. Teenager was extremely happy with the gym facility. Only thing missing was in room coffee and tea.
hotelName:
79    Hotel Claridge
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were on a busuness trip and we found this hotel, it was such a pleasant surprise, so clean and nice, the hotel is situated 3 km away from the city centre but if you have a car or use the metro it should be okay, absolutely loved it
hotelName:
79    Hotel Claridge
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: the hotel near to metro station and the Atocha station and also near to mini market, the room was spacious and the service was excellent! the room has city view, it help to check current weather outside
hotelName:
79    Hotel Claridge
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very helpful reception staff went above and beyond even found us a bar at 1am!! Room more than adequate and beds comfortable- shower not a bath Breakfast poor disinterested staff and stale churros and cold coffee
hotelName:
79    Hotel Claridge
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room i was given was very small, awkwardly shaped and I paid more than my friends who got a larger room with a view! The hotel is a good 10-15 minutes ride by car from the centre and does not have many amenities near it. The front desk staff were great but restaurant staff especially the lady had major attitude and was unwilling to help.
hotelName:
79    Hotel Claridge
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: great holiday placea bit out of the centre area not the best of madrid but all centre is easily accessible hotel rooms great and roomystaff really helpful and kind i had to make 200 minimum character
hotelName:
79    Hotel Claridge
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Other than the one young lady attending the restaurant and bar area all else is good. starting with the greetings at the reception desk who after checking us in to the hotel also took the time to give us directions on a map of where to go and visit while we stayed in Madrid. the room was clean and has a nice view
hotelName:
79    Hotel Claridge
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Claridge has a great Location, the staff is very professional and courteous and very comfortable. I was very satisfied and will recommend to anyone that visit Madrid. Subway station just across the street, Lots of restaurants and Bakeries walking distance.
hotelName:
79    Hotel Claridge
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed 5 nights last week with my family and I was pretty satisfied with the hotel. The room was very spacious which is very important for me because I have a lot of stuffs. The hotel is just few minutes away from the metro station and bus stop which is very convenient even though it takes about 20mins to get to downtown. I was able to get my room on the higher floor and close to my family which is very important. I definitely recommend this hotel and if I were to come back to madrid I would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
79    Hotel Claridge
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’m just staying a night at TOC hostel and I found this hostel just more than other hostels because the building made the hostel completely different especially the common lounge area. With special design and the wide space, TOC hostel really an outstanding hostel I’ve seen so far.Location just perfect, easy to access to all tourist spot like Plaza Mayor and Gran Via..of course the hostel quite close with well known Chocolateria San Gínes, just down from another street with 2mins walk, the Madrid churros shop, remember to to try the churros when you stay here.4 beds room the space wide enough and bed extremely comfortable but room a bit hot especially at midnight. WiFi connection strong and overall no issue during the stay.Will recommend for solo traveler and for those who like quiet environment.
hotelName:
80    Toc Hostel & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: if you looking for a place with the great location it is the place... You stay in the heart of Madrid, besides the Subway "Sol"...of course it is the "sun" for all of us ...because put us in the middle of the Spain Capital.
hotelName:
80    Toc Hostel & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 4 nights in a 4 bed dorm with an en-suite bathroom.Arriving from Barcelona, I was about an hour early for check-in, but the staff were really cool about it and let me check-in as the room was ready anyway. The room had A/C as expected and totally necessary considering the heat. It kept the room nice and cool and I had no trouble sleep with the thick blankets provided. Each bed comes with one electrical socket and “bag” to keep your stuff. The room and bathroom are cleaned magnificently, everyday.The kitchen facilities are excellent, plenty of cups, utensils, plates, a microwave and a fridge where you can stash your stuff. Plastic bags are provided for keeping food together and a pen to write your name on the bag. The kitchen, lounge and the entire hotel is kept fantastically clean. The cleaning staff are almost OCD about it, but kudos for that.Location wise, the hostel is only 2 minutes walk to the nearest metro station which is Sol. The hostel is practically on several of the major shopping thoroughfares in central Madrid, so eating, drinking and shopping will be no problem at all. There's also a El Cortes Ingles with a supermarket about two minutes walk if you prefer to stock up and eat at the hostel.Finally, I'd say the staff are a fantastic bunch. Friendly and helpful with any queries and requests.
hotelName:
80    Toc Hostel & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Having never stayed in a hostel before; the family suite at TOC was a pleasant surprise. The room presented to me as newly renovated; so extremly clean. The central location was perfect for exploring Madrid on foot and by Metro.Try it, you may be surprised!
hotelName:
80    Toc Hostel & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for five nights with my family, and really enjoyed the location of this hostel; the beautiful building and decor, and the friendly staff. The common rooms were inviting and the kitchen (with fridge, micro and oven for the guests to use) was well run and clean.Madrid is a very walkable city and so in under twenty minutes you have the big art museums, El Retiro park, and in ten minutes there are lots and lots of cool and cosy bars and cafes and independent stores in Malasaña. The royal palace and Gran Via is just a five minute walk away.Only negative thing was that me and my husbands mattresses were worn out, so it felt a bit like sleeping a hammock. (Not great for the back). Still I would not hesitate to return to this hostel, since everything else was comfortable, easy and inviting.
hotelName:
80    Toc Hostel & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There is nothing negative to say about this hostel. (Short) Walking distance from Plaza del Sol, Gran Via, subway station. I have shared a 6-bed female dorm and I was happy to see that there was enough space for all of us, two very good showers and toilets in the dorm and sinks where you could lay your necessaire while using it. Comfortable beds and clean facilities. The staff was nice and helpful. Breakfast was paid, but I decided to have it one morning to taste it and I don't regret it! Everything was fresh, of good quality and the choice was even a bit larger than in average hostels. In the end, you spend a little more money but what you get is definitely worth the price! Thumbs up!
hotelName:
80    Toc Hostel & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Less than 12 hours after booking my flights and this Hostel I found out that my whole reason for being in Madrid on the 1st June 2019 was a Scam. I was scammed out of nearly £1800. I explained this to the TOC Hostel and they would not consider returning my money after I asked to cancel. I have lost all of my savings to this Scam and now this Hostel and the Airline that I booked with are compounding that hurt even more.Do Hotels/Hostels flights etc have a cooling off period where you can cancel within a certain timeframe without losing everything??
hotelName:
80    Toc Hostel & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: TOC Hostel was in a great location, close to metro, close to Palace, Opera House and many tourist places. The reception staff were really helpful, and they printed off some stuff for me at no charge - it is the little stuff like this that makes an impression. The room and hotel were really clean, well appointed, serviced each day, fresh clean towels and amenities provided. It had a lovely balcony, was totally sound proof (when I opened the windows there was a total party happening every night, but I couldnt hear it with the windows closed), and a lovely queen sized bed, chair to sit in and best of all, fingerprint entry to your room - so no key to carry or lose.It was buzzing with people, I felt safe walking to the hostel at night by myself, the kitchen was clean and well appointed (though no stove for cooking, just an oven, microwave). The decor was fun and inviting, there was a lovely social area with a bar, billiard table and plenty of seating for everyone in comfortable couches or tables and chairs. Really enjoyed my stay and would come back again.
hotelName:
80    Toc Hostel & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good place to stay in the heart of the city safe and clean modern style. According to your room it might be a little bit noisy but still pleasant to stay in.I probably come back there for a new visit of Madrid...
hotelName:
80    Toc Hostel & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing hotel the views are gorgeous and the weather was perfect, staff are friendly and happy to help, I will say the root top pool and area isn’t big enough for people who do want to lounge but will return happily and definitely recommend this place! A good location however the town centre is around a 25 min walk away but it’s right next to the amazing park so can’t complain
hotelName:
81    H10 Puerta de Alcala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a nice hotel. Beds are comfortable. The recent updates to the hotel do make it feel modern. We had a room with a window to the rear courtyard. No street noises which was nice. Great views from the rooftop patio! The location is central with great shopping, sites, and city tour bus nearby. I am being critical of the hotel for three items. The public-access computer on the main floor is in a meeting room which the often rent out to groups. So if there is a meeting you cannot use the computer. Also the chair(s) in this room are not at the correct height (more like armchairs than a desk chair). The biggest issue is their idea of a non-smoking hotel. Granted guests cannot smoke in the building, BUT they have a covered area at the main entrance with an ash tray. People smoke right in front of the main door! This air gets immediately sucked into the hotel and pulled up the central stairwell because the door to the roof-top patio is kept open. On more than one night I had to wet a towel and place it at the bottom of my door to try and stop the smell from getting into my room! When I contacted the front desk they came to see what I was talking about. The man said he could not smell anything in the hallway, but that's impossible. He sent up housekeeping to spray deodorizer. This is not a solution to the problem and they declined my idea to change where they allow guests to smoke. I would not suggest staying at this hotel unless you do not mind the smell of second-hand smoke in the building and potentially in your room.
hotelName:
81    H10 Puerta de Alcala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived pretty early in the morning after an overnight flight. They were very gracious, stowed away all our luggage and told us we could probably get our rooms about 1 pm. Two hours earlier than check in. Room was small but normal size for Europe. Breakfast buffet very good and plentiful selection. The coffee in Spain is amazing. All the hotels had the coffee/latte/espresso machines with assorted size cups and a carafe of hot milk. We stayed two days, room service quick and reasonably priced. Everyone was great.
hotelName:
81    H10 Puerta de Alcala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is walking to retiro park. The goya neighborhood is perfect as this shows a neighborhood feel. There are some nice local resto and tapas bars around. Hotel rooms are slightly on the small side with not much room to move around. Hotel design and art is beautiful though. Bed is very soft and room very clean. Check in and front desk was excellent.
hotelName:
81    H10 Puerta de Alcala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for the second time on business trip to Madrid. H10 is always my first option everywhere I go for work. This one is a fantastic 4* hotel in a great area of Madrid. The rooms are spacious, with very nice modern furniture and art, a wonderfully comfortable bed and an also spacious bathroom with every accessory that you can imagine. No need to call reception for the missing toothbrush or shaving foam...everything is there already. Big TV with international channels, wifi, etc... The building is also decorated with top class taste. Art, design lights, chairs, sofas,... You can tell that there is thought and care in every single little thing. The breakfast buffet is not a disappointment either. Wide variety of options and all of high quality. If all this was not enough, the best in my opinion is the client experience and service. The staff are outstanding in their profession. Perfect balance between attention and respect for the costumer's space. When working you appreciate being offered attention, but you also require not being disturben unnecessarily. And they have found the formula to achieve both. Reception was also welcoming, fast, efficient and informative. I was working, but there were families and tourists staying as well. Never getting too busy, though. And the price is very competitive for their range. This is not a budget hotel, but it is very much worth the price that they charge. In summary, 10 out of 10 in what I look for in a hotel.
hotelName:
81    H10 Puerta de Alcala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good place to spend the a night or two. Room was not fancy but very clean. Location is great, safe, walking distance to great restaurants. Staff in the hotel extremely courteous, polite and efficient.
hotelName:
81    H10 Puerta de Alcala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place was great. The rooms were so clean and always done to perfection.The staff are very friendly and helpful.As you entered the breakfast room you were greeted and taken to a table by pleasant servers. Breakfast was good for buffet.The food at the roof top and its amazing views were incedible.Alberto at the front desk was so helpful. Alberto directed us to restaurants and directions to everywhere.We would stay here again!
hotelName:
81    H10 Puerta de Alcala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I recently stayed in this hotel with my boyfriend and can’t even explain how rude the staff are! They have a rooftop bar terrace which is tiny so u can never get a seat up there! We were sat down and not given a menu, which is what they were doing for everyone else, so after 10 minutes I had to go and get one myself. We waited 20 minutes to get served, there were people coming in after us and being seated right beside us and getting served before us so my boyfriend went to the bar to order our drinks, the woman behind the bar said sit down someone will take you order, in a very rude way! He came to sit down and we waited Another 5 minutes to order. We would have left but it was our last night in Madrid and we hadn’t be able to go to this bar yet as we were staying in the hotel ourselves but every time we had went it was far too busy and was nowhere for us to sit. Staff were so arrogant I wouldn’t stay in this hotel ever again do not recommend what so ever!! Don’t waste your money when there’s far better hotels! We only really stayed in this hotel because of the rooftop bar but I wish we wouldn’t have bothered! U literally get stared at by everyone up there if ur young!
hotelName:
81    H10 Puerta de Alcala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location close to the metro station. Quiet rooms and the comfiest beds! We loved the roof top terrace and pool, which had lots of seating. The bar was a little pricey as expected. We had a delay in our flight meaning we were 8 hours late on arrival, we called the hotel and they were extremely helpful and accommodating.
hotelName:
81    H10 Puerta de Alcala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Every aspect of my stay was a step above and beyond what was necessary. I truly was sad to check out! Fabulous hotel located in the heart of central Madrid on the very popular Calle Gran Via. Front reception staff was actually friendly (hard to find in Madrid) who helped me get checked in.The lady also gave me a helpful map and pointed out where the 2 museums were that I wanted to visit. I arrived a bit early but it wasn’t a problem at all and I was able to have access to my room right away. My room was practical yet stylish. I loved the floor to ceiling mirror that also doubled as the bathroom door. As is common in Europe, the room card must be placed in the slot by the door for the electricity to work. In the bathroom, there was a narrow counter above the sink to place toiletries. There was a magnifying mirror next to the sink which was very much appreciated. The 1/2 glass shower door meant that the bath water did not spill out onto the floor. The drain worked well. There was a placard with instructions to work the shower however it made no sense at all and unfortunately was not helpful at all. The shower seemed to have one temperature, which was hotter than I cared for, a rarity in Europe where most often the problem seems to be the inability to get hot water. I appreciated the amenities that were provided, shower gel, shampoo, LOTION(!), a shower camp and a sponge. The shower drained well. Electrical outlets on both side of the bed were very convenient. The only possible drawback was that my room faced Calle Gran Via and was pretty noisy. I slept fine but others might find it a problem. There was a rooftop patio that explored one night but it was closed (December) while I was there
hotelName:
53    Vincci The Mint
82    Vincci The Mint
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of Vincci The Mint is phenomenal for sightseers and nightlife goers alike. It's no more than a 15 minute walk to any tourist destination you want to see, but also just behind the hotels is a series of back streets with local pubs and restaurants to Michelin star fine dining. The hotel was exceptionally well appointed and a great, fun place to hangout while in-between activities. Core vitals: the service was excellent, the hotel was clean, and the beds were comfortable. When I come back with friends, I will stay here again.
hotelName:
53    Vincci The Mint
82    Vincci The Mint
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 4 nights at the hotel during our first visit to Madrid. The staff at the hotel was probably the most welcoming staff we have ever encountered - they all did their best to make sure we will enjoy our stay.The hotel itself is located right at the heart of the Gran Via, within a walking distance from most of the major attractions.
hotelName:
53    Vincci The Mint
82    Vincci The Mint
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband, adult daughter, and myself stayed seven nights at Vincci The Mint room 409, a triple junior suite The reception staff was extremely friendly and helpful with transportation advice. We paid for the included breakfast and it was excellent. Instead of a buffet or a buffet combined with hot order, you simply order what you wanted from the expansive menu (everything from an Iberian ham platter to a cheese tray to yogurt and muesli to eggs, waffles, etc.) - the food was uniformly delicious and the wait staff (shout out to Alejandro) was so friendly. They even had soy milk for my dairy-sensitive daughter. We could not have been happier. In the rooms, the beds were very comfortable (they provided a third bed for my daughter instead of the pull-out couch that is customary in Europe triples and less comfortable) and it was behind a partial wall for some privacy. The bathroom was very spacious (especially by European standards) with double sinks, a towel warmer, and a tub shower with consistently good pressure and temperature control. The mini bar items were reasonably priced, there were ample outlets for our devices, and there were individual adjustable lamps beside the double bed. Extra touches: they left a typewritten multi-page list of the neighborhoods in Madrid and the activities, sites, favorite staff restaurants in each one. There is a gorgeous rooftop bar; however, it was too cold to enjoy that during our visit. There are tons of great restaurants within yards of the restaurant and the hotel is less than a 15 minute walk to the popular Puerto de Sol. Taxis are plentiful right outside the hotel door. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.
hotelName:
53    Vincci The Mint
82    Vincci The Mint
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing Property! Excellent staff and great common areas. It has a great location. Breakfast was excellent as well with plenty of options.it walking distance to main Madrid’s highlights and attractions. I’ll come back in the future for sure.
hotelName:
53    Vincci The Mint
82    Vincci The Mint
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent from check-in to check-out.Comfortable bed booked a junior suite which was spacious and quite.Very clean.Only issue which wasn't a problem for us, however, is you are less mobile the shower over the bath could be problematic if trying to step in due to the fixed shower panel meaning you were stepping into the slant at the back of the bath which was a bit unbalancing with no handrails.
hotelName:
53    Vincci The Mint
82    Vincci The Mint
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location in centre of Madrid close to Riquel park . Breakfast incl very generous. The rooms are very comfortable. Decoration at reception was original and fun. During the summer the rooftop is said to be a great hangout place for drinks.
hotelName:
53    Vincci The Mint
82    Vincci The Mint
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect place to visit Madrid! Breakfast is generous and very good. Super charming in reception, bar and house keeping always helpful. We traveled with a toddler got a nice cute cot for her and a special bathtub for baby without asking.
hotelName:
53    Vincci The Mint
82    Vincci The Mint
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I'm quite pleased to return to this place, almost every quarter for business. The location is great, and yet if there are some changes in the product portfolio they carry, the people there make all the difference. Always receiving with a smile and more importantly handling issues with a smile and feel of ease.
hotelName:
53    Vincci The Mint
82    Vincci The Mint
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed staying at this Hotel and preferred the residential location as found nice places to eat close by where the locals use.H10 hotels are always of a high standard and the Tribeca was no different. It’s nice to be offered a welcome drink and the staff were friendly, this is why I am a member of the H10 group.I upgraded to a superior room and was not expensive at all, probably best to book a superior room initially rather than waiting on arrival as it is worth it.The breakfast was good but could improve if totally honest.We used the Tourist us to take us to the centre, the closest stop was but the football stadium but there other options also.Overall an enjoyable stay and no regrets not being in the centre as I could experience the local community.
hotelName:
83    H10 Tribeca
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Positives:Bar staff kind and welcomingBathrooms are massive, rooms are big and beds are comfortableIn safe area near stadiumPlenty of breakfast choices nearbyVictor very helpfulNegatives:Reception staff all stand and gawk as you check inOnly certain clientele receive the welcome glass of cavaVery unfriendly and abrupt check out
hotelName:
83    H10 Tribeca
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Enjoyed our stay thoroughly. Many fresh choices for breakfast. Limited lobby area and not too convenient to public transportation. Spacious room and bathroom. Desk staff friendly and helpful. Dinner menu limited. Would stay again.
hotelName:
83    H10 Tribeca
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is right on a corner and walking distance to plenty of restaurants, convenience stores, and a huge Corte Ingles that is fantastic. The staff was friendly, the beds were very nice, extremely clean, lots of toiletries, big towels, fully stocked minifridge, and fantastic breakfast buffet. The rooms have a contemporary look and the lobby, breakfast area have a West side/New York loft look. Huge maps of the NYC subway on the walls? I can't think of any negatives. Not fancy or luxurious but simple, impeccably clean, tasteful and a very good value.
hotelName:
83    H10 Tribeca
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a fantastic modern hotel which is done out beautifully. The reception bar area is lovely and the rooms are great. Really good comfortable beds and a clean bathroom. The breakfast was amazing had everything you could ever want and even bubbly for breakfast if it is required. The only downside is that it was a more business district and not far from Real Madrid’s stadium approx 8 minute walk. So could be good for the footie fans. Staff in the bar where extremely helpful and the gins are amazing in there.
hotelName:
83    H10 Tribeca
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed a few days in Madrid with the family, having driven from the UK. The secure carpark was an added bonus, and they were totally destination chargers on one of the floors however the passage way to get to the floor car park is very narrow. On arrival we were greeted with Cava or soft drinks. There was a smell as reception the others have mentioned, though this was just essential oils.... The room was large for three of us and the bathroom was really good. 2 of the 3 lifts could go all the way down to the car park levels.We walked into Madrid, and mainly ate at the local restaurantsFor a city centre, it was really good value and for a football fanatic, brilliant,being so close to the stadium.
hotelName:
83    H10 Tribeca
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for the first time in H10 Tribeca in our family vacation trip to Spain. The hotel is very nice, wonderful. The room for the standard was bigger that we expected. The restaurant is great! The breakfast is very good!! The staff at Restaurant provide an outstanding service! For sure we are looking for back to H10 Tribeca in the future.
hotelName:
83    H10 Tribeca
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel has everything it takes to be very good, but after checking in I was already looking forward to leave. The waitress was rude and impolite, I regularly visit hotels and have not been treated like that in my entire life. Luckily there was a trainee, I do hope she does not pick up the style demonstrated over there. No welcome, the only words I heard were "passport" and "credit card for warranty". The lady smashed my items back on the counter, went away, and let the trainee offer me the keys.Really a shame, as the room was nice and comfortable, the breakfast outstanding and the staff over there extremely helpful, the best I ever had. But checking out, the guy copied the behaviour of his colleague, the room was prepaid and he just took the keys and went away, did not even bother to say everything was fine or wish me a pleasant day. Again, the trainee came and told me I could leave. I felt her embarrassment with the total lack of empathy demonstrated by the people she was supposed to learn from. I visited the hotel twice: the first and last time.
hotelName:
83    H10 Tribeca
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed a couple of nights in this hotel a year or so ago when participating in the Vaughantown English Immersion course. I was back again in May and stayed for one night, The experience both times was so good that I hope to return again when I am back in Madrid.The buffet breakfast must be the absolute best in the city. Expansive in scope, it offers almost every breakfast item that could be desired. Be smart and include it in the room charge. You will not be disappointed I am sure.The rooms are large, well appointed, and a pleasure to occupy. The shower is marvelous with ample hot water and luxurious soaps. And when you are at the lobby desk to check in you are offered a glass of Cava!!!Some may consider it expensive, but remember, you get what you pay for!!!
hotelName:
83    H10 Tribeca
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Huge surprise. I had a good deal and try out this hotel for my first stay in Madrid and had the chance to enjoy everything from the beginning to the checkout. Everybody is really helpful and give you tips about nightlife, restaurants and historical views of Madrid. We also enjoyed the bathroom and room, ours wasn’t very big but well furnished.Regarding the location, it is quite convenient and you are able to walk in the whole city center.
hotelName:
84    The Walt Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: True to the description, The Walt is a modern, trendy boutique hotel centrally located right off Gran Via. Upon entering, you walk down into the reception area. We showed up around noon and our room was not ready. The staff was accommodating and got us in earlier than initially proposed. Just had a drink in their sleek dining area while we waited.Took the elevator up and was enthused by our room. It has two rooms; one a lounge area with a sofa and eating table and the other, the bedroom. Plenty of space for your luggage and a nice closet that lights up upon opening. The closet also contains a safe. Additional items include a wet bar, mini fridge, microwave and two televisions.Additional notes:1. Our room bordered the street Calle del Barco. We experienced loud outbursts past midnight from people walking through. 2. Location is ideal for walking to all the attractions.3. Uber from the train station was 8 Euros and change.4. Taxi from the hotel to the airport was a flat rate of 30 Euros.Total score = 4.5 (would definitely return)
hotelName:
84    The Walt Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Walt is in a great location accessible to Gran Via and the Center City and many sights and shopping. The staff was super friendly and helpful, recommending local restaurants, coordinating a night out for Flamenco, and helping with transportation to the train station on departure. On premise is a nice restaurant for breakfast, great coffee, and drinks. Room was comfortable, clean, and roomy. Would definitely recommend and would stay there again.
hotelName:
84    The Walt Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The walt ia a charming hotel, un a great location. the reception team was very young, a little clueless sometimes but eager to help. the room was very nice and clean, and the terrace was great. Highly recomended
hotelName:
84    The Walt Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location, very clean throughout, friendly employees. The only issue I did have was disappointing...I reported to the front desk manager that our AC unit was dripping on the floor the very first evening and I was told that the setting was possibly to low and it was creating condensation. We adjusted setting on AC to a setting that was almost at room temperature and the drip continued through the night and morning. It was difficult to sleep due to the lack of AC and constant drip sound. I explained this to the manager upon check out and all we got was and I am sorry. It was disappointing because the hotel should do a better job at customer service. we will not be back again because of this. Hope this review changes the policy of the hotel and makes them better because the property has a lot going for it.
hotelName:
84    The Walt Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Disproportionate bathroom to bedroom.Modern,clean,wonderful location.light on outside the bedroom all night.Quiet location small hotelRight next to Primark on the main drag and close to all the bars and restaurants
hotelName:
84    The Walt Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful beautiful and romantic room with terrace. it was in centre of the town. 2 minutes walk from high street.Room was clean and huge. Staff at reception was very friendly. We needed some stuff and reception staff brought it to our room. Had bar and restaurant.Have to look carefully on street as have small sign. Reception was great decorated with modern furniture.Our bed headboard had lights too.Rooms was cleaned daily but our sheets were changed daily too which doesn’t happen it many hotels.They shown us some good places to visit.
hotelName:
84    The Walt Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is in the most perfect location.Steps away from the Gran Via - shopping, architecture, restaurants, cafes.Rooms are nice and clean.Next time I will book a room with a terrace, other than that...was perfect.Would stay again.
hotelName:
84    The Walt Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our fifth visit to Madrid but this was the best hotel we have stayed in. It was very very clean with a great shower. The room was a small but had a balcony. Just off Gran Via so everything you need is there just a short walk. The hotel sent us the directions by taxi bus & metro. The Gran Via Metro station was closed so the last leg of the journey got a bit confusing however easily sorted once we asked in the station, the Caleo station was only another three minute walk away. All in all a great city break including a great hotel.
hotelName:
84    The Walt Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff is not helpful, they tell you the hotel is fully booked when you ask to change room while they have room available. When you ask for services, they do not deliver.Location: nothing decent around ( restaurants, bars, etc..)
hotelName:
85    Ayre Gran Hotel Colon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I really like the hotel, is in a great area of Madrid, very well connected, with a lot of local restaurants and bars near by. The hotel was very clean, the food was okey, the rooms are pretty good. My only complain are the elevators, they are old and not well synchronize, even thought they have 4, it takes so long to go down or up, that I had to use the escalators many times.
hotelName:
85    Ayre Gran Hotel Colon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel superbly decorated within easy walking distance to metro. Only fault I could give is that there are no coffee or tea making facilities in the room. Coffee vending machine in foyer, but would prefer facilities in rooms.
hotelName:
85    Ayre Gran Hotel Colon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were a group of 20 and visited for a birthday celebration, the hotel was near the park retrio and a lovely walk through the park to the city centre. The staff were very efficient but also friendly, the rooms comfortable, the breakfast was good buffet style with plenty of choice. Good base for a visit to Madrid.
hotelName:
85    Ayre Gran Hotel Colon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were not in the main building for the hotel, but our room was exceptionally quiet, well furnished with a lounge area and tv, a good sized bathroom with large walk in shower. Everywhere was very clean and the service from the staff was helpful and professional.We really liked the location, it was just a couple of streets away from the Retiro Park, which was a lovely area to walk around, and you can walk on to Museums just beyond there. The bus stop and metro station were very close to the hotel, and ideal for getting around and right into the centre.We thought that the Hotel was very good value and an ideal location.
hotelName:
85    Ayre Gran Hotel Colon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in this hotel for 3 days on a business trip.Its a nice hotel with good buffet breakfast. i reached quite early in morning but they made room available without any fuss.Though i feel rooms are bit small and expensive for facilities .No tea or coffee maker in room.Beds are comfortable and clean.
hotelName:
85    Ayre Gran Hotel Colon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our first hotel on our trip to Spain. We were pleasantly surprised and happy to see how nice the room was. Would definitely stay here again and recommend this place. The location was great also.
hotelName:
85    Ayre Gran Hotel Colon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very clean; efficient and cordial staff. Quiet and excellent for a good rest before/after flight. There were a few dated aspects, including some ‘wear and tear’ parts of the room and corridor, but nothing overly-concerning. Some attention to detail by maintenance staff would address this. I will stay here again.
hotelName:
85    Ayre Gran Hotel Colon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights. One night prior to our tour beginning and 2 nights on the tour. The first night we had a triple room which was really a double room with the addition of a third bed. This configuration was tight and since there is no where in the bathroom to store anything, the room was claustrophobic with all the suitcases, toiletry bags, and beds. On days 2 and 3 the third person moved into their own room and our room felt much more comfortable and big enough for 2. The room is fine but the bathroom lacks adequate counter space. There is a great deal of open and empty space in the bathroom due to the spartan design of the room so adding some type of shelving to address lack of storage would be an easy fix.We purchased the buffet breakfast the first day and it was included on the tour day mornings. This was worth the price. The food was good and there was a great deal of variety including gluten free options. The restaurant was clean and the food was replenished frequently. We didn't see any other places to eat breakfast near the hotel so the buffet is a great option. The location is not walkable to the main area of Madrid but a bus stop is located just down the street and the bus goes to the middle of town. There is also a metro stop nearby so transportation is easy accessible to anywhere you want to visit in Madrid.
hotelName:
85    Ayre Gran Hotel Colon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent two nights with my parents there(14/10 and 15/10) . We were checked in by a lovely Venezuelan girl who showed us the apartment, explain the map and some things about the city. The first night, we were in the 4th floor- Room 4D which has a really nice view to the Santo Domingo Square and others nice streets. The second night, my parents were in a really big apartment 4A, which has two rooms and everything nice. After travelling for more than 1 month, the rooms in this hostal are even better that in a 4 stars hotel where we were. Finally, I left my parents there and the Venezuelan girl (Lidi ??? ) help them to book a taxi for the next day to the airport and also helped me to get my boarding ready.Thanks again to her and gala hostal for your hospitality.Best regards Jeison cepeda
hotelName:
86    Hostal Gala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just returned from a 4 night stay at Hostal Gala with my daughter. Have to say I was a bit apprehensive to stay in a hostel as it always brings to mind dormitories and backpackers. How wrong I was. A bit hard to find as just a wooden front door with a tatty small flag above it. However once at reception the welcome was warm and friendly.The room we had was spotlessly clean, spacious with a great ensuite, and a small balcony overlooking the square. The beds were clean and comfy. The location is perfect as within walking distance of pretty much everything, Gran Via, Plaza del Mayor, Plaza del Sol, the Palace and Cathedral and the food market. Lots of bars and restaurants in the immediate vicinity and even though there are hot & cold beverage vending machines in the hostel, there is a great cafe opposite. The reception is manned 24/7 but you get your own door keys so can come and go freely. The only downside is if your a light sleeper you may need ear plugs. The square outside attracts skateboarders until quite late, the hostel is above an Escape Room venue which obviously has some excitable moments, the internal walls are a bit thin and the floor in our room was very squeaky but then it is an old building. Overall great value for money for a great location, good size clean room with a comfy bed.
hotelName:
86    Hostal Gala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived in Spain to thorough and clear directions to access this hotel. It was well signed despite being in a building located next to the plaza. We were very pleased with our comfortable, clean room and more than pleased with the hotel's proximity to the sites, sights and thoroughfares. Staff were absolutely lovely, offering suggestions about districts and things to see, troubleshooting any issues (our aircon randomly turned off one afternoon) and even happily printing some tickets for us for no charge. A home away from home, would return here.
hotelName:
86    Hostal Gala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Gala hostel has a perfect location if you want to spend a few days in Madrid . Most of the time you can walk everywhere and enjoying the bars and the restaurants in the center. The staff were very friendly and helpful (24/7). The room was big enough for a couple with nice bathroom. The balcony gives to the plaza(square) which is usually crowded and very noisy which can be a problem for someone who prefers silent nights.
hotelName:
86    Hostal Gala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a great location. That staff were there 24x7, and very nice/helpful. The guy that checked us in gave us some great tips on were to go and what to do. Probably one of the nicest hotel/hostel staffs I've come across.The main problem:Thursday and Friday night the street turns into a party area. The next morning there are beer cans and broken bottles all over the place. When we left to go to the airport there were still a group of guys outside that were drinking and tried to harass us as we walked away. This is obviously not a negative on the hostel Gala, but it's something you should be aware of if choosing it.Bring ear plugs or noise cancellation technology if needed. My wife is not normally sensitive to noise and she couldn't sleep.The renovations that were done look nice in the pictures but everything is very cheaply done. The bed was hard and uncomfortable. pulling the sheets bad the mattress looked about 20+ years old. The room was tiny, really tiny. The bathroom was equally small. The bed was full size, not queen. Over all because of the location I though that it was a good value. I'm not sure I'd stay here again, but I wouldn't rule it out.
hotelName:
86    Hostal Gala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is an old building but is well maintained. This is a pricey Hostal, but I think its worth the money. It is clean, the staff is nice, rooms are small as you can expect from a hostal, but the location is really great. It is two blocks away from la Gran Via, few blocks from Sol, Palacio Real, and many other city attractions. The neighborhood is safe and there are at least 3 metro stops within 2 blocks from the hostal, so it is really easy to get there. If you are arriving or leaving when metro is not opened, it costs 30 euros to get to/from the airport.
hotelName:
86    Hostal Gala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stopped with a group of 9 friends in the middle of June and didn't hear one complaint from any of them. (Ones a right moaner too)Heard that if you were facing the street noise could be a problem but can't say I noticed anything. Beds made everyday and towels changed. The rooms were spacious and clean and in general the whole hostel was spotless. Staff were very friendly and helpful at all times. Shop that sells everything you need on the same street. Bars across the road which were perfect for us while waiting for everyone to get ready. Would recommend going to see Kev Gymage Lounge for a roof top bar and pool. Tried a local restaurant too! It's called McDonald's and does excellent burgers. Loads of bars and clubs and if I ever go back with a group I'll 100% be stopping here. Also the showers were crazy good!
hotelName:
86    Hostal Gala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hostal Gala exceeded my expectations. I felt I got my money's worth and more. Thank you Hostal Gala. Here is my objective impression:Pros:Great location, close to transportation, restaurants, cafes, Gran Via, Sol CleanShower is amazing, great pressureTowels are great (i saw a review about them being bad, that is not true)Good room size for European standards, quite surprised as usually rooms are way smaller 24h reception serviceFree breakfast snacksGood lightingComfortable bedThey attend to your needs and requests in a friendly and efficient manner (except for one instance, see Cons below): toilette was not flushing properly and they called a plumber right away and offered me to change me rooms if problem was not resolved in a timely fashionConsToilette was not working properly and I reported asap, at first the reception desk lady implied I may have done something, later after the plumber came they realized it was not me and profusely apologized---but I def did not like to be accused of something I did not doSince it is in the center of Madrid it can be noisy
hotelName:
86    Hostal Gala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked the place for 5 nights but due to change of travel plan we had to leave on the second day. The front desk staff was quite friendly about our change and refunded 2 nights out of the 5 (we only stayed 1 night). If you need to cancel last minute or leave early, their policy is to charge for the next 48 hours. The room is clean and modern looking. Our room had an ensuite bathroom but it's quite small, You can rest your chin on the sink in front of you when you sit on the toilet. The room has a small balcony looking out to the intersection and nice natural light coming in. It's only a minute away from the Gran Via street and 3 minutes walk from Plaza Callao. I would come stay again next time I am in Madrid.
hotelName:
86    Hostal Gala
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in a very clean and spacious room. The staff were extremely helpful with directions and any information needed during our stay. We were able to obtain our room key on arrival prior to the check in time which was very appreciated after flying for 24 hours. We would highly recommend
hotelName:
87    VP Jardin Metropolitano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall the room is good and staff are friendly and helpful . This particular individual named Luis was very rude when I had to wait for 20 mins for a room key card that wasn't working , no explanation given let alone any apologize . I missed lunch meeting because of it and Luis simply said that's how it is and you can't speak to a manager all you want . I have no problem with room key card not working , this happens on all the hotels . But after waiting for 20 mins in the queue for this and received no sympathy from the hotel is just poor service .
hotelName:
87    VP Jardin Metropolitano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I'm just back from a work visit to Madrid and I stayed at this hotel. The location is great, the rooms clean and quiet, the staff are helpful and polite. The hotel's restaurant is quite decent, but there are a lot bars and restaurants nearby if you're feeling adventurous. The nearby metro station offers easy access to pretty much everything in Madrid.
hotelName:
87    VP Jardin Metropolitano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Cannot say enough good things about this hotel and the staff. First of all, we arrived to Madrid at 10:00 am on the morning train from Barcelona. Even at that hour, they were able to get us situated into a room so that we could start our day sightseeing which was a blessing as we only had two days in Madrid. Secondly, they made a phone calls for us to see if we could change a reservation we had at a particular restaurant, but gave us additional information even when we could not. Thirdly and most importantly, due to a family emergency back in the States, we had to leave Madrid immediately and Alberto was extremely kind in helping us figure out how to make phone calls out, arranged a taxi, made sure the call we had been waiting on to change our flight got through and it was a priority. Everyone was extremely helpful during this very stressful moment of crisis. The hotel is so conveniently located and is very clean, comfortable, and quiet, with excellent breakfast choices. Don’t think twice, book this hotel.
hotelName:
87    VP Jardin Metropolitano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just spent four days in Madrid and stayed at the Jardin Metropolitano. Excellent location close to everything, great value for the price, and the staff was exceptional. They were helpful, engaging, and offered great suggestions for places nearby to visit. The breakfasts were delicious too. Our room had two full size beds which is unique in Europe. I will definitely stay there again when I am in Madrid.
hotelName:
87    VP Jardin Metropolitano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is located in Madrid's financial district, meaning it's a bit out of the way from the central tourism area. However, it's a two-minute walk to Cuatro Caminos metro station, which has connections to several different metro lines (including the one to the airport!), meaning you can hop on and get around the city with ease. It took about 20 minutes to get to Sol station, which is by Plaza Mayor, to give you an example. That said, there is enough by the hotel to keep you entertained and well-fed; there's many fast-food places, bars, shops, and even a grocery store (Carrefour, open 24/7). The grocery store came in very handy, especially since we had a mini-fridge in our room.The hotel workers did their best to check us in as quickly as possible - especially since we arrived at 9am and they didn't anticipate any clean rooms to be available. The room itself was pretty spacious and super clean. My travel partner - who is particularly picky about cleanliness - was impressed, so that's saying something! The beds were incredibly comfortable and I had no issues sleeping. The A/C worked AMAZING, which was much needed, given the heat in Madrid in July. I experienced two minor issues I'd like to share. For one, the wifi wasn't the best. When you're on a trip, you shouldn't be glued to your phone - you should be off enjoying the sights! However, it's nice to be able to get in touch with people back home or take some downtime to watch YouTube, and that's hard to do when the wifi is finicky. The second issue I had was the hair dryer going off on its own at 5 or 6ish in the morning during two nights of our stay. It was very weird. All of a sudden, the hair dryer turned on by itself, woke us up, and we had to go and shut it off. It was the only piece of equipment in our room that seemed outdated, so I'm not sure if that's the cause for it malfunctioning or what? Overall, this place is aesthetically beautiful and modern, very comfortable, and close to amenities. Would recommend.
hotelName:
87    VP Jardin Metropolitano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Having just returned from Madrid and a 1 night stay in this hotel id have to say what a delight it was. The hotel itself is very impressive with a good standard of decor and facilities. The room was superb, big comfortable beds fantastic facilities i couldn't fault it. It was conveniently situated for the metro to travel around and had a host of bars and restaurants in an easy walking distance. When ever i return to Madrid Im sure ill return here to stay as i really cant fault it.
hotelName:
87    VP Jardin Metropolitano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We always love this hotel. The only thing wrong is that staff for breakfast are unhelpful. The guy that worked there was lovely but the girl was MOST unhelpful. Everything else about the hotel is GREAT. The staff on the desk are great - shame about the breakfast people.
hotelName:
87    VP Jardin Metropolitano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed there for Fitur. The Hotel is really well located with the underground on the door. The hotel is well kept, really clean, good service. The breakfast is really good for a City Hotel and room service is good. I highly recommend it for a short stay in Madrid. The negative is the price for the parking is really expensive.
hotelName:
87    VP Jardin Metropolitano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is very central which is amazing for easy access. but what a difference is the friendly Staff especially Alberto who made our stay special with his extra efforts and always being helpful and attentive.
hotelName:
89    Axel Hotel Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently stayed at the Axel Hotel in Madrid and enjoyed it very much: very nicely appointed room, quiet (ask for a room facing the internal courtyard), and with a whimsical decor. Good breakfast (the restaurant also serves Peruvian Japanese fusion food, which is excellent). Friendly and efficient staff. Perfect location: within walking distance of the main museums (Prado, Thyssen, etc.) and even of the best gay club in town (Attack SX)!
hotelName:
89    Axel Hotel Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We traveled to Madrid for a short city break and this hotel had great reviews. As a mature couple we thought this LGBT hotel would be full of same sex couples but this was far from the case. A special shout-out to the reception staff who could not have been more helpful. We also chose this hotel as it has a rooftop pool but we fully expected this to be closed in November. Luckily for us the pool was still open (until 11.30pm each night) so we were able to enjoy the heated pool by moonlight! The rooms were quirky in design, spotlessly clean and the breakfast (which was included) was delicious and open until 1100am so plenty of opportunity for a lie-in. This hotel is ideal for anyone looking for great service and a great location (the nearest Metro station Anton Martin is just down the street) from which to explore the wonderful city of Madrid. Check out my review of the free walking tour too, well worth doing...
hotelName:
89    Axel Hotel Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Definitely this is a hotel I will be back. The location is excellent, the service and the amenities... At this hotel you aren't one more guest... They make you feel special and always call you by your name.We stayed 4 nights and we wanted even to stay longer... At the beginning of my stay I had some difficulties (who doesn't? We are human and nothing is perfect) but the employees of the hotel resolved everything promptly and we were treated like royalty.The hospitality and restaurants industry is full of certain difficulties when taking care of its guests... No one is exempt! The secret is to react promptly and resolve anything that will be on the way... This is exactly what this hotel did and I want to give special thanks to David from the Front Desk who was so helpful and he was always ready to have a nice conversation with us and to take care of any of our needs.The room was huge (203) in incredible amenities. The hotel premises are always spotless and you always find a friendly and helpful team member around.Even though the location is very central and convenient the hotel is very quite and it's perfect for a good sleep and to recharge during your holidays.I will tell all my family and friends about this hotel and I can't wait to be back... And again... David! Thank you so much and to all your Team... You have made our stay memorable.
hotelName:
89    Axel Hotel Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The service was truly above and beyond here, everyone who worked there was incredibly friendly and knowledgeable. The manager personally made sure our stay was perfect including finding two rooms side by side on a busy long weekend last minute for us. The hotel itself is beautiful and the rooftop pool can’t be beat. Highly recommend having the breakfast, it’s fantastic. We loved the decor of the rooms and learning about its connection to queer culture in Spain. Cortes is a wonderful area to wonder around in day and night, plus we could walk to all the big museums. Truly a perfect stay, THANK YOU!!
hotelName:
89    Axel Hotel Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Even if Axel Hotel is adults only and ‘Hetero Friendly’ as they proclaim, you don’t have to be gay to enjoy it. I was just there with my wife for a couple of nights and we can state that this is probably the best hotel for the price. Excellent location right in the heart of the city, great and extremely friendly service by everyone, we strongly recommend it to everyone no matter your sexual orientations. People are very welcome to this hotel and we can state it. Thank you good people of Axel hotel!
hotelName:
89    Axel Hotel Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The guys was really nice, the location of the hotel is perfect and the rooms are very cool. That wasn’t our last stop at Axel! A special thx to alberts! Best regards to the whole Hotel-Team A. Kessler
hotelName:
89    Axel Hotel Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked the hotel through Easyjet and sooooo glad that we did. As it says on the advertisement is is heterofriendly and we just loved everything about it. the staff on reception were fantastic and the room was stunning! Such a fun decor and so many lovely little touches in the presentation of the room. The beds were super comfortable and couldn't fault anything about our stay. Breakfast buffet is available in the adjoining eating area and we added that on to our accommodation booking as it was there was ample choice. The hotel is very near to the centre of the city and why we originally chose it. I've already recommended to friends on Facebook as it is a place that I would definitely choose to stay again.
hotelName:
89    Axel Hotel Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just returned from this hotel and had an amazing time. The location is perfect being just a short stroll to the main shopping area, the park, gay area and the historic square for dinner. The hotel itself has really nice rooms (maybe a tad dark), fantastic shower and really comfy beds. Small bar downstairs which to be honest I wouldn’t bother with. The roof top pool is a great place to get the end of day sun.
hotelName:
89    Axel Hotel Madrid
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had been there for 2 nights in a 6-bed room. The room is clean, very interesting and comfortable layout of the room, that provides you good rest. All the amenities inside the room. Good location in the city center, near the Metro station. Kind and cheerful staff.
hotelName:
90    Bastardo Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What I love about the hostel is the friendly vibe and the amazing staff, 5/5 for the service. I have to mention the pub crawl tour which is a must! No keys, QR code in your phone, wow!The rooms and beds were really excellent, I really liked the privacy. The dorm was clean when I entered, cleaned everyday and absolutely no issues with the general cleanliness of the hostel in general. The beds were arranged two by two and each had a privacy because the design around the shower, which as we all know can make a major difference between getting a good nights sleep or not depending on your room-mates. Fortunately Bastardo is a "higher" class of hostel and my room-mates were all very clean, tidy and mindful.The showers and bathrooms were really clean, and available.
hotelName:
90    Bastardo Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Super nice employees, perfect location, good wifi, clean facilities, 2m long beds (what a bliss), guided tours (perfect way to discover the city), concerts, and stuff organized every day, .... Perfect !
hotelName:
90    Bastardo Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Incredible location. Super clean. It's not a backpacker hostel, it's more a familiar place to stay on a budget. I stayed at a shared room (6 people) it the place is comfortable. My roommates very nice and privacy driven girls. Definitely would stay there again.
hotelName:
90    Bastardo Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were due to stay at the hostel, but they cancelled our rooms just 2 days before we were due to arrive!They cited a payment issue and gave 24 hours to resolve, but gave up our rooms to others within the timeframe regardless. We confirmed with the booking agent there were no issues with our payment details and no attempted payment with the bank, so have to assume they sold our rooms to a higher bidder - turns out it was the Madrid derby that weekend, which would not have been known when we booked months ago.Have sent a complaint, but still waiting to hear, as we were left to find alternative accommodation which left us out of pocket.Could not trust with a future booking!
hotelName:
90    Bastardo Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here 4 nights as a Couple. Booked the Double Room , which were on the 6th Floor I guess, where rooms directly open to Terrace. The super spacious Hot Water Rain Shower in the room was best part(much needed after a hectic day)Apart from daily cleaning and Towel change, the Lobby of the Hostel is very trendy, super vibrant and lovely place to sit in. Having the key as an Bar-code is also super helpful, which eliminates the burden of carrying the Plastic Key Card everywhere. The Staff is also very helpful. Experience is much superior to the generic crowded hostel. Everything feels really exclusive. Tribunal Metro is right outside the Hostel..20 meters. Tribunal is also is on the Direct Line from Atocha Madrid Station, from where Renfe Trains can taken to various nearby cities Barcelona/Valencia/ Toledo etc, which makes travel very convenient. If you are arriving/traveling via train in Madrid...forget everything and take the Metro. The Location of the Hostel is very central, walking distance to everywhere.Gran Via - 7-8 mins WakSol - 12-13 Mins WalkBiggest of Zara, H&Ms, SFhera , Casinos are within 5-7 min walk from the Hostel.We even walked all the way to Mayor's Plaza / Madrid Palace.Apart from daily cleaning and Towel change, the Lobby of the Hostel is very trendy, super vibrant and lovely place to sit in. Having the key as an Bar-code is also super helpful, which eliminates the burden of carrying the Plastic Key Card everywhere.Will definitely recommend this place to stay when you are in Madrid
hotelName:
90    Bastardo Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Dear Bastardo Hostel,I am ambivalent with my evaluation!The really intelligent furnishing of the 6-bed rooms allows a maximum degree of privacy for a multi-bed room. This has been a great success and I have never experienced it like this in a hostel before! The sanitary facilities in the rooms are very clean, and there is even a rain shower. In addition to the shampoo provided in the showers, soaps on the washbasins would be desirable. If one does not intend to provide for oneself during one's stay, I would recommend the hostel to 100%. There are many leisure activities, such as yoga classes, and the bar and restaurant are lovingly run.However, I think it's a pity that, besides the generous design in the "commercial" areas, the kitchen for the guests is very neglected. It is located in the basement, which means: no windows! And there is no stove. Even if its existence is not officially claimed on the website, at least my definition of a kitchen includes a stove, and two microwaves are not enough. I therefore think that the description on the website is misleading. The ambience of the "Kitchenette" doesn't invite you to stay and have a cosy meal! The black wall paint and neon tubes make you feel more like being in an interrogation room. Since at the time of my stay on the beautiful roof terrace there was no restaurant service, one could sit down there on the floor for a snack, which was very nice. But without this possibility, as a self-caterer, one has few possibilities.As I said, I am ambivalent. On the one hand, the hostel is suitable for both long and short stays, young and old people, picky and less picky guests due to the good furnishings and equipment. Only if you like to cook fresh yourself, you have to live with deductions.But all in all: a joyful stay!
hotelName:
90    Bastardo Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very trendy and it's like everything in one place. You got a comfort bed, a bar downstairs, a rooftop, a good music, a perfect laundry section and full of shops and restaurants nearby. Metro is 2 mins walk. Security is exceptional as everything controlled by your phone.
hotelName:
90    Bastardo Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My experience at Bastardos Hostal completely fulfilled my expectations even more it surpassed them! Guys at the check-in table were very helpful and collaborative; the room was neat and the bed spacious and comfortable even with your own spot to keep your stuff locked and safe. Totally recommend it and off course will definitely come back in the future
hotelName:
90    Bastardo Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: On a quiet street in Madrid that you'd miss if you weren't looking for it is this gem of a hotel. Beautiful place with well-appointed rooms, super comfortable beds, room to spread out. The staff is unfailingly excellent. We had cocktails at the bar a few times (highly recommend La Mula) and enjoyed every minute. It's in the literary part of town, which is also a delight (Calle de Cervantes, por ejemplo.)
hotelName:
56    Gran Hotel Ingles
91    Gran Hotel Ingles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Surprising. We only stay for one night and it's amazing how the staff can make you feel better than in your own home; the difference: it's a great luxury home. Prince, Almudena, Giulia and David welcomed us, gave us advice and said goodbye as if we were close for life. The reception in the hands of Isabel, Anabel and Sara was an absolute attention to any detail that we might need to have a more comfortable stay. The room service is impeccable, detailed and tidy. In the Lobo 8 restaurant we were lucky enough to be recommended by Chef Angelo and pastry chef Sergio, who would define the gastronomic concept as modern, personal, high quality and careful with the product. The restaurant service was very professional for the detailed description of each of the elaborations that served us as well as the concern for food intolerances. Alejandro, Raul, María and Marta serve you at breakfast and in the restaurant as pure lovers of their trade, they transmit their love for what they do. Lobbyto Cocktail Bar is the space of the lobby of the hotel converted into a spectacular cocktail of the 20s United States at a price more than fair for the quality of the signature cocktails of the hand of Mike and Fabri.Finally I prefer that you experience on your own the comfort, quality and luxury of the rooms and each of the details that are throughout the hotel. We'll be back next month yes or yes! Thank you Gran Hotel Inglés!
hotelName:
56    Gran Hotel Ingles
91    Gran Hotel Ingles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I returned last night from Madrid. We stayed in Gran Hotel Ingles for four nights and had a lovely time. The hotel is centrally located and in walking distance from a lot of hot spots.What makes it stand out is the staff who provided lots of nice personal touchea and made us feel special.For example, we received a handwritten welcome note in our room and later another note offering a spa discount.When I was disappointed by the shumai in the lobby restaurant, not only were the waiters apologetic and took the food off the bill, they later delivered chocolate cake to our room. It was a nice touch.When we told the manager how fabulous one of the concierge staff was (she got the Netflix adapter working and helped us watch TV in English), they later sent up two bottles of Coke Light, our beverage of choice with two glasses of ice. It was sweet that they noticed what beverage we liked and appreciated our compliment.Overall, we had a great stay here.
hotelName:
56    Gran Hotel Ingles
91    Gran Hotel Ingles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for 5 nights this September. I really liked our room which was located at the second floor and facing the small street in front of the hotel. I love the design of this boutique hotel.All of the staff were really helpful and properly trained. My Rating :Ambiance - 5 out of 5Service - 5 out of 5Food Quality - 5 out of 5Cleanliness - 5 out of 5Price Points - 5 out of 5
hotelName:
56    Gran Hotel Ingles
91    Gran Hotel Ingles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 4 nights, best indicator of how well located the hotel is that we didnt use a bus or taxi once. Room was very nice with very comfortable bed and great facilities. Staff were very friendly and attentive without being overbearing. Provided some very nice touches to make my sister's 50th Birthday that bit more special.
hotelName:
56    Gran Hotel Ingles
91    Gran Hotel Ingles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for one night and thought the hotel was excellent! Perfect location - central but on a quiet side street. Walking distance to the Prado museum and many other attractions. It is a luxury hotel with very helpful and friendly staff, from the man who checked us in to the concierge to the restaurant and bar people. The lobby is spacious, elegant and comfortable with a variety of places to sit and have a drink or just rest for a minute. The room was tastefully decorated with many amenities and comforts, and it all appears to be recently remodeled or new. We loved this hotel and would definitely return when we have more time to explore Madrid.
hotelName:
56    Gran Hotel Ingles
91    Gran Hotel Ingles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We could not have had a nicer stay in Madrid than at the Gran Hotel Ingles. I cannot say enough about how wonderful the staff was. From the first time we entered the hotel and got a hearty greeting from the doorman (well, really every time...), to check-in when our room was ready despite arriving quite early, the excellent service in the lobby bar, and the wonderful concierge who helped us with restaurant reservations and helped us sort out our train reservations that somehow went awry, the staff really made our stay great. The hotel is beautiful and well, truly luxurious. Our room was an absolute dream. I would absolutely stay at the Gran Hotel Ingles again in the future.
hotelName:
56    Gran Hotel Ingles
91    Gran Hotel Ingles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
