review_body: We had such a wonderful time at the Gran Hotel Ingles. The staff are so friendly and work all very professional and are very focused on every detail. A truly 5 star hotel! We loved the full experience! We will definitely return! Keep up the great job!
hotelName:
56    Gran Hotel Ingles
91    Gran Hotel Ingles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A wonderful warm greeting when we arrived very early. Our beautiful room was quiet with a decadent bath. Perfect location in a quiet street with very little traffic. Delicious, fresh breakfast in a delightful dining room with expert and friendly service from Emanuella and others. This is without doubt the most delightful hotel we have stayed in for many years. It is the staff that make it so special. Everyone without exception - from reception to wait staff to bar staff and housekeeping - were all genuinely enthusiastic and keen to help make our stay so special. They all appeared to really enjoy their work and it showed. Some of the special people we came across were Lorena, Anabel, Julio, Jorge and Emanuella. Bravo to all of you! I hope we can return to Madrid soon and we would not consider staying anywhere else.
hotelName:
56    Gran Hotel Ingles
91    Gran Hotel Ingles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located just 50m from Main Gran Via road , this hotel is at the heart of the city. Many amenities around the hotel , restaurants , supermarkets , shopping , etc. However , the rooms are really small with a relatively large bathroom and toilet. We booked a room for 4 that comes with a bunk bed. It probably can accommodate another max 2 luggages , otherwise , you will have to close your luggages as there is no space in the room. The sound proofing of the room is terribly bad. Our room is located just next to the house keeping store room and every morning , you will be awakened by the noise created when they start work. This is very annoying. I wouldn’t say that this is a good value for money as we pay almost USD200 a night.
hotelName:
92    Petit Palace Tres Cruces
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is part of the Petit Palace Chain. There are many in Madrid. This one represents good vale and good service. Nice breakfast available, somewhat pricey.Rooms are small and spartan. Just the basics. We felt that the neighborhood was rough Lots of homeless on the street. Garbage strewn all over. Left us with an uncomfortable feeling.
hotelName:
92    Petit Palace Tres Cruces
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights. The location of this hotel was very convenient & well within walking distance of Old Madrid & Bourbon Madrid. The breakfast at the hotel was good & there are many restaurants nearby for dinner. The front desk staff were very friendly & helpful, which was appreciated. The room was clean & the bed was comfortable. The only reason we gave this a 3* is because it’s the tiniest & smallest room in a hotel that we’ve ever stayed in.
hotelName:
92    Petit Palace Tres Cruces
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just back from a stay here found it really good. The staff were fantastic very friendly and helpful. The location is excellent 30seconds from gran via and about 4mins to sol. Rooms were lovely good air con fantastic shower nice comfortable beds. Fantastic value for money.
hotelName:
92    Petit Palace Tres Cruces
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As a traveler who stayed in hotels around the 4 to 5-star neighborhood, I must say I was very impressed with the service of this franchise. Most (not all, unfortunately) of the staff were extremely welcoming and nice. A lot of thanks to Carolina for making it feel like home, It didn’t feel like the over courteous 4-5 Star Service, rather it felt like the staff were our friends, genuinely trying to help us out. The location is great sandwiched between Gran Via and Puerto Del Sol (both very happening places). You could walk there and spend the day in those areas or grab a hop on hop off bus from either area.I was traveling with my sister and we initially booked a room at Petit Palace Del Carmen. The standard room was too small for the both us (this is purely personal preference, the room came with two beds like stated, however, it was a little tight for our liking). We asked for a second standard room but they were fully booked. Fortunately, there was another Petit Palace hotel right next door i.e. Tres Crusces (I know, talk about convenience). Noelia from Del Carmen along with Carolina from Tres Crusces were kind enough to transfer our current room booking to Petit Palace Tres Cruces. This was done with no hassle whatsoever and we got the second vacant room in Tres Cruces. We got two attic rooms at the Tres Crusces. That coupled with the heatwave going on in Europe at the time made the room unbearable. There was only one vacant non-attic room which we took and the next night the second non-attic room became available and Carolina was kind enough to do all the room transfers again.Some downs, the rooms were a little underkept, the A/C Control in my room had a knob missing (it was functional nonetheless), however for a small boutique budget hotel, there should be some scope of tolerance. The big downside for me though was Roberto in the front desk. As a paying customer, I have never been to a hotel where the staff shrugs at my requests. When my sister asked him to relocate my room the first night, he shrugged and said, "Well, we are fully booked, I don't know what you want me to do". When I asked whether the hotel gives complimentary water he shrugged and said: "Well, if you want water, you have to buy it". Yes, hotel policies might be in place, but when you shrug and phrase your sentences in such a negative way, it makes the paying guest feel very frustrated. Granted, after a bit of nagging, he did help me out by giving me a fan in the attic room on my first night. I expected a little better service, even for a budget hotel.As far as budget hotels go, this is a really great option with mostly great staff. If you’re into the 4-5 Star hotel experience, this is not the hotel for you.
hotelName:
92    Petit Palace Tres Cruces
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located in a very central location 2 minutes from Sol and from the Gran via, you can do everything by footThe room was small not enough place for 2 sutecases The breakfast was excelent with a lot of optionesWe will defenatly come again
hotelName:
92    Petit Palace Tres Cruces
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed in March 2019 and we enjoyed our stay. The room was decent size for European standards, and updated. We had a bit of trouble with the AC and the shower let water out. The breakfast was very tasty. Dining room and front desk staff were friendly and helpful. Location was fabulous - close to nightlife and the sights.
hotelName:
92    Petit Palace Tres Cruces
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is situated in the centre of Madrid. The musea, the royal palace, in fact all the things you have to see in Madrid are on walking distance. The rooms of the hotel are nice and clean. The bathroom is very efficiënt. And the staff of the hotel is very friendly and helpful.
hotelName:
92    Petit Palace Tres Cruces
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good location. Hotel personal is excellent . Rooms are small, but who cares if we spent all our time in the city and need to come for the night. Good for money. I would recommend the hotel. My rating is 3.5.
hotelName:
92    Petit Palace Tres Cruces
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights with my mum & sister on our annual city break. Hotel is very clean & a great location. 15/20 minute straight walk into the centre (that’s at a average pace - we aren’t fast walkers) hotel staff are super friendly & so helpful. Metro station is just over the road so we got a tube from the airport which was very easy to do & super cheap! Taxi is only €30 if you prefer to or from the airport. If I visit Madrid again I would definitely return to this hotel!
hotelName:
93    Hotel Puerta de Toledo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Having just spent five nights in the hotel Puerta de Toledo I would be very happy to stay there again. It is in a good location as the entrance to the metro is very close by. Our room and the rest of the hotel were all kept in excellent condition, and the staff were very helpful and pleasant. The buffet breakfast is good.
hotelName:
93    Hotel Puerta de Toledo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is great! Staff is super friendly and helpful. We had a question for them every time we went through the lobby... from where to catch a bus to the location of the nearest laundromat, and they were always kind, patient and helpful.Rooms were clean and comfortable. The breakfast was good- lots to choose from.Wonderful location-close to Metro and walking distance to many sights.We will definitely stay here next time we are in Madrid.
hotelName:
93    Hotel Puerta de Toledo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely experience.Rooms small but otherwise good.Reception and bar staff really very very good.Sadly breakfast staff not likewise and the modest breakfast very average.The plates are cold and the 'Hot' food too need microwaving.Found generally in Madrid that cold plates are the norm for hot food.However ,hotel ideal for a city break with taxis outside always available.Beds good.
hotelName:
93    Hotel Puerta de Toledo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had comfortable stay for 3 nightsRooms were clean, comfortableStaff were very friendly and efficientLocation is very good. it is a 15 minute walk to Plaza Mayor and also the metro station is just outside the hotelThe only areas of improvement are:Noise from adjacent rooms was audibleBreakfast spread was ok but quality could be improved
hotelName:
93    Hotel Puerta de Toledo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Close to metro station and stumbling distance to local cafes where you can get basic food and cheap drinks. Comfortable and spacious accomodation which has a bar ( can obtain snacks). The buffet breakfast is very good - plenty of choise of cold and hot food. We were on 3rd floor which was quiet and had all basic needs covered.
hotelName:
93    Hotel Puerta de Toledo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 1 night, the room was big enough to open-up 2 medium size luggage and the bed was comfy. My only concern was the shower, I think this is very common in Spain that they don't have drapes in the shower so when you take shower the water goes out and the whole floor gets wet but other than that no complains.
hotelName:
93    Hotel Puerta de Toledo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I recently spent a week here and found the hotel to be comfortable and the staff excellent.As a solo traveler, I ended up in a tiny tiny room, but you don't go to Madrid to stay in your hotel room. The room was comfortable to sleep in and the included internet allowed me to plan out my adventures.As I arrived early, I wasn't able to check in right away and there were facilities for safe and secure storage of my baggage. Staff was also unsurprised and helpful when I couldn't figure out how to turn on the lights in the room. It seems that my room key needed to be put in to a device just inside the room to turn on the power. Clever, but unexpected. I've not encountered that before.The front desk staff was also helpful in working with my tour provider passing on vouchers and advising me of any messages. As a non-Spanish speaker I was pleased that there was always someone there who was fluent in English.The bed was comfortable and even though I had an inner room it faced on to a central courtyard and there was good natural light. I did find the small shower stall floor a bit slippery but it was small so there was no real danger of injury.If you don't want to use the hotel lounge there are cafes close by. The included breakfast in the lower floor was quite varied and allowed me to easily fuel up for a day of exploring.There is a subway stop just a block away so if you aren't up to walking the hilly streets of Madrid to get to where you want, you can easily get everywhere by transit.From my base here, I was able to go visit the Prado and Royal Palace, both within an hour's walk for me - but I'm an active pedestrian. I enjoyed just also wandering around the various neighbourhoods.
hotelName:
93    Hotel Puerta de Toledo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Hotel Puerta de Toledo is situated at the edge of the busy and potentially noisy areas of Madrid but is only a twenty minute walk to the exciting and vibrant Plaza de Mayor which is as close to the centre of Madrid as you can get. The hotel itself is listed as a three star but in my opinion it is closer to at least a three and a half star.From the moment you walk into the hotel you notice a lively but ordered atmosphere in clean and modern surroundings, reception and check in are well organised and the rooms are extremely well furnished and very clean, plus our room was larger than I normally expect from a three star hotel. If you do not want to walk to your chosen sights in Madrid then about two hundred meters from the hotel is a metro station which not only allows easy, quick and cheap transport around Madrid but also can take you to and from Madrid airport.In addition to walking and the metro there is also an excellent public bus network with stops within fifty meters of the hotel. I would recommend buying a Madrid transport card which can be used on most methods of public transport and you choose what value to put onto the card and you can add additional monies as and when required, this card makes travelling much easier and I believe that it also works out cheaper. After the first busy and exhausting day sightseeing we returned to the hotel and had a great nights sleep in a very comfortable bed and a silent room, the double glazing was excellent along with the lack of noise from other rooms and corridors. After rising and showering we made our way down to the breakfast area to be greeted with the biggest selection of differing and tasty foods that I have ever been presented with for breakfast. Allow yourself to enjoy as many dishes as possible, self service, before setting out again to see the sights of Madrid. We allowed ourselves a five night break to take in Madrid but will need to return as there is so much to see, when we do return we intend to stay at the Hotel Puerta de Toledo again,
hotelName:
93    Hotel Puerta de Toledo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
